Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Request for Goodwill Removal of Late Payment Dear Sir/Madam, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to request your consideration in removing late payments from my credit report for the accounts listed below. I have been a responsible and timely payer overall, and I sincerely regret the oversight that caused the late payment in question. 

Account Information : XXXX XXXX : # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : # XXXX The late payments occurred due to a XXXX XXXX XXXX I was dealing with during that time. This condition caused unexpected XXXX  XXXX  that made it difficult for me to manage my financial responsibilities. While I fully understand the importance of making payments on time, my primary focus during that period was on recovering my health, which caused a delay in my payment processing. 

Since then, I have made every effort to get my finances back on track, and I have ensured that all my payments are up to date. I deeply value my credit and am committed to maintaining a good payment history moving forward. 

As a loyal customer, I kindly request your assistance in removing these late payments from my credit report as a gesture of goodwill. I believe this removal would more accurately reflect my overall creditworthiness and my commitment to fulfilling my financial obligations. 

I greatly appreciate your time and understanding, and I look forward to hearing from you regarding this request. If you require any additional information or documentation, please feel free to contact me. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Re : FCRA Section 605C Consumer Submission of Dispute for Identity Theft and Human XXXX  Victimization To Whom It May Concern, I, XXXX XXXX, am writing to inform you that I am a victim of both identity theft and human XXXX. Due to these crimes, unauthorized accounts, fraudulent inquiries, and incorrect personal information have been added to my credit report. As a result, I am requesting the immediate removal of the below-listed accounts, inquiries, and addresses in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 605C. 
I have filed a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report, and the following fraudulent accounts, addresses, and inquiries were opened or associated with my name without my knowledge or consent. As part of the remedy under the FCRA and Section 605C, I am submitting this letter for your prompt attention and investigation. 
XXXX. Fraudulent Accounts to Be Removed : The following unauthorized accounts were opened under my name : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ), Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Secured Loan XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Secured Loan No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account XXXX. Fraudulent Addresses to Be Removed : The following unauthorized addresses are falsely associated with my name and must be removed from my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX. Unauthorized Inquiries to Be Removed : The following unauthorized credit inquiries were made without my permission and should be removed from my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Mo XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX Legal Basis for Dispute : In accordance with FCRA Section 605C, I am requesting the removal of the above items due to the identity theft and human trafficking I have suffered. These violations infringe on my right to privacy and accuracy under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including : 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Section 602 A ) : The right to privacy of consumer information.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Section 604 A, Section 2 ) : A consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without written instructions from the consumer.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : Consumer reporting agencies can not report adverse information older than seven years, except for criminal convictions.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) : A person shall not furnish inaccurate information to a consumer reporting agency.

Action Requested : In compliance with the FCRA Section 605C, I request the immediate removal of the fraudulent accounts, addresses, and inquiries from my credit report. Additionally, please conduct a thorough investigation and send me written confirmation of the actions taken.

Please respond to this matter within 30 days, as required by law. Failure to do so may result in legal action being taken against the responsible parties. I am requesting a copy of my updated credit report after the removal of the fraudulent information. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Incorrect Information on Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my credit report. These errors, as furnished by the creditors listed below, violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I am requesting the CFPBs assistance to ensure these matters are thoroughly investigated and that the information is corrected or removed if it can not be substantiated.

Disputed Accounts and Issues 1. XXXX  XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) Issue : The account is reported as a charge-off with {$460.00} written off and past due as of XX/XX/XXXX. These details appear inconsistent with my payment history and balance updates. 

Request : Verify the payment history, balance, and charge-off status. Remove or correct any discrepancies if substantiation is lacking. 

XXXX. XXXX ( Account XXXX. XXXX ) Issue : The account is listed as repossessed with an {$8100.00} balance past due. However, the payment history and status updates are unclear and inconsistent with my records. 

On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I was involved in a severe car accident while completing a XXXX delivery. The vehicle was rear-ended, causing serious neck and back injuries that left me unable to work or generate income. The car remained at the repair facility for approximately XXXX months while the at-fault partys insurance processed the claim and handled repairs. 

During this time, I contacted XXXX Customer Service to explain my situation and request assistance due to these extenuating circumstances. Despite my efforts to keep them informed, XXXX attempted to repossess the vehicle from the repair facility. I managed to make a payment to delay the repossession temporarily, but the vehicle was ultimately repossessed in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Request : XXXX. Validate the reported payment history, repossession status, and balance. 

XXXX. Provide documentation detailing the accounts payment history, repossession procedures, and any charges or balances resulting from the repossession. 

XXXX. Remove or correct any inaccuracies or unverifiable information in compliance with the FCRA. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) Issue : The account reflects a past due balance of {$80.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, alongside delinquencies that do not align with my records. 

Request : Investigate and verify the reported payment history and past due amounts. Remove unverifiable information. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is listed as charged-off with {$220.00} past due. However, prior dispute attempts have not resolved discrepancies in the payment history or charge-off details. 

Request : Reinvestigate and correct any errors in the charge-off or payment records. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is inaccurately listed as a charge-off. Additionally, I have never signed an agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX. My original contract was with XXXX XXXX XXXX, and there is no documentation proving my obligation to XXXX. 

Request : 1. Confirm the accuracy of the charge-off status, payment history, and balance.

2. Remove unverifiable information, as required under : 15 USC 1666b : Billing error correction.

15 USC 1681i : Credit reporting dispute requirements.

15 USC 1681s-2 : Obligations of furnishers to report accurate data.

UCC 9, Part 6 : Repossession compliance.

Summary of Concerns Many of these accounts reference prior disputes that failed to produce conclusive evidence or rectifications. The inaccuracies harm my credit profile and fail to meet the FCRAs requirements for accurate, complete, and verifiable reporting.

Requested Actions 1. Ensure each disputed account is thoroughly reinvestigated.

2. Remove or correct any unverifiable or inaccurate information.

3. Require furnishers to provide documentation supporting their reporting or correct the records as necessary.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please keep me updated on the progress of your investigation and any actions taken to resolve these disputes. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Re : FCRA Section 605C Consumer Submission of Dispute for Identity Theft and XXXX XXXX Victimization To Whom It May Concern, I, XXXX XXXX, am writing to inform you that I am a victim of both identity theft and XXXX  XXXX. Due to these crimes, unauthorized accounts, fraudulent inquiries, and incorrect personal information have been added to my credit report. As a result, I am requesting the immediate removal of the below-listed accounts, inquiries, and addresses in compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), Section 605C. 
I have filed a Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) Identity Theft Report, and the following fraudulent accounts, addresses, and inquiries were opened or associated with my name without my knowledge or consent. As part of the remedy under the FCRA and Section 605C, I am submitting this letter for your prompt attention and investigation. 
XXXX. Fraudulent Accounts to Be Removed : The following unauthorized accounts were opened under my name : XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX ), Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Secured Loan XXXX XXXX XXXX, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Secured Loan No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account No Name Found, Account # : XXXX, Opened : XX/XX/XXXX, Collection Account XXXX. Fraudulent Addresses to Be Removed : The following unauthorized addresses are falsely associated with my name and must be removed from my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX XXXX. Unauthorized Inquiries to Be Removed : The following unauthorized credit inquiries were made without my permission and should be removed from my credit report : XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX Date XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX, Date : XX/XX/XXXX Legal Basis for Dispute : In accordance with FCRA Section 605C, I am requesting the removal of the above items due to the identity theft and human trafficking I have suffered. These violations infringe on my right to privacy and accuracy under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, including : 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Section 602 A ) : The right to privacy of consumer information.

15 U.S.C. 1681 ( Section 604 A, Section 2 ) : A consumer reporting agency can not furnish an account without written instructions from the consumer.

15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ) : Consumer reporting agencies can not report adverse information older than seven years, except for criminal convictions.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) : A person shall not furnish inaccurate information to a consumer reporting agency.

Action Requested : In compliance with the FCRA Section 605C, I request the immediate removal of the fraudulent accounts, addresses, and inquiries from my credit report. Additionally, please conduct a thorough investigation and send me written confirmation of the actions taken.

Please respond to this matter within 30 days, as required by law. Failure to do so may result in legal action being taken against the responsible parties. I am requesting a copy of my updated credit report after the removal of the fraudulent information. 
Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, PA XXXX Subject : Request for Goodwill Removal of Late Payment Dear XXXX, I hope this letter finds you well. I am writing to request your consideration in removing late payments from my credit report for the accounts listed below. I have been a responsible and timely payer overall, and I sincerely regret the oversight that caused the late payment in question. 

Account Information : XXXX XXXX : # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : # XXXX The late payments occurred due to a rare medical condition I was dealing with during that time. This condition caused unexpected health complications that made it difficult for me to manage my financial responsibilities. While I fully understand the importance of making payments on time, my primary focus during that period was on recovering my health, which caused a delay in my payment processing. 

Since then, I have made every effort to get my finances back on track, and I have ensured that all my payments are up to date. I deeply value my credit and am committed to maintaining a good payment history moving forward. 

As a loyal customer, I kindly request your assistance in removing these late payments from my credit report as a gesture of goodwill. I believe this removal would more accurately reflect my overall creditworthiness and my commitment to fulfilling my financial obligations. 

I greatly appreciate your time and understanding, and I look forward to hearing from you regarding this request. If you require any additional information or documentation, please feel free to contact me. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate, misleading, and potentially unlawful reporting regarding my XXXX  XXXX account that is being furnished to Experian XXXX in XXXX Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified **multiple violations and inconsistencies** under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which require immediate correction. Identified Violations and Inaccuracies 1. **Reporting Incorrect Status with Past Due Balance and Charge-Off** : - The report reflects that the account has been charged off and closed. However, it simultaneously lists a **past due amount** of ** $ XXXX as of XXXX XXXX. - A charged-off account indicates that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible. Per FCRA guidelines, any charged-off balance can not remain reported as past due, as this misrepresents the current status of the debt. XXXX. **Future-Dated Entries** : - The report reflects contradictory **future dates** ( e.g., Status Updated : XX/XX/year>, Balance Updated : XX/XX/year> ). These dates are impossible because this report was generated in XXXX XXXX. Reporting future activity is inaccurate, misleading, and violates the FCRAs requirement for fair and accurate reporting. 3. **Credit Usage at 118 % ** : - The report states that my credit usage is **118 % **, which is mathematically incorrect because the credit limit is reported as ** $ XXXX while the current balance is ** $ XXXX. This reflects inaccuracies in balance calculation or credit usage reporting. 4. **Ambiguity in Comments and Dispute Resolution** : - The comments indicate the account was previously in dispute investigation complete. However, no documentation or outcome of the investigation was provided to me, violating my right to a proper investigation under FCRA Section 611. 5. **Multiple Reporting Violations** : - **Incorrect Balance Reporting** : The balance and credit usage appear overstated. - **Duplicate Reporting** : The account balance and past due amount seem to be inconsistently reported across sections. Additional Violations in Payment History Reporting 1. **Future-Dated Late Payments** : - The payment history shows **late payments for XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, and XXXX XXXX. As of todays date in XX/XX/year>, these months have not yet occurred, and future payments can not be accurately reported as late. This constitutes **false and inaccurate reporting** and is a clear violation of FCRA Section 607 ( b ), which mandates maximum possible accuracy. 2. **Inconsistent Reporting with Past Account Status** : - The account has already been charged off and closed as reflected earlier in the report. A charged-off account should not reflect **ongoing monthly late payments**, as the creditor is no longer expecting regular payments. Reporting multiple late payments after the charge-off date is both redundant and misleading. 3. **Adverse Impact on Creditworthiness** : - These inaccuracies in payment history significantly harm my creditworthiness by misrepresenting my financial behavior and account status. Legal Basis for Dispute Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : - **Section 611** requires that disputed information must be investigated and corrected within 30 days. - **Section 607 ( b ) ** requires maximum possible accuracy of information furnished. - **Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ** prohibits furnishers from reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information. - **Section 605 ( a ) ( 5 ) ** prohibits re-aging or reporting obsolete information. The inaccuracies on this report violate these provisions and misrepresent my creditworthiness, causing harm. Requested Action I demand the following : 1. **Immediate investigation** into the inaccurate reporting under FCRA guidelines XXXX 2. **Removal of the account and of the following : - The past due status and amount, as the account is charged off. - Any future-dated entries, as they are impossible and misleading. - The overstated credit usage percentage and balance inconsistencies. - Inaccurate payment history reporting for future months and redundant late payments post-charge-off. 3. **Documentation** of the investigation results and verification of all corrected information. Failure to Comply If you fail to address these inaccuracies within the 30-day timeframe required by law, I will escalate this matter with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) and explore all available legal remedies under the FCRA. I have enclosed a copy of the credit report, including the **payment history**, for your reference. Please respond to this dispute promptly.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX and Experian are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. XXXX and Experian are reporting adverse items on my XXXX & XXXX account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. XXXX and Experian are reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. XXXX and Experian are also reporting a charge off which according to the IRS publication 4681, a charge off is considered income and may not be reported as debt. The account has been charged off as witnessed by the report. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. XXXX and Experian do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian and XXXX XXXX XXXX , whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX & XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, XXXX and Experian are the reporting agency and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the financial institution, XXXX and Experian, the consumer reporting agency, DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am opting out of your reporting services for this account.

I have made calls to no avail unable to get a phone number to speak to a human. I don't exactly know how this affects my credit with " access granted ''. I get no answer and just want to know WHY when I definitely locked these two accounts ) they remain accessible. Secondly, there is documentation that I have an account with XXXXXXXX XXXX! I DO NOT HAVE AN ACCOUNT WITH MACYS. When I applied for this account ( XXXX XXXX ) mid XXXX, my accounts were frozen, and I was told I can unfreeze. I didn't bother. I do not have an account to XXXX so why is it on my credit listings. This too I am just noticing it. It is blocked and can't be unlocked! I am somewhat XXXX now regarding this complaint in that at first it did not accept my instituting a new password and I believe my privacy for CFPB has been violated ( I have email prviacy address ), and I believe two accounts for CFPB has been created! 
Becaue I can't reach a human being, I am rquesting a written response to my concerns regarding mention of XXXX XXXX ( which I have NO account ) and why two accounts XXXX  XXXX ( I can't tell if it's my XXXX  account or XXXX ) but I am unable to access I tried to file a disupte and the approprate page would not show up XXXX my computer ( another concern ). So I am prevented from filing a dispute ( I will continue to try ) However I did apply for XXXX XXXX mid XXXX and told my credit report was frozen, so why is XXXXXXXX XXXX showing as a account on Experian report. Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom it Concerns, Currently, You are reporting inaccurate and incomplete data in regards to the below noted student loan account ( s ). I demand that you contact the Reporting Data Provider ( s ), as I have already done, and demand a validation of the debt ( of course they can't provide the statement at this time ). Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act section 1681c2. Block of information resulting from identity theft they must ( a ) Block Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

Remove the Inquiries, but because they are using a call center out of the country their agents are refusing to comply with the Federal Trade Commission and the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I was advised that they do not have to follow the law and that they have their own internal policy that they will follow. I am requesting that they remove all the fraudulent inquiries from my credit report other than XXXX XXXX and that they send me an updated copy of my credit report. Consumer complaint narrative:
I am following up on my initial complaint against Experian regarding the unexplained XXXX reduction in my credit score ( Complaint ID : XXXX ). Despite filing a formal dispute with Experian, they responded with the message : ITEM ALREADY MATCHES THE DISPUTE REQUEST. This response is vague, dismissive, and does not address my concerns about why my score dropped from XXXX to XXXX despite no negative activity being reported. 

The score reduction appears to stem from a Positive Activity : Loan Paid update from XXXX XXXX, which does not justify such a significant decrease. Furthermore : XXXX XXXX confirmed the loan was paid in full and reported positively. 
Experians handling of this matter lacks transparency and accountability. 
Their dispute resolution process has failed to provide me with a meaningful explanation or resolution. 

I respectfully request that the CFPB demand a thorough investigation from Experian to : 1. Explain why a XXXX reduction occurred despite no negative credit events. 
2. Verify that the scoring model applied to my file aligns with accurate and complete data.

3. Provide documentation detailing how this score change was calculated. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I hope the CFPB can hold Experian accountable for ensuring accurate credit reporting.

Consumer complaint narrative:
In XXXX, I noticed an unfamiliar/unauthorized/unvalidated account on My Experian credit report named " XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I provided " XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX '' a notice containing the following : " Provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork back to me along with the Affidavit signed in accordance with your 28 United States Code Section 1746 within thirty days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation and proof of claim : i. Alleged Name and Address of Creditor : ii. Name on File of alleged debtor : iii. Alleged Account Number : iv. Amount of alleged debt : v. Date that this alleged debt became payable : vi. Date of original charge off or delinquency : vii. Amount paid if debt was purchased : viii. Please attach a copy of any signed agreement debtor has made with debt collector, or other verifiable proof that debtor has a contractual obligation to pay debt collector ; ix. Furnish a copy of the original promissory note/agreement redacting my social security number to prevent identify theft and state that your client named above is the holder in due course of the note agreement and will produce the original for my own and a judges inspection should there be a trial to contest these matters ; x. Produce the account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation that you are now attempting to collect ; xi. Identify by name and address all persons, corporations, associations, or any other parties having an interest in legal proceedings regarding the alleged debt ; xii. Verify as a third party debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of the alleged debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original maker of the note ; xiii. Verify you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity ; xiv. Verify you know and understand that credit card contracts are a series of continuing offers to contract and as such are non-transferable ; xv. Provide verification from the stated creditor that you are authorized to act for them ; xvi. Verify that you know and understand that contacting me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the debt constitutes the use of interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by advancing a writing, which you know is false with the intention that others rely on the written communication to their detriment a violation of your 18 United States Code Section 1341. And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA. 

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading. 

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or XXXX XXXX XXXX, as required by law. 

Impact of the Violation This accounts unauthorized and inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my creditworthiness, resulting in a lower credit score and negatively affecting my ability to access credit and financial opportunities.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This report highlights the ongoing noncompliance by Experian and XXXX in addressing multiple violations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my repeated disputes and requests, Experian has failed to validate or verify disputed items, provide necessary documentation substantiating alleged debts, and address unauthorized credit inquiries on my report. This has been happening since XXXX XXXX XXXX and I have not been receiving proof within the 30-day period or at all. I would have to check online without proof that things had been validated. 

I am also attaching letter that I have request for proof of permission for hard inquires.

Key Issues Reported : Failure to reinvestigate disputed items within the legally required 30-day period, as mandated under 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ).

Lack of evidence proving my legal obligation to pay alleged debts, contrary to FCRA and IRS Code requirements under 26 U.S.C. 6050P.

Unauthorized hard credit inquiries without my explicit written consent, violating permissible purpose requirements outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( a ).

These actions have caused significant damage to my creditworthiness, financial opportunities, and emotional well-being. I demand immediate resolution, including : Removal of all inaccurate and unverifiable information from my credit report.

Written confirmation of these corrections.

Compensation for the harm caused, as permitted by the FCRA.

If these issues are not addressed, I will pursue legal action under the FCRA and FDCPA and report the violations to the FTC, CFPB, and my state Attorney General.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> EXPERIAN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 USC Dear Experian, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing.

Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification.

3. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law.

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

However all other attempts at reaching Bank of America customer service have failed. I have attempted to call their multiple phone numbers listed on their website or the back of other debit or credit cards I hold with them ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ). None have worked. Nor can I submit a written request or complaint on their site as nowhere do they list a customer support email address to contact. I am traveling currently and am not able to go into a branch location during business hours. I simply need to make get ahold of a customer service representative to report the card lost and request a replacement be mailed. This is a simple request, one I have easily made with other credit card issuer companies- XXXX, XXXX XXXX- on multiple occasions. With Bank of America, this simple request is impossible. I've attempted for more than two hours and have given up. Their credit cards business clearly does not have the safety and security of their customers in mind.

Subject : Dispute on Removal of Fraudulent Information on credit report in Violation of 15 US Code 1681C-2.

I am writing to dispute fraudulent information on my credit report pursuant to 15 USC 1681c-2 and to request that this information be blocked. I have enclosed a copy of my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 US.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days.

To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : ACCOUNT NUMBER ACCOUNT DATE OPENED. 

1- XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> As required by 15 USC 1601c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report Immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point I may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent Information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and Experian has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mina, so I require you to send me all the documentation to prove that this information is accurate. I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report. According to my credit report, XXXX XXXX has listed certain accounts as charged off. However, I have concrete documentation proving that these loans are not in default, and this claim is false. This misinformation has caused undue harm to my credit score and is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Ohio state laws. 

Details of the Disputed Accounts : Creditor : XXXX XXXX Account Number ( s ) : n/a Reported Status : Charged Off Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Reporting an account as charged off when it has not defaulted constitutes false reporting, which is prohibited under this law. Moreover, Ohios consumer protection laws also mandate that creditors and credit bureaus must report information fairly and accurately, per Ohio Revised Code Section 1345.02, which prohibits unfair and deceptive practices. 

Additionally, in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ), the courts reinforced the obligation of credit reporting agencies to conduct reasonable investigations when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Reporting a charge-off inaccurately violates this precedent and further illustrates a failure to uphold proper investigative standards. 

To support my dispute, I have attached the following documents : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
2. Documentation proving that my XXXX XXXX loans are not in default. 
3. [ Any additional evidence, such as account statements or correspondence with XXXX XXXX. ] I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] investigate this matter promptly and delete the inaccurate charge-off entries from my credit report. Failure to address and correct this issue may leave me no choice but to seek legal remedies under the FCRA and Ohio consumer protection laws. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and expect a written response within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This is a formal complaint regarding inaccurate and unlawful reporting of late payments on charged-off accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX These errors are in direct violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which mandates maximum possible accuracy in consumer credit reports. 

I. INACCURATE REPORTING Late Payments on Charged-Off Accounts : It is widely established that once an account is charged off, reporting additional late payments is not permissible. Despite this, the aforementioned creditors have continued to report late payments after charging off the accounts. This practice is both inaccurate and misleading.

Violation : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), credit reporting agencies must ensure the maximum possible accuracy of information included in consumer reports. 

Permissible Purpose : I do not give written consent for XXXX, Experian, or XXXX to report these accounts or my personal information further. The reporting of these accounts without my consent constitutes an additional violation of the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which restricts the circumstances under which consumer information may be disclosed.

II. FAILURE TO RESPOND TO DISPUTES I have previously disputed these accounts, and the credit reporting agencies failed to respond within the required 30-day period as stipulated by 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ). This non-compliance places your agencies in direct violation of the FCRA.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX., 115 F.3d 220 ( 3d Cir. 1997 ) : Credit reporting agencies are liable for failing to ensure maximum possible accuracy of consumer information. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : Reinforces liability for inaccurate reporting under the FCRA. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : Agencies must conduct a reasonable investigation upon receiving a dispute. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Establishes consumers right to challenge inaccuracies in credit reports. 

XXXX v. XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Agencies duty to investigate disputed items thoroughly.

I received notice that you verified certain items on my credit report from the following companies : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Please tell me how you did that. Who did you talk to at the original credit grantor? Did you write them? Was a XXXX form used or was this through electronic automatic dispute verification? Don't provide the generic response of how you use various methods. Tell me exactly how you verified them and include the full name of the person you spoke with. 

Also, what is the date of the commencement of delinquency? The original creditor is required to give that to you. So when is that? And when will this trade-line be past the reporting timeframe? Don't provide the generic " 7 years '' response ; I am aware of that. Tell me specifically when these accounts allegedly became delinquent, and specifically when they will be removed. Some of these accounts are reporting as charged off as well as being included in bankruptcy. So, which is it? 

Supply your response within 15 days or delete the trade-lines.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Experian Back Office Team, I am responding to your recent refusal to comply with my FTC Identity Theft Report and supporting documentation, which is in clear violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ( FCRA Section 605B ). Your rejection of my rightful request to block unauthorized items is unlawful, baseless, and constitutes a willful disregard for my consumer, civil, and constitutional rights. 
statement that the FTC Identity Theft Report must be filed with a law enforcement agency to be valid. This statement is incorrect and represents a misinterpretation of federal law, specifically the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), and I urge you to review the applicable regulations governing identity theft and consumer rights. 
The Law Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, there is no requirement that an FTC Identity Theft Report be filed with any law enforcement agency for it to be valid. According to this law : 1. Section 1681c-2 ( b ) : A consumer only needs to submit an FTC Identity Theft Report to the credit reporting agency , which is sufficient to block fraudulent information on the credit report. The FTC Identity Theft Report is designed to be used directly by consumers to challenge fraudulent entries on their credit reports without needing any additional action by law enforcement. 
2. No Police Report Requirement : The law does not require a police report in addition to the FTC report. The FTC Identity Theft Report itself is the essential document in resolving fraud-related credit report disputes. The consumer has the legal right to use this document to ensure that fraudulent information is blocked from their credit file within four business days as per FCRA 1681c-2 ( b ).

By claiming that the FTC report must be filed with law enforcement, you are infringing upon my rights and misapplying the law. Your refusal to accept the FTC Identity Theft Report without further law enforcement action is a direct violation of my rights under 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which requires you to investigate disputes and ensure the accuracy of the information on my credit report. 

I have been patiently and diligently adhering to my rights as a consumer, providing you with all the necessary documentation to correct the unauthorized information on my credit report. Despite my repeated efforts, including sending you my FTC Identity Theft Report, proof of address, my drivers license, Social Security card, and other forms of identification, my request for removal of fraudulent information remains unaddressed. I have made every reasonable attempt to resolve this matter, ensuring that all documents were submitted correctly and promptly. Yet, you continue to refuse to take any action. 
It is abundantly clear that Experian is intentionally disregarding my rights as a consumer, which is not only unlawful but unethical. Your failure to act, despite receiving all required documentation and my repeated requests, represents a clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681i, which mandates that you investigate and correct inaccuracies on a credit report. Your actions amount to gross negligence at best, and willful disregard of my rights as a consumer at worst. 
The Consequences of Experians Unlawful Actions Your continuous refusal to correct the misrepresented information on my credit report is having an extremely detrimental impact on my financial future. The misrepresentation of my credit report has adversely affected my ability to access credit, secured loans, and any financial opportunities that I am lawfully entitled to as a consumer. The unauthorized entries you refuse to remove are obstructing my right to financial freedom and undermining my economic security. 
By failing to act, you are effectively harming my reputation in the credit system, creating barriers that prevent me from moving forward in a lawful and equitable manner. Your actions are not just an inconveniencethey are actively damaging my ability to participate in the economy, access housing, apply for loans, or even engage in basic financial transactions. These ongoing issues are resulting in unjustified financial harm, and Experians refusal to correct the inaccuracies is making this harm permanent. 
Unlawful Practices and Their Impact on Me The persistent disregard of my due diligence is not only unlawful but constitutes intentional harm. Under FCRA 1681n, your continued failure to address these issues may constitute willful noncompliance, subjecting you to punitive damages and liability for all damages caused by your actions. The law is clear : you are responsible for correcting any inaccuracies and for protecting consumers like myself from fraud and harm. Your refusal to follow the law demonstrates a flagrant disregard for my consumer rights, my constitutional rights, and the legal protections afforded to me under the FCRA. 
Additionally, under FCRA 1681o, your failure to perform a reasonable investigation and take action after being given clear, documented proof of my claims makes you liable for actual damages, legal fees, and potentially punitive damages. 
Experians Repeated Failures and the Severity of These Violations You are well aware that this situation is no longer just a simple disputeit is a pattern of unlawful practices. I have sent equitable letters on numerous occasions, clearly outlining the fraudulent activity, providing documentation of my identity, and even filing an FTC report, all in accordance with the law. Despite this, I am still facing civil penalties and denied my consumer rights through your inaction. Your actions have not only been negligent but appear to be a calculated effort to deny my rightful claims. 
This ongoing violation of my consumer rights has reached a point of no return. Your unwillingness to make necessary corrections has made it clear that Experian has no regard for the financial security and well-being of consumers. These actions directly conflict with the FCRA, and Experians continued failure to comply with the law is causing me direct, measurable harm. 
Your refusal to act is not just a slight inconvenience ; it is an active violation of my constitutional rights, civil rights, and the protections provided by federal law. The misrepresentation of my financial standing is undermining my entire future and represents an ongoing financial injury for which Experian is legally responsible. 



Unauthorized Accounts to Be Removed XXXX. XXXX XXXX  : Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Numbers : XXXX, XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX : Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Account Number : XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Account Number : XXXX Unauthorized Names to Be Removed XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 
should appear on my report. 
Unauthorized Addresses to Be Removed XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX FL XXXX Only XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX XXXX authorized. 



Experians Legal Obligation Under FCRA 1681i, you are legally obligated to investigate disputed information on a consumers credit report. The FTC Identity Theft Report is a valid form of documentation to begin that process, and Experian must take immediate action once it is provided. Your failure to recognize this report and insist upon additional, unlawful requirements constitutes an obstruction of my rights. 
Should you continue to insist that a law enforcement filing is required for an FTC Identity Theft Report to be valid, you are subjecting yourself to further liability under 15 U.S.C. 1681n, which allows for the recovery of damages, attorney fees, and punitive damages for willfully failing to comply with the FCRA. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681o, if this violation is determined to be negligent, you are still liable for actual damages and attorneys fees.

Conclusion I demand that you immediately remove all fraudulent entries from my credit report as required by 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 and 15 U.S.C. 1681i, based on the FTC Identity Theft Report I have already submitted. Any continued refusal to do so will not only violate federal law but also expose Experian to further legal action, including a formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and potential civil litigation for the damages caused by your unlawful actions.

Your attempt to accuse me of a material misrepresentation or error is not only defamatory but also unfounded. An FTC Identity Theft Report, filed under penalty of perjury, is sufficient under federal law to block the disputed information within four business days of receipt. You have failed to comply with this mandate, exposing Experian to legal liability. 
Legal Violations and Case Law 1. Violation of 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 : By failing to block the disputed items, you are in direct violation of the FCRA. Courts have repeatedly ruled that credit reporting agencies can not delay or refuse a proper identity theft claim ( see XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ). 
2. Civil Rights Violation : By holding false and unauthorized information against my will and disregarding my multiple notifications, you are infringing upon my civil rights under 42 U.S.C. 1983, as you are willfully obstructing my right to accurate credit reporting. 
3. Constitutional Right to Privacy : Your continued retention of disputed personal information violates my Fourth Amendment right to privacy by unlawfully holding unauthorized data despite clear notice and demand for removal. 
Personal Accountability of Experians Back Office Team Let this serve as notice that individual accountability will be pursued against Experians back office team. I will take the necessary legal steps to subpoena records that identify the specific employees who handled my case. Per 15 U.S.C. 1681n, Experian and its employees can be held individually liable for willful noncompliance with the FCRA. You should be aware that Experian has faced similar lawsuits, such as : XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX ) - Resulted in {$60.00} XXXX awarded for inaccurate reporting and FCRA violations. 
XXXX v. Experian - Courts have repeatedly affirmed Experians duty to investigate and correct disputed items. 
Demands This letter demands the immediate and permanent removal of the following unauthorized accounts, names, addresses, Failure to comply with this demand within the legally required timeframe will leave me with no choice but to : 1. File a formal civil lawsuit against Experian and its back office team for FCRA violations, defamation, and emotional distress.

2. Pursue legal discovery to identify individual employees responsible for this unlawful conduct.

3. Report Experians willful violations to the CFPB, FTC, and State Attorney General for further investigation and penalties.

Experian has been held accountable in the past, and this situation will be no different. Do not misrepresent federal law or attempt to obstruct my rights again.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Letter of Intent to Sue for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally notify you of my intent to file a lawsuit against Experian for violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically concerning your failure to block and remove inaccurate and fraudulent information from my credit report related to a fraudulent XXXX account. 

As a victim of identity theft, my personal information was unlawfully used to open this fraudulent account. Additionally, my mail was fraudulently redirected to the perpetrator 's address, further exacerbating the situation. Once I discovered these violations, I promptly reported the incident to the police and the U.S. Postal Service to rectify the mail fraud issue. To safeguard my identity, I also enrolled in a credit monitoring system. 

The FCRA mandates that a consumer reporting agency must block reporting of information resulting from identity theft within four ( 4 ) business days of receiving proper notification from the affected consumer. I have complied with all requirements under the FCRA, including submitting : An identity theft report filed with the FTC, Proper identification. 
Despite meeting all legal obligations and formally notifying Experian of the fraudulent XXXX account, more than four business days have passed, and this account remains on my credit report. This non-compliance violates the FCRA, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2, which explicitly outlines the process and timeline for blocking such information. 

Moreover, I have identified additional inaccuracies in how this account is reported. The address associated with the XXXX account is not mine and is not listed on my credit report, further demonstrating its fraudulent nature. The account is marked as " charged off '' and " written off, '' indicating that the creditor obtained a tax write-off for the alleged amount. Under federal law, it is unlawful for a creditor to receive a tax write-off and subsequently report an outstanding balance, making the reporting both deceptive and inaccurate. The FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) requires that all information on a consumer 's credit report be 100 % accurate, a standard which Experian has failed to meet in this instance. 

I am once again submitting a copy of my identity theft report along with proper identification. I am demanding that Experian permanently delete and remove the fraudulent XXXX account from my credit report immediately. If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will proceed with filing a lawsuit against your company in the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Florida, to seek damages for your violations of the FCRA. 

Please consider this letter your final notice to rectify this situation. Should this issue remain unresolved, I will also seek statutory damages, punitive damages, and attorney 's fees as allowed under the FCRA. 

I look forward to your prompt response and resolution. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
Bureau 's Failure to Conduct Reinvestigation for Account with XXXX XXXX. 

Dear XXXX, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). The credit bureau has failed to remove a late payment from my account with XXXX XXXX the necessary steps are being taken on my part to rectify this incorrect information. 

I recently disputed the presence of late payment on my XXXX XXXX account XXXX, which has been negatively impacting my credit history. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being.

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Follow-Up Dispute Verification - Failure to Comply with FCRA and this is the proof than show the violation Totally all law written to FCRA Section 611, FCDRA AND TILA, DELETE IMMEDIATELY THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT : I am writing to formally THIS COMPLAINT the accuracy of information PERSIST IN THE ACCOUNT AND THE bureau has verified on my credit report regarding the following account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX While I appreciate your response indicating that the information has been verified, I believe there are still significant inaccuracies that require further investigation. Specifically, XXXX. Account Type - Detail Experian lists the account as " Auto Loan '', while XXXX and XXXX classify it as " Installment account ''. This inconsistency should be corrected to ensure the details match. 
2. Payment Status Experian states the account was " Paid, was past due 30 days two or three times '', while : XXXX marks it as " Paid or paying as agreed '' ( no delays reported ). 
XXXX states " Pays account as agreed ''. 
This suggests a possible inaccuracy in Experian if no late payments are confirmed. 
3. Credit Limit Experian does not report a credit limit, whereas XXXX and XXXX show {$0.00}. This creates an information gap. 
4. Date of Last Payment Experian lists the last payment date as XX/XX/year>, while XXXX reports XX/XX/year>. Although the difference is minor, these dates should align across agencies. 
5. Date Last Active Experian reports the last active date as XX/XX/year>, while XXXX states XX/XX/year>. This discrepancy should be reviewed. 

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 16811 ( 7 ) credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 USC 1601, it is imperative that all credit information provided is accurate and transparent to protect consumer rights As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report. I request that you conduct a more thorough investigation into this matter, particularly considering the following points : 1. Inconsistencies : There are discrepancies among the three credit bureaus regarding this account.

2. Verification Issues : According to Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, you are required to verify accounts through original documentation. I request that you provide the supporting documentation you relied upon to verify this account.

3. Consumer Rights : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, if you can not provide adequate documentation to support the validity of this account, you must remove it from my credit report.

4. Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information.

I believe 100 % AND THE PROOF IS ATTACH TO THIS COMPLAINT THAN the bureau has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) in their investigation process. 
Specifically, I wish MORE POINT AND VIOLATION HAVE THE EXPERIAN TO MY RIGHT AFTER THE INVESTIGATION THE ACCOUNT HAVE DISCREPANCIES AND INACCURATE : 1. Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns.

2. Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation. 
XXXX. Duties of Furnishers of Information ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) : The furnishers of the disputed information did not adequately investigate or rectify the inaccuracies after being notified of my dispute, as required by law. 
4. Transparency and Accuracy ( TILA, 15 USC 1601 ) : The information provided in my credit report has not been accurate or transparent, violating my consumer rights.

5. Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. Your response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record.

6.

7. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information.

8.

9. 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information.

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Experian for their failure to comply with the FCRA and TILA. Additionally, This is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Removal of Inaccurate/invalidated credit information, please remove immediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Permissible Purposes ( 15 USC 1681b ) ( Section 604a ) ) : Experian included information in my report without my explicit written consent. Timing of Payments ( 15 USC 1666b ) : A creditor may not treat a payment on a credit card account under an open end consumer credit plan as late for any purpose. Notice of Disclosure and Opt-Out ( 15 USC 6802 ) : Consumers must be given notice of disclosure and the option to opt-out of such disclosures. I have not received such notice regarding this option for my consumer information.

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is being filed against XXXX, Experian, and XXXX for failure to comply with federal laws governing the reporting and timely removal of inaccurate accounts associated with identity theft. 

I have previously submitted an Identity Theft Affidavit, an Affidavit of Truth, and copies of my identifying information to each of the credit bureaus via certified mail, which has been received as evidenced by the return receipts. These documents clearly establish that the following accounts are fraudulent and must be deleted immediately : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I stated Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681-1681x ), you are required to investigate and delete any information that can not be verified as accurate within 4 business days when identity theft has been properly reported. Specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 mandates that credit reporting agencies block fraudulent information within 4 days of receiving an identity theft report and proof of identity.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) requires the deletion of inaccurate or unverifiable information following a reasonable investigation.

Failure to comply with these obligations has been adjudicated in the following court cases, which highlight your liability and lack of compliance : XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Failure to remove inaccurate information after proper notice constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 

XXXX v. TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Credit reporting agencies are liable for damages when they fail to conduct reasonable investigations.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute several fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent and remain reported in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my valid identity theft report, Experian has unlawfully refused to investigate and remove these accounts, further compounding their violations. 

The accounts and inquiries in question are : Accounts XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX  XXXX. 
Account : XXXX ( Experian ) XXXX  Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX Auto Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX ) Inquiries XXXX  XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( Experian ) XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX Experian XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ) Experians Unlawful Conduct Experian has responded to my dispute with an automated email falsely claiming that my identity theft report and supporting evidence are invalid, stating : " We are responding to your request that information in your personal credit report be blocked due to identity theft. Based on our review of your request and the information available to us, we have determined that either : your request to block was made in error, or, your request to block information was based on a material misrepresentation, or, you knowingly obtained or should have known that you obtained possession of goods, services, or moneys as a result of one or more of the transactions that you are seeking to block. '' This response is both baseless and illegal. I have complied with all legal requirements, including submitting a valid identity theft affidavit. Experians refusal to block or remove these accounts violates several provisions of federal law : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Blocking Information Resulting from Identity Theft : Credit reporting agencies are legally required to block information stemming from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation. Experian 's failure to comply directly violates this statute. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting : Reporting fraudulent accounts for which I did not authorize the furnishing of data violates permissible purposes under federal law.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Reinvestigation of Disputed Information : Experian is required to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of disputes. Refusing to investigate and relying on automated responses demonstrates clear noncompliance.

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports : Experian is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. Allowing fraudulent accounts and inquiries to remain on my credit report violates this provision.

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Experians refusal to address valid disputes constitutes willful noncompliance, making them liable for civil damages.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : The entities reporting these fraudulent accounts have also failed in their legal duty to provide accurate and verified information. 

Conclusion Experians ongoing failure to comply with federal law and their reliance on automated denials are unacceptable and unlawful. I urge the CFPB to investigate Experians conduct and hold them accountable for their violations of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

15 U.S.C 1681 Section 604 A Section 2 : It also states a consumer reporting agency can not furnish a account without my written instructions 15 U.S.C 1681c. ( a ) ( 5 ) Section States : no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.
