Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I was taken advantage of due to malpractice while your company broke several laws under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I recently did an investigation on my credit report and I found invalidated, inaccurate, unverifiable, and questionable items that your company is reporting. Your agency is not reporting 100 % correct information. Under 15 U.S. code 1681e ( b ) ( b ) Accuracy of report whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates. For the past two months I've tried to settle this issue with your company via mail however, I have reasonable evidence that your company is only trying to make times harder on me at the moment by not following reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) Permissible purposes of consumer reports also validate that anything reporting on my credit report that I did not consent to is fraud. I DID NOT give written or oral consent to any company listed below to disclose any of my nonpublic personal information. As of XX/XX/XXXX I've notified each company ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX  that I am using my right to opt out of their reporting on my consumer report. I have a right to privacy and per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer, I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non-written, verbal, and non-verbal per 5 USC 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non-written, verbal, and non-verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant to 15 USC section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) RESPONSIBILITIES OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES. A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Your agency along with XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX XXXX is in violation of multiple laws set forth by XXXX in regard to the following individual accounts of the consumer ( myself ). 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( I ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge-off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the creditor ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( me ) to any consumer reporting agency ( EXPERIAN, XXXX ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX XXXX can NOT collect on a XXXX debt. These accounts are now considered certificates of indebtedness per the XXXX and income can NOT be reported on a consumer report. The XXXX clearly defines a charge-off as gross or ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes the reporting of these accounts inaccurate! I provided a screenshot from the XXXX website. By definition, the XXXX clearly says a canceled debt or charge-off is income. The reporting of these accounts are inaccurate. To further validate that these accounts have been charged-off by each company with the XXXX, I received a copy B of each company 's 1099C filing with the XXXX and I've attached each copy as evidence. According to my consumer report and the 1099C filings with the XXXX by XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX each company has received a profit loss tax write off as a benefit of reporting debts greater than {$600.00}. XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX has obviously written the debt off with the XXXX so they should no longer be reporting these accounts on my consumer report, by doing so they're committing tax fraud. They've already filed the required forms with the XXXX  to notify them that they've took a profit loss, yet these accounts are still reporting these accounts on my consumer report. Maybe EXPERIAN and XXXX XXXX think XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and XXXX XXXX hasn't actually written off the debt attached to the accounts. If that is the case per 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) these accounts are inaccurately reporting and should be removed immediately. According to my XXXX credit file on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX removed the same accounts that EXPERIAN and XXXX are currently reporting XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX. I have attached a copy of the credit report from XXXX that shows the account has been removed. I request that you immediately remove these account from my credit report. Pursuant to 15 USC 6802 ( 1 ) ( c ) companies must not disclose any of my personal information unless I was given an explanation on how I can exercise a non-disclosure option, I am supposed to be notified of my eligibility to opt-out every thirty days. 16 CFR 313.7 ( f ) states there is a continuing right to opt-out, and a consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I've never been notified that I'm eligible to opt out. This is a violation of 15 USC 6802. Obligations with respect respect to disclosure of personal information. Pursuant to 15 USC 6801 ( a ) " It is the policy of the XXXX that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' Pursuant to 15 USC 6801 ( a ) " nonpublic personal information '' means personally identifiable financial information provided by a consumer to a financial institution ; resulting from any transaction with the consumer or any service performed for the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX are reporting adverse items on my XXXX XXXX account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. is reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to report adverse items by EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX and XXXX XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked unless the reporting is paid as agreed or Current. 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, and EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX are the reporting agencies and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX, the financial institution, and EXPERIAN, XXXX and XXXX, the consumer reporting agencies, DO NOT have my consent to furnish adverse information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX XXXX XXXX for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : XXXX XXXX XXXX failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or XXXX XXXX XXXX, as required by law. 

Impact of the Violation This accounts unauthorized and inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my creditworthiness, resulting in a lower credit score and negatively affecting my ability to access credit and financial opportunities.

Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX, IL XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX SS # XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX RE : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear CFPB, I am submitting this formal complaint to address several inaccuracies on my credit reports furnished by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX. These accounts violate multiple federal statutes, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and related regulations. I request an investigation into these violations and immediate correction or removal of the inaccurate entries. 
Accounts in Dispute and Specific Inaccuracies : XXXX. XXXX, XXXX * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Discrepancy in the " High Credit '' amount : {$27000.00} ( XXXX XXXX vs. {$990.00} ( Experian ). 
* Reporting of " Collection/Chargeoff '' status despite a {$0.00} balance. 
* Comments indicating contradictory statuses : " Charged off as bad debt '' vs. " Account transferred or sold. '' XXXX. XXXX * Account Number : XXXX * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Reporting of a " Collection/Chargeoff '' status despite a {$0.00} balance. 
* Comments indicate the account is both " Paid charge off '' and " Transferred or sold, '' creating conflicting information. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Discrepancy in the " Date Opened '' : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX XXXX vs. XX/XX/XXXX ( Experian ). 
* Comments include conflicting resolutions : " Consumer disputes this account information '' vs. " Resolved by data furnisher. '' XXXX. XXXX * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) * Account Type : Revolving * Issues : * Discrepancy in " High Credit '' amounts : {$3000.00} ( XXXX ) vs. {$2100.00} ( Experian ). 
* Contradictory comments : " Dispute resolved ; customer disagrees '' vs. " Consumer disputes after resolution. '' * Incorrect reporting of " 120 days late '' in payment history despite ongoing dispute. 
Violations of Federal Law : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : * 1681e ( b ) : Failure to ensure maximum possible accuracy.

* 1681i : Failure to conduct a reasonable investigation upon dispute.

* 1681s-2 ( b ) : Furnishing inaccurate information despite prior disputes.

2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : * 1692e : Use of false or misleading representations in reporting debts.

* 1692g : Failure to validate debts upon request.

3. Unfair and Deceptive Practices : * Misreporting account statuses and payment histories constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under federal consumer protection laws.

Actions Requested : 1. Immediate Removal of Inaccuracies : * All disputed accounts must be corrected or removed from my credit reports due to the failure to meet the accuracy standards under FCRA. 
XXXX. Investigation and Enforcement : * Investigate the actions of the furnishers ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX ) and the credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, XXXX ) for potential violations of federal law.

3. Validation of Debt : * Require furnishers to provide proper documentation validating their claims, including original account agreements and proof of accuracy.

4. Cease and Desist Misreporting : * Ensure furnishers and credit bureaus implement safeguards to prevent future misreporting.

Conclusion : The inaccuracies and legal violations associated with these accounts undermine the integrity of the credit reporting system and harm my financial standing. I urge the CFPB to take immediate corrective action and hold the responsible parties accountable. 
Please provide updates regarding this complaint at the earliest convenience. I am available to supply additional documentation if needed. 
These inquiries violate federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which mandates permissible purpose requirements for accessing consumer credit reports. The following inquiries are disputed : Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX, XXXX Category : Mortgage Companies - Finance XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX, XXXX Category : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Credit Unions XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Auto Financing XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Auto Financing XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Auto Financing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Auto Dealers, New XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Bank Credit Cards Violations of Federal Law : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Credit reports may only be accessed for a permissible purpose, such as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer.

These inquiries were not authorized by me, and I did not initiate any credit transactions related to these entities.

Unfair and Deceptive Practices : Unauthorized inquiries negatively impact my credit score and constitute an unfair practice under consumer protection laws.

Actions Requested : Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : All inquiries listed above must be removed from my credit reports due to the lack of permissible purpose and authorization.

Investigation and Enforcement : Investigate the actions of the entities that accessed my credit reports and ensure compliance with FCRA requirements.

Safeguards Against Future Violations : Implement measures to prevent unauthorized access to my credit file.

Conclusion : These unauthorized inquiries harm my credit standing and violate my rights under federal law. I urge the CFPB to take immediate corrective action to ensure compliance and protect consumers from similar violations. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX [ CFPB Address ] Washington XXXX DC XXXX Dear Sir/Madam, Re : Complaint Against Bank of America I am writing to file a formal complaint against Bank of America regarding their handling of multiple cashier 's check deposits and subsequent actions that have caused significant financial and emotional distress. 

Issue Background : Delayed Availability of Funds : On XX/XX/XXXX, I received a cashiers check from XXXX XXXX, drawn on XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, and deposited it into my checking account at Bank of America. 

Upon depositing the check via the mobile app, I received a notification that the check would not clear for four days. Despite contacting customer service and explaining the urgency, I was informed that Bank of America needed to retrieve their funds first. 

I subsequently canceled the transaction and deposited the check at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. However, on XX/XX/XXXX, Bank of America requested the check be returned to them, causing me to owe XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$560.00}. I received a letter from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX threatening legal action if the amount was not paid within XXXX days. 

Improper Handling of Cashier 's Check to XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX # XXXX advertised a XXXX XXXX XXXX for sale. I contacted the dealership and confirmed the automobile was available. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, I went to the Bank of America XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX, Texas, and requested a cashier 's check in the amount of {$10000.00}, made payable to XXXX XXXX. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, the automobile was stolen from my residence, and a XXXX Police Department auto theft report was made. Officers were dispatched to my residence, and a XXXX Police Report was filed. 

While Bank of America was supposedly investigating the matter, the same automobile was sold to another individual who retained an attorney and obtained a standing judgment for {$48000.00} from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX in XXXX. 

Despite the stolen vehicle and the standing judgment, Bank of America claimed they could not recover the funds from the {$10000.00} cashier 's check to XXXX XXXX. This contradicts their ability to reverse the cashiers check from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

Bank of America also falsely claimed they did not have a police report, despite having received the same police report I uploaded in the initial complaint form. 

Issues : Delayed Availability of Funds : The delay in clearing a cashiers check, which represents guaranteed funds, was unreasonable and caused significant financial hardship. 

Improper Handling of Canceled Transaction : Despite canceling the transaction, Bank of America requested the return of the check, causing undue financial liability. 

Failure to Reverse Transaction : Bank of America did not process or acknowledge the reversal of the {$10000.00} cashiers check to XXXX XXXX. 

Lack of Support and Resolution : Bank of America 's customer service failed to provide adequate support and resolution, exacerbating the issue. 

Request : I respectfully request that the CFPB investigate Bank of Americas handling of these matters and ensure that : Bank of America covers the {$560.00} owed to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX due to their error. 

Bank of America processes the reversal and provides compensation for the {$10000.00} cashiers check to XXXX XXXX. 

Bank of America reviews and revises their policies on holding cashiers checks to prevent similar issues in the future. 

Bank of America provides a formal apology and compensation for the financial and emotional distress caused. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your prompt response. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX As required by 15 USC 1601c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report Immediately. I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Consumer complaint narrative:
As an XXXX XXXX, a XXXX, and a dedicated provider striving to break cycles of poverty and secure a better future for my family, I am deeply troubled by the persistent negligence and discriminatory practices of the credit reporting agenciesExperian, XXXX, and XXXX XXXX Their actions have not only jeopardized my familys financial stability but have also pushed us closer to generational poverty. 
These errors are a direct violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. This blatant disregard for their legal obligations under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), FCRA, and FDCPA reflects systemic failures that perpetuate inequities and reinforces the XXXX XXXX  that disproportionately harm XXXX XXXX  like myself. By failing to uphold these statutes, these agencies are not only threatening my financial future but are also undermining the very principles of fairness and equality that these laws were designed to protect.

The accounts and inquiries listed below are unauthorized, fraudulent, or inaccurately reported. Their continued presence on my credit reports has caused significant financial harm, including limiting my access to credit and opportunities to support my growing family. Despite providing the required documentationincluding proof of identity, an FTC fraud report, and a statement identifying these items as fraudulentthese agencies have failed to comply with their obligations to block or remove this information under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 within the four days mandated by law. 

Please remove unauthorized/fraudulent inquiries and accounts : ExperianAccounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX I demand the immediate removal of these accounts and inquiries from my credit reports within the four days required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2.

15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer. 

Failure to comply will result in legal action. By willfully violating the FCRA, I am willing to settle your civil liability damages I have suffered as a result of your violation for {$1000.00} pursuant to FCRA 616 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ]. Should you fail or refuse to settle the matter by tendering payment in the amount of {$1000.00} within ten ( 10 ) calendar days of receipt of this notice and demand, I will seek actual damages, which are greater than {$1000.00}.

Your failure to act not only harms me but perpetuates systemic injustices that disproportionately affect XXXX XXXX. This is a violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act and underscores the need for accountability. By failing to act, these agencies further demonstrate a disregard for the financial wellbeing of individuals like myself who are striving to create a stable foundation for their families. 

For violating my rights under the FCRA, send funds immediately to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX and Experian are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. XXXX and Experian are reporting adverse items on my XXXX XXXX  account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states, Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. XXXX and Experian are reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. XXXX and Experian are also reporting a charge off which according to the IRS publication XXXX, a charge off is considered income and may not be reported as debt. The account has been charged off as witnessed by the report. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. XXXX and Experian do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to XXXX, Experian and XXXX XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.15 U.S.C . 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, XXXX and Experian are the reporting agencies and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX  XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX, the financial institution, and XXXX and Experian, the consumer reporting agencies, DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am opting out of your reporting services for this account.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Problem with personal statement of dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
Notice to Agent is Notice to Principal and Notice to Principal is Notice to Agent Under my rights afforded by the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), I formally dispute the accuracy of the reported XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account on my credit file . This account contains multiple discrepancies and ambiguities across all three credit reporting agencies XXXX, Experian, and XXXX which clearly violate reasonable verification procedures required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) and 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ).

Specific Discrepancies and Ambiguities : Status Inconsistency : XXXX lists the account as " Charge-Off '' with the last payment as XX/XX/year>. 
Experian states the " Account Charged Off '' with a date discrepancy ( XX/XX/year> ) and marks a consumer dispute unresolved. 
XXXX reports " Charged Off as Bad Debt '' with an unclear payment history. 
These inconsistencies indicate an inadequate investigation and verification process, violating 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) ( A ). 
Ambiguous Payment History : Each bureau provides differing dates of delinquency and " charge-off '' status reporting, which contradict the accurate timeline. 
No payment history is displayed on XXXX 's report, violating 1681e ( b ) regarding the accuracy of all data presented.

Verification Procedures : I demand the bureau disclose the reasonable procedures used to verify this account, as required under 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ). Failure to disclose such procedures violates my consumer rights. 
Consumer Statement and Dispute Status : Experian mentions " Item in Dispute by Consumer '', yet it remains unresolved. This violates your duty under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) to investigate disputes promptly and mark accounts as accurate only after proper validation. 
Violations of Law Identified : FCRA Violations : 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to maintain and follow reasonable procedures for maximum possible accuracy. 
15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) : Failure to reinvestigate disputed items and correct or delete inaccurate information.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Failure of the furnisher to conduct a thorough investigation after being notified of a dispute. 
Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) Violations : 15 U.S.C. 6802 : Non-consensual sharing of inaccurate data with credit bureaus.

15 U.S.C. 6804 : The bureaus failure to safeguard the integrity of consumer data during reporting. 
Recent Data Breaches Impacting Consumer Trust : Given the National Consumer Protection Database ( NPD ) breach, I question the validity of verification procedures for my personal data. This further necessitates proof that accurate records exist and were verified securely. 
Relief Sought : Immediate Deletion : I request that this account be permanently deleted from my credit file if your investigation can not prove its absolute accuracy. 
Procedural Documentation : Provide documentation of the methods used to verify this information. 
Cease Reporting : Stop reporting this account until your procedures are brought into compliance. 
Failure to address this dispute within 30 days will result in further actions, including a formal complaint to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) and pursuing legal remedies. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX [ XXXX ] without prejudice, all natural inalienable rights reserved.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir or Madam, I am writing to formally dispute a charge-off listed on my credit report that I believe is inaccurate and does not accurately reflect my current financial standing. Under U.S. Code 1681a, the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) ensures that all information on my credit report is both accurate and complete. I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this charge-off and, based on the information provided below, take appropriate action to have it removed. 

The charge-off in question is listed under the account for XXXX, Experian and XXXX. The charge-off is reported as XX/XX/year>, and it negatively impacts my credit score and my ability to access credit at favorable terms. 

Reason for Dispute : I believe this charge-off was incorrectly reported due to The credit reporting agency did not furnish an account and payment history for XX/XX/year> on my credit report. As a result, I am requesting the removal or correction of this entry, as it no longer accurately reflects the state of my financial obligations. 


I kindly ask that you investigate this matter under the guidelines of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am confident that upon review, it will be clear that the charge-off was reported in error, and I request that it be corrected or removed from my credit report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response and resolution.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/year> EXPERIAN XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 USC Dear Experian, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing.

Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification.

3. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX  Report To : Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) To : XXXX, XXXX, Experian ( All Credit Bureaus ) Date : XX/XX/XXXX Subject : Report of Identity Theft and Fraudulent Activity Linked to XXXX XXXX  for XXXX XXXX XXXX of Birth : XX/XX/XXXX Social Security Number : XXXX Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX CA XXXX URGENT REPORT OF FRAUDULENT ACTIVITY AND XXXX XXXX LINKAGE Dear Sir/Madam, I, XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX this report to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB XXXX and to XXXX, XXXX XXXX and Experian, as my name, personal information, and financial details have been unlawfully used to perpetrate fraudulent activities. I am concerned that my identity has been XXXX or otherwise exploited for fraudulent purposes, including the unauthorized creation of accounts and use of false addresses in my name. This report highlights the fraudulent activity that violates my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and may be related to broader XXXX XXXX or organized identity theft. 
Summary of Fraudulent Activity : Upon reviewing my credit reports as of XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered the following fraudulent activities that are indicative of identity theft. This information has likely been misused without my knowledge or consent. I suspect that these fraudulent actions may be linked to XXXX XXXX  or organized identity exploitation. Below is a list of fraudulent accounts and non-mailable addresses that have been reported under my identity. 
Fraudulent Non-Mailable Addresses The following addresses, which I have no knowledge of, appear on my credit report and are being used to further fraudulent activities. These addresses are non-mailable and have no connection to my true residential address XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Fraudulent Accounts : I have identified several fraudulent accounts that have been opened in my name without my consent. These accounts do not reflect any transactions that I have authorized and appear to be part of a broader pattern of fraud : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  : Given the nature and scope of the fraudulent activity described above, I have serious concerns that this identity theft is linked to XXXX XXXX or the misuse of my personal information by criminal organizations. It is important that the proper authorities investigate the possibility that my personal information has been XXXX for exploitation and financial fraud. 
Request for Immediate Action : As a victim of identity theft, I request that the following actions be taken immediately : 1. Removal of Fraudulent Accounts : Please remove all fraudulent accounts listed above from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section 609 & 611.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Experian, XXXX, XXXX and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

Subject : Request for Deletion of Credit Report Dear CFB Experian, XXXX, XXXX and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

I am writing to formally request the deletion of my credit report due to multiple security breaches and the lack of any active lines of credit under my name. I have experienced five security breaches, including incidents involving XXXX, for which I have received settlements. Additionally, I was affected by a recent credit breach from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

According to the data breach website, my Social Security number and personal information have been compromised by these companies. Given this information, my credit report should have been locked, and there should be no listings or open lines of credit. I have not had any credit accounts for over five years, and due to health issues, I am no longer driving, further reducing my need for credit.

Furthermore, I request the immediate detection of my credit report to prevent any unauthorized access and the removal of my information from all third-party pre-approval lists. I believe that all three credit bureaus ( XXXX, Experian, and XXXX ) should have refrained from sharing my information without my consent. 

I also request the deletion of any and all unauthorized information on my report, including but not limited to addresses, phone numbers, income, and any charge-offs. It is essential that my credit report reflects only accurate and authorized information. 

Additionally, I want to bring to your attention the recent lawsuit settled in XX/XX/year>, which held credit reporting agencies accountable for mishandling consumer data. This settlement further underscores the need for the protection of consumers ' personal information and reinforces my request for the deletion of inaccurate information from my credit report. 

Please be advised that under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to request the deletion of any inaccurate or unverifiable information. Failure to comply with my request may result in a fine of up to {$1000.00} as stipulated by relevant laws.

I kindly ask that you investigate this matter and provide written confirmation of the deletion of my credit report. Please let me know if you require any additional documentation to support my request. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
In accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting act. The List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681. 
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has violated my rights.

And according to the fair credit reporting act Whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ).

And according to 15 USC 1681 5 they are suppose to do this ( 5 ) Treatment of inaccurate or unverifiable information ( A ) In generallf, after any reinvestigation under paragraph ( 1 ) of any information disputed by a consumer, an item of the information is found to be inaccurate or incomplete or can not be verified, the consumer reporting agency shall ( i ) promptly delete that item of information from the file of the consumer, or modify that item of information, as appropriate, based on the results of the reinvestigation; and ( ii ) promptly notify the furnisher of that information that the information has been modified or deleted from the file of the consumer.

and according to 15 USC 1681s-2 they are suppose to not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

15 U.S.C. 1681B ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this complaint to the CFPB because when I recently reviewed my credit profile I was dismayed to find that, despite my previous request, that the credit reporting agency of EXPERIAN has failed to correct the inaccuracies in my personal information. This letter serves as my second formal notice requesting immediate action to rectify these errors. I request that you delete the inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next thirty days. Below, I have outlined the specific details of my personal information that are inaccurately reported and must be removed without delay : - Name : My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX. I do not have any other names or aliases, am not associated with any other names, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. If any other names or aliases are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information without infringing on my consumer rights. Correct my name on my credit report to reflect the following name ; XXXX XXXX XXXX any other names not spelled and included in its entirety are therefor inaccuarate. Attached to this document is the proof of my identity. 

- Address : My current and only address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. I do not have any other current addresses, nor do I desire any other addresses to be retained or reported, all other addresses or previous addresses are not mine and are non-mailable addresses for XXXX XXXX XXXX, therefore inaccurate. Any additional addresses must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. Attached to this document are my proofs of address. 

- Date of Birth : My date of birth is XX/XX/year>XXXX  and is to be reported exactly in this manner any other combination is inaccurate. I do not have any other dates of birth, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. If any other dates of birth are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. Please reference the attached document. 

- Telephone Numbers : I do not have any requisite telephone numbers, nor do I desire any telephone numbers to be retained or reported. Any retained telephone numbers must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. 

- Employers : I do not have any requisite employers listed, nor do I desire any employers to be retained or reported. If any employers are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. 

- Spouses, Roommates, Co-Applicants : I do not have any requisite spouses, roommates, or co-applicants, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. Any related information must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information you report. This is my second notification alerting you to inaccuracies in my credit report. By failing to correct these errors, you are now in violation of the FCRA, including but not limited to : - 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. 

- 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information.

- 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Reporting obsolete information or retaining data longer than permitted.

If the inaccuracies are not corrected within thirty days from the date of this letter, I will be compelled to seek legal recourse to enforce my rights under the FCRA. Furthermore, I request that once you have corrected the inaccuracies, you provide me with a complete and updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Please send this corrected report to my address at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If I do not receive a response or corrective action within the designated timeframe, I will interpret this as non-compliance, and appropriate legal measures will be taken. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX UCC1-304, UCC1-308 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED WITHOUT RECOURSE WITHOUT PREJUDICE

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Account # XXXX Dear Experian Dispute Department, I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of the above-referenced account on my credit report. According to your records, this account reflects a balance of {$16000.00}. However, I have documentation ( attached for reference ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that the actual deficiency balance is {$5600.00} after the repossession and sale of the collateral. This discrepancy is not only significant but is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1681i and related consumer protection laws.

Grounds for Dispute : 1. Inaccurate Reporting ( 1681e ( b ) ) : Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy and completeness of all information reported. The discrepancy between the actual deficiency balance provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX and the amount being reported by Experian clearly demonstrates a failure to meet this requirement. 

2. Verification Requirement ( 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ) : I request that you immediately conduct an investigation into this matter and verify the accuracy of the reported balance. If the creditor can not substantiate the reported balance of {$16000.00}, this account must be corrected or deleted from my credit file.

3. Unfair and Misleading Information : Reporting an inflated balance misrepresents the true state of this account, which negatively impacts my creditworthiness and violates consumer protection principles.

4. Potential Violations of FDCPA ( 807 ) : If this inaccurate balance is being communicated as an attempt to collect a debt, it may constitute a false or misleading representation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Attached to this letter is documentation from XXXX XXXX XXXX showing the correct deficiency balance, which unequivocally supports my claim.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is filed against Experian, XXXX, and XXXX for multiple violations of federal law under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and other consumer protection laws. Despite formally disputing 15 fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries on my credit report, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX has failed to act in accordance with their legal obligations. My initial dispute letter included detailed documentation of identity theft and requested the removal and blockage of the fraudulent accounts. As of today, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX has failed to resolve my disputes within the legally mandated timeframes or provide sufficient remedies for their violations. 

The following fraudulent accounts and inquiries remain unresolved and continue to cause harm to my credit profile : Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  ) ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) Unauthorized Credit Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Legal Violations Committed by Experian XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX : Failure to Investigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX failed to conduct a proper investigation of my disputes within the required 30-day period after receiving notice, in direct violation of FCRA 1681i ( a ).

Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : My credit report continues to contain inaccuracies, including discrepancies in balances, open dates, and payment histories across bureaus, in violation of FCRA 1681e ( b ).

Failure to Block Fraudulent Information After Notice of Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Despite being provided with sufficient evidence of identity theft, including police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX has failed to block the fraudulent accounts and inquiries.

Failure to Provide Timely Written Results of Investigations ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX did not provide written notice of the results of their investigations within the required 30 days. 

Failure to Provide Consumer Resources for Victims of Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( e ) ) : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX neglected to implement fraud alerts or offer guidance and support for identity theft victims, in violation of FTC regulations. 

Failure to Notify of Debt Validation as Required ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Creditors failed to provide debt validation within five days of reporting fraudulent accounts, which Experian, XXXX, and XXXX has continued to report. 

Failure to Reinvestigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : Despite providing additional documentation to challenge the resolution of prior disputes, Experian, XXXX, and XXXX has failed to conduct a reinvestigation. 

Violations of Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801 ) : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX failed to safeguard my personal information, as evidenced by the fraudulent accounts and inquiries. 

Relief Requested : I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to hold Experian, XXXX, and XXXX accountable for their repeated violations of federal law. Specifically, I demand the following remedies : Immediate removal and permanent blockage of all fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries listed above. 

Written confirmation from Experian, XXXX, and XXXX regarding the removal of fraudulent entries and the provision of updated, corrected copies of my credit report. 

Implementation of fraud alerts on my credit file for additional protection against future identity theft. 

An investigation into how my personal information was compromised and how these accounts were permitted to appear on my credit report. 

Compensation for damages resulting from negligence and noncompliance with federal law, including but not limited to damage to my creditworthiness and emotional distress. 

Issuance of penalties and corrective measures against Experian, XXXX, and XXXX to ensure compliance with federal regulations. 

Supporting Documentation : Enclosed with this complaint, I have provided the following : Copies of my original dispute letters sent to Experian, XXXX, and XXXX. 

Copies of police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address. 

Documentation of all correspondence with Experian, XXXX, and XXXX. 

Conclusion : Experian, XXXX, and XXXX 's failure to comply with federal law and address my disputes in a timely and lawful manner demonstrates willful neglect and reckless disregard for their responsibilities under the FCRA. I request that the CFPB take decisive action to ensure accountability and provide remedies for the harm caused by their noncompliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please do not hesitate to contact me should you require further details or documentation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being. 

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute several fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent and remain reported in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my valid identity theft report, Experian has unlawfully refused to investigate and remove these accounts, further compounding their violations. 

The accounts in question are : Accounts XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX, Experian ) XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Experian ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX, Experian ) Experians Unlawful Conduct Experian has responded to my dispute with an automated email falsely claiming that my identity theft report and supporting evidence are invalid, stating : " We are responding to your request that information in your personal credit report be blocked due to identity theft. Based on our review of your request and the information available to us, we have determined that either : your request to block was made in error, or, your request to block information was based on a material misrepresentation, or, you knowingly obtained or should have known that you obtained possession of goods, services, or moneys as a result of one or more of the transactions that you are seeking to block. '' This response is both baseless and illegal. I have complied with all legal requirements, including submitting a valid identity theft affidavit. Experians refusal to block or remove these accounts violates several provisions of federal law : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Blocking Information Resulting from Identity Theft : Credit reporting agencies are legally required to block information stemming from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation. Experian 's failure to comply directly violates this statute. 

XXXX XXXX.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting : Reporting fraudulent accounts for which I did not authorize the furnishing of data violates permissible purposes under federal law.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Reinvestigation of Disputed Information : Experian is required to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of disputes. Refusing to investigate and relying on automated responses demonstrates clear noncompliance.

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports : Experian is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. Allowing fraudulent accounts to remain on my credit report violates this provision.

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : Experians refusal to address valid disputes constitutes willful noncompliance, making them liable for civil damages.

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : The entities reporting these fraudulent accounts have also failed in their legal duty to provide accurate and verified information. 

Conclusion Experians ongoing failure to comply with federal law and their reliance on automated denials are unacceptable and unlawful. I urge the CFPB to investigate Experians conduct and hold them accountable for their violations of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> To whom this may concern : I am writing to update/correct my personal information on my credit file I dont wish to have any telephone number on my report. 

Under consumer law, credit bureaus reporting old or outdated addresses may violate provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The relevant sections are : 1. FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : Accuracy of Information Credit bureaus are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. Reporting an old or incorrect address could violate this provision if it misrepresents your current address and affects your credit profile. 

2. FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) : Dispute Process You have the right to dispute inaccurate or outdated information, including old addresses, with the credit bureau. Once you file a dispute, the bureau must investigate and correct or delete inaccurate information, typically within 30 days.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by Experian XXXX have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER XXXX XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, Experian has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : experian failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 1. Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

CFPB ( Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ) complaint. 

Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting by XXXX, XXXX, and Experian Description of the Issue : I am filing this complaint to address inaccurate credit reporting by XXXX, XXXX, and Experian regarding accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and a student loan serviced by the Department of EducationXXXX XXXX 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent a Notice of Liability and Self-Executing Default to XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX mail on XX/XX/year>, delivered on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
They were given 10 days to respond, but no response was received. Therefore, they are in default, and this account should no longer be reported. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX A Notice of Liability and XXXX Default was sent via certified mail on XX/XX/year>, and delivered on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
Again, no response was received within 10 days, placing this account in default. This account should also be removed immediately. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of EducationXXXX ) I attempted to send a certified Notice of XXXX and XXXX Default on XX/XX/year>, but the letter was returned as undeliverable on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
The address provided by the school was invalid, and I have been unable to properly serve notice. This loan contract was entered into under unconscionable terms and lacked full disclosure of its impact on credit reporting. 
Violations and Requests for Validation : I am requesting that XXXX, XXXX, and Experian provide the following : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : Proof that I provided written express consent to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the Department of EducationXXXX to report this information to the credit bureaus. 
XXXX. Court Orders : Records showing that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX , or the Department of EducationXXXX obtained a court order from a competent jurisdiction to communicate with me about these debts.

3. GAAP Compliance : Documentation that XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and the Department of EducationXXXX are adhering to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ) in verifying the validity of these debts. 
If this information can not be provided, the accounts should be deleted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) for failure to verify their accuracy. 
Impact on My Rights : The reporting of these accounts is depriving me of my life, liberty, and pursuit of happiness by negatively impacting my credit score without proper validation.

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report.

Specifically, 1. Account Type - Detail Experian lists the account as " Auto Loan '', while XXXX and XXXX classify it as " Installment account ''. This inconsistency should be corrected to ensure the details match.

2. Payment Status Experian states the account was " Paid, was past due 30 days two or three times '', while : XXXX marks it as " Paid or paying as agreed '' ( no delays reported ). 
XXXX states " Pays account as agreed ''. 
This suggests a possible inaccuracy in Experian if no late payments are confirmed. 
3. Credit Limit Experian does not report a credit limit, whereas XXXX and XXXX show {$0.00}. This creates an information gap.

4. Date of Last Payment Experian lists the last payment date as XX/XX/year>, while XXXX reports XX/XX/year>. Although the difference is minor, these dates should align across agencies. 
XXXX. Date Last Active Experian reports the last active date as XX/XX/year>, while XXXX states XX/XX/year>. This discrepancy should be reviewed. 

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 16811 ( 7 ) credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 USC 1601, it is imperative that all credit information provided is accurate and transparent to protect consumer rights As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report. I request that you conduct a more thorough investigation into this matter, particularly considering the following points : 1. Inconsistencies : There are discrepancies among the three credit bureaus regarding this account.

2. Verification Issues : According to Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, you are required to verify accounts through original documentation. I request that you provide the supporting documentation you relied upon to verify this account.

3. Consumer Rights : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, if you can not provide adequate documentation to support the validity of this account, you must remove it from my credit report.

4. Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by Experian XXXX have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER XXXX XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, Experian has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : experian failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : XXXX. Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX  Account XXXX : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative: Synchrony Care Credit App discloses inaccurate payment deadline information that has now resulted with me being charged late fees and reduced credit limits. I use the CareCredit app which alerts me when my payment is due and Ive always paid my payment on time according to the deadline that states on the app which is by XXXX XXXX  EST. I went to pull up my account this month as I need to take my daughter to the dentist to notice that Ive been being charged late fees and they reduced my available credit limit by almost {$400.00}! I then pulled up the statement in my App account to find out that the statement discloses that the payment must be made bXXXX XXXX XXXX EST which is contradicting based off the App. I contacted them to request a refund of late fees and to get my available credit back to me considering the App had incorrect information and that I was not aware of the XXXX XXXX EST cut off and they were unable to resolve the issue. Their only response was sorry.. well that doesnt cut it! They need to fix the misleading information they have on the App before this happens to others and they need to credit the late fees and credit limit back to me. I feel this is just their way of scamming people. This is NOT okay. I cant take my daughter to get her cracked tooth fixed now. I want this resolved!

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to lodge a formal complaint and request an investigation regarding a charged-off account, ACCOUNT NAME : ACHIEVEPL, ACCOUNT # : XXXX inaccurately reported by a creditor. Specifically, the creditor has unlawfully reported a charged-off account while simultaneously reflecting a balance on my credit report. This reporting practice violates my rights under federal law, including the Internal Revenue Code ( Title 26 ) and the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Furthermore, I have not received a 1099-C from the creditor, which is required when debt is canceled, discharged, or otherwise written off. 

B

asis for Complaint Failure to Issue 1099-C as Required by IRC 6050P Under the Internal Revenue Code ( IRC 6050P ), a creditor is obligated to issue a Form 1099-C when a debt of {$600.00} or more is canceled or charged off. The absence of a 1099-C creates ambiguity about the legal status of the account. It is a clear indication of noncompliance with federal tax reporting requirements and calls into question the validity of the continued reporting of any balance. Inconsistent Reporting of a Charged-Off Account By reporting the account as " charged-off '' while still reflecting a balance, the creditor is engaging in inconsistent and inaccurate reporting. A " charge-off '' designation signifies that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible and ceased collection activities. Therefore, any balance reported is misleading and violates the accuracy standards required under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ). 

Court Precedent : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Bank In XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, the court held that once a debt is charged off, it can not simultaneously remain active for reporting purposes or accrue interest. This precedent underscores that reporting a charged-off debt with a balance constitutes a misrepresentation of the debt 's legal status and harms the consumers creditworthiness. 

Violations of Law IRC 6050P requires creditors to issue a Form 1099-C for debts deemed canceled, charged-off, or discharged. The failure to comply violates federal tax law. 

FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) mandates that information furnished to credit reporting agencies must be accurate and not misleading. The continued reporting of a balance on a charged-off account is inconsistent, inaccurate, and unlawful. 

Requested Actions I respectfully request that the CFPB : Investigate the creditors noncompliance with IRC 6050P, particularly the failure to issue a Form 1099-C ; Require the creditor to clarify the legal status of the charged-off account and correct any inaccurate reporting ; Direct the creditor and credit reporting agencies to remove the charged-off account and balance from my credit report ; Enforce compliance with the FCRA and federal tax laws to prevent further violations of my rights. 

Supporting Documentation I have attached all supporting documentation, including account statements and any relevant correspondence, to substantiate my complaint. 

Conclusion The inaccurate reporting of a charged-off account with an outstanding balance violates federal law and my rights as a consumer. The absence of a 1099-C further demonstrates the creditors failure to adhere to legal requirements under the Internal Revenue Code. I urge the CFPB to investigate this matter promptly and take all necessary actions to ensure compliance with federal law. 

Sincerely, XXXX : XXXX
