Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Consumer complaint narrative: I contacted JP Morgan Chase Auto to discuss applying for their deferment program. I spoke with an individual on XX/XX/XXXX, and I applied for the program. I advised that I would like to skip my XXXX car payment and add it to the end of the loan due to an unexpected financial hardship. The representative asked me several qualifying questions and stated that I was APPROVED for this program. He indicated that they will send me a written agreement that I would need to sign and send back. I received the agreement via mail and faxed it back on XX/XX/XXXX. Nonetheless, The representative advised that my XXXX payment would be skipped and that this would not affect my credit. Mind you, I have never been late with my car payment at all during my relationship with JPMorgan Chase. The representative asked when I would make my XXXX car payment, and I had indicated on XXXX when it was due. He further explained that this would be a new month and would be standard payment procedure. Well come to find out, They did not approve my payment deferment because I was not able to make my car payment on XX/XX/XXXX. They provided no communication stating that I was denied and the details of being denied was not detailed in the agreement that I signed. In addition, I was under the impression that if I make my payment within the 10 day grace period that I would still be ok. I contacted the escalation department and spoke to them about my grievances with their procedures and how it was a switch and bait. Due to their illogical business process ... my credit has been adversely affected, and this is not fair. Like, I stated previously I have never been late on my car payment. i trusted them that they would follow through on their plan. they tricked me and now my credit has dropped more than XXXX points. I am in the process of purchasing a home and now I will definitely not be able to close because of this hiccup. I ask they they correct the negative reporting to the credit bureaus and that they approve my request for deferrment as soon as possible. The representative stated that I need to make XXXX payments now in order to be current and to be considered again. They are like a XXXX organization that just played a trick on their client for what gain? I am not sure but I am collateral damage. I think this new administration needs to regulate companies like this with these arbitrary policies that benefit no one. It's illogical and unfair, and it really speaks to their business goals of not truly helping their customers. I already pay way to much in interest ( 21 % ) which is already unfair to pay for a XXXX XXXX XXXX that is not even worth half the money I still currently owe. The economic climate and inflation has made it unbearable to be able to afford anything now a days. I pride myself in paying my car payment on time and they just arbitrarily ruined my credit and have no recourse nor compassion over their flawed illogical policy that has no legal reasoning to base their decision. Please hold them accountable. The Constitution was created for " we the People, '' not " we the corporations. '' I am requesting help from all agencies, including the Justice Department, to correct this.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
As an XXXX XXXX, a father-to-be, and a dedicated provider striving to break cycles of poverty and secure a better future for my family, I am deeply troubled by the persistent negligence and discriminatory practices of the credit reporting agenciesXXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion XXXX Their actions have not only jeopardized my familys financial stability but have also pushed us closer to generational poverty. 
These errors are a direct violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. This blatant disregard for their legal obligations under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), FCRA, and FDCPA reflects systemic failures that perpetuate inequities and reinforces the racial biases that disproportionately harm XXXX XXXX like myself. By failing to uphold these statutes, these agencies are not only threatening my financial future but are also undermining the very principles of fairness and equality that these laws were designed to protect. 
The accounts and inquiries listed below are unauthorized, fraudulent, or inaccurately reported. Their continued presence on my credit reports has caused significant financial harm, including limiting my access to credit and opportunities to support my growing family. Despite providing the required documentationincluding proof of identity, an FTC fraud report, and a statement identifying these items as fraudulentthese agencies have failed to comply with their obligations to block or remove this information under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 within the four days mandated by law.

15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

Failure to comply will result in legal action. By willfully violating the FCRA, I am willing to settle your civil liability damages I have suffered as a result of your violation for {$1000.00} pursuant to FCRA 616 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ]. Should you fail or refuse to settle the matter by tendering payment in the amount of {$1000.00} within ten ( 10 ) calendar days of receipt of this notice and demand, I will seek actual damages, which are greater than {$1000.00}.

Your failure to act not only harms me but perpetuates systemic injustices that disproportionately affect XXXXXXXX XXXX. This is a violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act and underscores the need for accountability. By failing to act, these agencies further demonstrate a disregard for the financial wellbeing of individuals like myself who are striving to create a stable foundation for their families. 

For violating my rights under the FCRA, send funds immediately to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX

Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
My mortgage servicer for my FHA loan is Carrington and I feel that they are not giving me a chance to be considered for homeowner assistance programs and are pushing me into foreclosure. I have gone through several difficult situations, but am now on my feet with a new job and additional income sources and want to try and work things out. The problem is that they are telling me the only option is to reinstate the past due balance in full, while they are having a foreclosure attorney contact me. I am very frustrated and concerned with the way they have handled the servicing of my mortgage loan. I had some major issues due to loss of employment, fire and injury that put me on workmens compensation. I have tried to communicate with Carrington and I got an email that said XXXX is reviewing my application, but I have not sent any application in. When I call to follow up I get conflicting information and it sounds like this is a delay tactic because now I am in the foreclosure system at Carrington. I thought there were programs that could help someone in my situation save their home. It sounds like Carrington has moved past that part of the program and instead started trying to auction off my home. I am back on my feet financially and can make things right if Carrington were to allow access to government programs they are supposed to offer. 

This home was owned by my parents since XXXX. When they passed away I bought the house with a loan from XXXX XXXX  in XXXX. I refinanced with XXXX in XXXX and got some cash out to get caught up on bills. I have worked as a truck driver for 30 years and it is a business with a lot of ups and downs and I was never able to save very much money. In fall of XXXX my ex-girlfriend was going to move several hours away and take our XXXX XXXX XXXX daughter with her. My daughter did not want to go and I desperately tried to come up with a plan so she could stay close to me and her grandparents. I put together the money I had and bought an RV and a space at an RV park and my daughter and I stayed there while I commuted to work and my primary residence. This lasted a few months and put me into a tough place financially and I defaulted on the loan. I contacted XXXX  and they worked with me and put me into a HUD program to put the past due payments into a second XXXX so I could resume making the regular mortgage payments. I was able to make the first couple of payments as my daughter had moved in with her grandparents but I was still in a lease for the RV Park and then my work truck caught on fire and it was a crazy situation and while I was trying to put the fire out I seriously injured my shoulder. This put me out of work. Due to all of these problems I fell behind on the mortgage payment again and was on workmens compensation for a couple of months. 

When I fell behind after getting the help in XXXX the loan had transferred to Carrington. When I ran into all of these problems I contacted them to tell them what was going on. I was told that I would need to reinstate the full past due amount and that I was going into foreclosure. I could not believe that Carrington was sending my case to XXXX XXXX XXXX.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against XXXX for their failure to comply with federal laws governing consumer privacy and disclosure rights. XXXX has violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and other applicable statutes by : 1. Failing to Provide Required Disclosures : XXXX did not provide me with any disclosures or notifications regarding my rights to opt out of the sharing of my personal information with third parties. 
2. Failure to Honor My Opt-Out Request : I recently sent XXXX a XXXX opt-out notice, as permitted under 12 CFR 1016.7 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( i ) and 15 USC 6802, requesting that they immediately cease the disclosure of my personal information. Despite this, XXXX has continued to share my information without my authorization, directly violating my federally protected consumer rights. 
Details of the Violations : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602 ( a ), it is stated : There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 
XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the consumer. I have the right to ensure my private information is not shared without my consent. 
This right is further supported by 15 U.S.C. 6801, which declares : It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information.

A furnisher of information to credit agencies qualifies as a financial institution under this definition.

Per 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) : A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
Neither XXXX ( the furnisher of information ) nor the consumer reporting agenciesXXXX XXXX, or TransUnionhave my consent, written or otherwise, to furnish or report my information. Any prior consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. 
Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) - ( c ) states : A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise the nondisclosure option.

I was never informed of my right to exercise this option, which constitutes a failure to comply with the law.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ), it is stated : A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Moreover, 15 U.S.C. 1681e requires that consumer reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure compliance with 1681c and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to authorized purposes under 1681b. XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion have failed to meet this requirement in their handling of my information. 
Lastly, 12 C.F.R. 1016.7 explicitly states : A consumer may exercise the right to opt-out at any time.

I am exercising my right to opt out of all reporting services provided by XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. 
Requested Resolution : 1. I request the immediate removal of all unauthorized and inaccurate information reported by XXXX from my credit files with XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. 
2. I demand that XXXX cease all reporting of my personal information and comply fully with my opt-out request. 
3. I request compensation in the maximum allowable amount of {$1000.00} for these violations, as provided under the FCRA and Privacy Act of 1974. 
Impact on Me as a Consumer : XXXX actions have violated my trust, compromised my privacy, and caused undue stress. Their failure to comply with federal laws governing the accuracy, privacy, and proper handling of consumer information has further damaged my ability to ensure my credit file reflects accurate and lawful information. 
I trust the CFPB will investigate XXXX violations and hold them accountable for failing to respect my federally protected consumer rights.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by Transunion XXXX have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT XXXX XXXX to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence Letter 1 and Letter 2, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, Transunion has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : experian failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 1. Creditor Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  o Account Number : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

This complaint is being filed against XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion for failure to comply with federal laws governing the reporting and timely removal of inaccurate accounts associated with identity theft. 

I have previously submitted an Identity Theft Affidavit, an Affidavit of Truth, and copies of my identifying information to each of the credit bureaus via certified mail, which has been received as evidenced by the return receipts. These documents clearly establish that the following accounts are fraudulent and must be deleted immediately : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I stated Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681-1681x ), you are required to investigate and delete any information that can not be verified as accurate within 4 business days when identity theft has been properly reported. Specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 mandates that credit reporting agencies block fraudulent information within 4 days of receiving an identity theft report and proof of identity.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) requires the deletion of inaccurate or unverifiable information following a reasonable investigation.

Failure to comply with these obligations has been adjudicated in the following court cases, which highlight your liability and lack of compliance : XXXX v. TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX Cir. XXXX ) : Failure to remove inaccurate information after proper notice constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 

XXXX v. TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ) : Credit reporting agencies are liable for damages when they fail to conduct reasonable investigations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report. According to my credit report, XXXX XXXX has listed certain accounts as charged off. However, I have concrete documentation proving that these loans are not in default, and this claim is false. This misinformation has caused undue harm to my credit score and is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Ohio state laws. 

Details of the Disputed Accounts : Creditor : XXXX XXXX Account Number ( s ) : n/a Reported Status : Charged Off Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Reporting an account as charged off when it has not defaulted constitutes false reporting, which is prohibited under this law. Moreover, Ohios consumer protection laws also mandate that creditors and credit bureaus must report information fairly and accurately, per Ohio Revised Code Section 1345.02, which prohibits unfair and deceptive practices. 

Additionally, in XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ), the courts reinforced the obligation of credit reporting agencies to conduct reasonable investigations when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Reporting a charge-off inaccurately violates this precedent and further illustrates a failure to uphold proper investigative standards. 

To support my dispute, I have attached the following documents : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
2. Documentation proving that my XXXX XXXX loans are not in default. 
3. [ Any additional evidence, such as account statements or correspondence with XXXX XXXX. ] I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] investigate this matter promptly and delete the inaccurate charge-off entries from my credit report. Failure to address and correct this issue may leave me no choice but to seek legal remedies under the FCRA and Ohio consumer protection laws. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and expect a written response within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX  To whom this may concern : I am writing to update/correct my personal information on my credit file I dont wish to have any telephone number on my report. 

Under consumer law, credit bureaus reporting old or outdated addresses may violate provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The relevant sections are : 1. FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : Accuracy of Information Credit bureaus are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. Reporting an old or incorrect address could violate this provision if it misrepresents your current address and affects your credit profile. 

2. FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) : Dispute Process You have the right to dispute inaccurate or outdated information, including old addresses, with the credit bureau. Once you file a dispute, the bureau must investigate and correct or delete inaccurate information, typically within 30 days.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Complaint Against TransUnion for Violation of 15 U.S. Code 16811 ( 5 ) and Failure to Remove Inaccurate Account Information.

Dear Consumer, Financial Protection Bureau, I am writing to file a formal complaint against TransUnion for its repeated failure to remove inaccurate account information from my credit report following two reinvestigations, which is in violation of 15 U.S. Code 16811 ( 5 ) of the Fair Credit Reporting Act Account Information : Creditor Name : XXXX Account Number : XXXX Date of Charge Off : XX/XX/year> Amount : {$1200.00} Despite providing clear evidence of the inaccuracies in the above-referenced account and requesting its removal from my credit report, TransUnion has failed to comply with the law and has retained the inaccurate account information.

The Fair Credit Reporting Act mandates that if a reinvestigation does not resolve a dispute, the credit bureau must delete the disputed
information within five business days. The repeated failure of TransUnion to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 16811 ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against TransUnion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that TransUnion upholds its obligations under the law. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against XXXX for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : XXXX failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or XXXX, as required by law.

Impact of the Violation This accounts unauthorized and inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my creditworthiness, resulting in a lower credit score and negatively affecting my ability to access credit and financial opportunities.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Follow-Up Dispute Verification - Failure to Comply with FCRA and this is the proof than show the violation Totally all law written to FCRA Section 611, FCDRA AND TILA, DELETE INMEDIATLY THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT : I am writing to formally THIS COMPLAINT the accuracy of information PERSIST IN THE ACCOUNT AND THE bureau has verified on my credit report regarding the following account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account NumberXXXX While I appreciate your response indicating that the information has been verified, I believe there are still significant inaccuracies that require further investigation. Specifically, 1. Current Balance : XXXX does not report a balance, while TransUnion and XXXX list {$0.00}. This inconsistency creates confusion, as all agencies should show the same balance. 
2. Date Last Active : XXXX reports the last active date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears to be an error since it is a future date. 
TransUnion shows XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX lists XX/XX/XXXX. This discrepancy should be investigated. 
3. Date of Last Payment : XXXX lists the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while TransUnion and XXXX report XX/XX/XXXX. The difference of a few days could be an error if the payments were made simultaneously. 
4. Payment Status : TransUnion states that the account was 60 days past due. 
XXXX mentions the account was past due 30 days two or three times. 
XXXX says " not more than three payments past due ''. These descriptions do not match and should be consistent.

5. Account Comments : XXXX specifies " Account Closed by Credit Grantor '', while TransUnion says " Canceled by Credit Grantor ''. Although similar, the wording differs, which could create confusion.

6. Last Reported Date : XXXX lists the reported date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears incorrect since it is a future date. TransUnion and XXXX show XX/XX/XXXX, which seems more accurate. 
7. Credit Limit : All credit bureaus correctly report a credit limit of {$500.00}, so no error is present here.

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 16811 ( 7 ) credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 USC 1601, it is imperative that all credit information provided is accurate and transparent to protect consumer rights As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report. I request that you conduct a more thorough investigation into this matter, particularly considering the following points : 1. Inconsistencies : There are discrepancies among the three credit bureaus regarding this account, including [ list specific inconsistencies ].

2. Verification Issues : According to Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, you are required to verify accounts through original documentation. I request that you provide the supporting documentation you relied upon to verify this account.

3. Consumer Rights : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, if you can not provide adequate documentation to support the validity of this account, you must remove it from my credit report.

4. Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information.

I believe 100 % AND THE PROOF IS ATTACH TO THIS COMPLAINT THAN the bureau has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) in their investigation process.

Specifically, I wish MORE POINT AND VIOLATION HAVE THE TRANSUNION TO MY RIGHT AFTER THE INVESTIGATION THE ACCOUNT HAVE DISCREPACIES AND INNACURATE : 1. Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns.

2. Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation.

3. Duties of Furnishers of Information ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) : The furnishers of the disputed information did not adequately investigate or rectify the inaccuracies after being notified of my dispute, as required by law.

4. Transparency and Accuracy ( TILA, 15 USC 1601 ) : The information provided in my credit report has not been accurate or transparent, violating my consumer rights.

5. Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. Your response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record.

6.

7. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information.

8.

9. 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information.

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Transunion for their failure to comply with the FCRA and TILA. Additionally, This is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Removal of Inaccurate/invalidated credit information, please remove inmediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

I am filing this complaint against XXXX for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : XXXX failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or XXXX, as required by law. 

Impact of the Violation This accounts unauthorized and inaccurate reporting has significantly harmed my creditworthiness, resulting in a lower credit score and negatively affecting my ability to access credit and financial opportunities.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by TRANSUNION .I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER XXXX XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence Letter 1 and Letter 2, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, TRANSUNION has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : TRANSUNION failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 1. Creditor Name : XXXX o Account Number : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

Consumer complaint narrative:
TRANSUNION XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 U

SC Dear TransUnion, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing. Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification.

3. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is filed against XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion for multiple violations of federal law under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and other consumer protection laws. Despite formally disputing 15 fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries on my credit report, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion has failed to act in accordance with their legal obligations. My initial dispute letter included detailed documentation of identity theft and requested the removal and blockage of the fraudulent accounts. As of today, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion has failed to resolve my disputes within the legally mandated timeframes or provide sufficient remedies for their violations. 

The following fraudulent accounts and inquiries remain unresolved and continue to cause harm to my credit profile : Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Original Creditor : XXXX Sprint ) ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : Not Provided ) Unauthorized Credit Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Legal Violations Committed by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and TransUnion : Failure to Investigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion failed to conduct a proper investigation of my disputes within the required 30-day period after receiving notice, in direct violation of FCRA 1681i ( a ).

Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : My credit report continues to contain inaccuracies, including discrepancies in balances, open dates, and payment histories across bureaus, in violation of FCRA 1681e ( b ).

Failure to Block Fraudulent Information After Notice of Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Despite being provided with sufficient evidence of identity theft, including police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion has failed to block the fraudulent accounts and inquiries.

Failure to Provide Timely Written Results of Investigations ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion did not provide written notice of the results of their investigations within the required 30 days. 

Failure to Provide Consumer Resources for Victims of Identity Theft ( XXXX U.S.C. 1681g ( e ) ) : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion neglected to implement fraud alerts or offer guidance and support for identity theft victims, in violation of FTC regulations. 

Failure to Notify of Debt Validation as Required ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Creditors failed to provide debt validation within five days of reporting fraudulent accounts, which XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion has continued to report. 

Failure to Reinvestigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : Despite providing additional documentation to challenge the resolution of prior disputes, XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion has failed to conduct a reinvestigation. 

Violations of Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801 ) : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion failed to safeguard my personal information, as evidenced by the fraudulent accounts and inquiries. 

Relief Requested : I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to hold XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion accountable for their repeated violations of federal law. Specifically, I demand the following remedies : Immediate removal and permanent blockage of all fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries listed above. 

Written confirmation from XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion regarding the removal of fraudulent entries and the provision of updated, corrected copies of my credit report. 

Implementation of fraud alerts on my credit file for additional protection against future identity theft. 

An investigation into how my personal information was compromised and how these accounts were permitted to appear on my credit report. 

Compensation for damages resulting from negligence and noncompliance with federal law, including but not limited to damage to my creditworthiness and emotional distress. 

Issuance of penalties and corrective measures against XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion to ensure compliance with federal regulations. 

Supporting Documentation : Enclosed with this complaint, I have provided the following : Copies of my original dispute letters sent to XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. 

Copies of police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address. 

Documentation of all correspondence with XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion. 

Conclusion : XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion 's failure to comply with federal law and address my disputes in a timely and lawful manner demonstrates willful neglect and reckless disregard for their responsibilities under the FCRA. I request that the CFPB take decisive action to ensure accountability and provide remedies for the harm caused by their noncompliance.

The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. Consumer complaint narrative:
TRANSUNION XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 USC Dear TransUnion, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing.

Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification.

3. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

The repeated failure of TransUnion to adhere to this requirement is a clear violation of 15 U.S. Code 16811 ( 5 ) and has caused me financial harm and distress.

I am requesting that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter and take immediate action against TransUnion for its non-compliance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I am seeking the immediate deletion of the inaccurate account information from my credit report and appropriate measures to ensure that TransUnion upholds its obligations under the law.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to a prompt resolution and your assistance in rectifying this issue.

These inquiries were conducted without my authorization, which violates my rights under federal law.

I demand an investigation into these inquiries as required under the FCRA. If you are unable to verify that these hard inquiries were authorized, you are legally obligated to remove them from my credit report under 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( Procedure in case of disputed accuracy ).

Failure to comply with this request within the legally required 30-day timeframe under the FCRA will result in further action, including filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or seeking legal remedy.

Please send all correspondence to the address listed above. I look forward to your prompt response and resolution of this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) I am submitting this complaint regarding violations of my rights as a consumer under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) by TRANSUNION .I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER XXXX XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. Despite my previous correspondence Letter 1 and Letter 2, which requested the removal of the above-mentioned account due to inaccuracies and failure to validate the information as required by law, TRANSUNION has not conducted a proper investigation nor provided the required documentation. Reasons for Complaint : 1. Violation of the FCRA : o Investigation Requirements ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Your verification response did not include a sufficient description of the investigation process, as required by the FCRA. You failed to adhere to the obligation to provide a thorough and detailed account of the steps taken to verify the information. o Permissible Purposes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681b ( 2 ) ) : The information provided did not comply with the permissible purposes outlined in the FCRA. The verification process failed to meet the established standards for handling and reporting information. o Privacy Rights ( 15 U.S.C. 1681a ( 4 ) ) : The continued inclusion of this bankruptcy record and associated accounts infringes upon my privacy rights. The failure to follow appropriate procedures for handling sensitive information constitutes a violation of this section. o Description of Investigation ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. o Invocation of 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) and 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 2 ) : I am invoking these provisions to request the removal of this account and to demand proof of its verification. The failure to complete this verification constitutes an abuse of my rights. 2. Violation of the TILA : o Disclosure Requirements : TRANSUNION failed to provide accurate and timely disclosures regarding the account status, breaching the TILA requirements. 3. Federal Consumer Protections : o Title 15, Chapter 41 : The failure to provide adequate proof and the apparent disregard for my rights under the FCRA indicate a violation of federal consumer protection laws. o Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. The response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record. Immediate Action Requested : Delete Immediately for Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) : 1. Creditor Name : XXXX o Account Number : XXXX Present below the inaccurate information persistently affecting my credit report.

Follow-Up Dispute Verification - Failure to Comply with FCRA and this is the proof than show the violation Totally all law written to FCRA Section 611, FCDRA AND TILA, DELETE INMEDIATLY THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT : I am writing to formally THIS COMPLAINT the accuracy of information PERSIST IN THE ACCOUNT AND THE bureau has verified on my credit report regarding the following account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number:XXXX While I appreciate your response indicating that the information has been verified, I believe there are still significant inaccuracies that require further investigation. Specifically, 1. Current Balance : XXXX does not report a balance, while TransUnion and XXXX list {$0.00}. This inconsistency creates confusion, as all agencies should show the same balance. 
2. Date Last Active : XXXX reports the last active date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears to be an error since it is a future date. 
TransUnion shows XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX lists XX/XX/XXXX. This discrepancy should be investigated. 
3. Date of Last Payment : XXXX lists the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while TransUnion and XXXX report XX/XX/XXXX. The difference of a few days could be an error if the payments were made simultaneously. 
4. Payment Status : TransUnion states that the account was 60 days past due. 
XXXX mentions the account was past due 30 days two or three times. 
XXXX says " not more than three payments past due ''. These descriptions do not match and should be consistent.

5. Account Comments : XXXX specifies " Account Closed by Credit Grantor '', while TransUnion says " Canceled by Credit Grantor ''. Although similar, the wording differs, which could create confusion.

6. Last Reported Date : XXXX lists the reported date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears incorrect since it is a future date. TransUnion and XXXX show XX/XX/XXXX, which seems more accurate. 
7. Credit Limit : All credit bureaus correctly report a credit limit of {$500.00}, so no error is present here.

Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 16811 ( 7 ) credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 USC 1601, it is imperative that all credit information provided is accurate and transparent to protect consumer rights As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report. I request that you conduct a more thorough investigation into this matter, particularly considering the following points : 1. Inconsistencies : There are discrepancies among the three credit bureaus regarding this account, including [ list specific inconsistencies ].

2. Verification Issues : According to Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, you are required to verify accounts through original documentation. I request that you provide the supporting documentation you relied upon to verify this account.

3. Consumer Rights : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, if you can not provide adequate documentation to support the validity of this account, you must remove it from my credit report.

4. Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information.

I believe 100 % AND THE PROOF IS ATTACH TO THIS COMPLAINT THAN the bureau has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) in their investigation process.

Specifically, I wish MORE POINT AND VIOLATION HAVE THE TRANSUNION TO MY RIGHT AFTER THE INVESTIGATION THE ACCOUNT HAVE DISCREPACIES AND INNACURATE : 1. Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns.

2. Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation.

3. Duties of Furnishers of Information ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) : The furnishers of the disputed information did not adequately investigate or rectify the inaccuracies after being notified of my dispute, as required by law.

4. Transparency and Accuracy ( TILA, 15 USC 1601 ) : The information provided in my credit report has not been accurate or transparent, violating my consumer rights.

5. Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. Your response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record.

6.

7. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information.

8.

9. 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information.

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Transunion for their failure to comply with the FCRA and TILA. Additionally, This is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Removal of Inaccurate/invalidated credit information, please remove inmediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Bureau 's Failure to Conduct Reinvestigation for Account with XXXX XXXX. 

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being.

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) investigate this charge-off and, based on the information provided below, take appropriate action to have it removed. 

The charge-off in question is listed under the account for XXXX, XXXX and Transunion. The charge-off is reported as XX/XX/year>, and it negatively impacts my credit score and my ability to access credit at favorable terms. 

Reason for Dispute : I believe this charge-off was incorrectly reported due to The credit reporting agency did not furnish an account and payment history for XX/XX/year> on my credit report. As a result, I am requesting the removal or correction of this entry, as it no longer accurately reflects the state of my financial obligations. 


I kindly ask that you investigate this matter under the guidelines of the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I am confident that upon review, it will be clear that the charge-off was reported in error, and I request that it be corrected or removed from my credit report. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your timely response and resolution.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act section 1681c2. Block of information resulting from identity theft they must ( a ) Block Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I was taken advantage of due to malpractice while your company broke several laws under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. I recently did an investigation on my credit report and I found invalidated, inaccurate, unverifiable, and questionable items that your company is reporting. Your agency is not reporting 100 % correct information. Under 15 U.S. code 1681e ( b ) ( b ) Accuracy of report whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer report it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual to whom the report relates. For the past two months I've tried to settle this issue with your company via mail however, I have reasonable evidence that your company is only trying to make times harder on me at the moment by not following reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy. 15 USC 1681b ( 2 ) Permissible purposes of consumer reports also validate that anything reporting on my credit report that I did not consent to is fraud. I DID NOT give written or oral consent to any company listed below to disclose any of my nonpublic personal information. As of XX/XX/XXXX I've notified each company XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) that I am using my right to opt out of their reporting on my consumer report. I have a right to privacy and per the Privacy Act of 1974 as a federally protected consumer, I am now revoking any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non-written, verbal, and non-verbal per 5 USC 552a. Per the FCRA as a federally protected consumer I am now opting out of any and all authorization I the consumer may have given you written, non-written, verbal, and non-verbal per 15 USC 6802. I shall also point out their responsibility pursuant to 15 USC section 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) : ( a ) RESPONSIBILITIES OF FURNISHERS OF INFORMATION TO CONSUMER REPORTING AGENCIES. A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person has been notified by the consumer, at the address specified by the person for such notices, that specific information is inaccurate; and ( ii ) the information is, in fact, inaccurate. Your agency along with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is in violation of multiple laws set forth by XXXX in regard to the following individual accounts of the consumer ( myself ). 15 USC 1681a ( 2 ) ( a ) ( I ) states that the consumer report does not include information solely as to transactions or experiences ( payment history, charge-off status ), between the consumer ( myself ) and the creditor ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer ( me ) to any consumer reporting agency ( XXXX, TRANSUNION ) if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX can NOT collect on a discharged debt. These accounts are now considered certificates of indebtedness per the IRS, and income can NOT be reported on a consumer report. The IRS clearly defines a charge-off as gross or ordinary income, INCOME DOES NOT GET REPORTED ON THE CONSUMER REPORT which in fact makes the reporting of these accounts inaccurate! I provided a screenshot from the IRS website. By definition, the IRS clearly says a canceled debt or charge-off is income. The reporting of these accounts are inaccurate. To further validate that these accounts have been charged-off by each company with the IRS, I received a copy B of each company 's XXXX filing with the IRS and I've attached each copy as evidence. According to my consumer report and the XXXX filings with the IRS by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  each company has received a profit loss tax write off as a benefit of reporting debts greater than {$600.00}. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has obviously written the debt off with the IRS so they should no longer be reporting these accounts on my consumer report, by doing so they're committing tax fraud. They've already filed the required forms with the IRS to notify them that they've took a profit loss, yet these accounts are still reporting these accounts on my consumer report. Maybe XXXX and TRANSUNION XXXX think XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  hasn't actually written off the debt attached to the accounts. If that is the case per 1681s-2 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ( ii ) these accounts are inaccurately reporting and should be removed immediately. According to my XXXX credit file on XX/XX/XXXX XXXX removed the same accounts that XXXX and TRANSUNION are currently reporting XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX I have attached a copy of the credit report from XXXX that shows the account has been removed. I request that you immediately remove these account from my credit report. Pursuant to 15 USC 6802 ( 1 ) ( c ) companies must not disclose any of my personal information unless I was given an explanation on how I can exercise a non-disclosure option, I am supposed to be notified of my eligibility to opt-out every thirty days. 16 CFR 313.7 ( f ) states there is a continuing right to opt-out, and a consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I've never been notified that I'm eligible to opt out. This is a violation of 15 USC 6802. Obligations with respect respect to disclosure of personal information. Pursuant to 15 USC 6801 ( a ) " It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers ' nonpublic personal information. '' Pursuant to 15 USC 6801 ( a ) " nonpublic personal information '' means personally identifiable financial information provided by a consumer to a financial institution ; resulting from any transaction with the consumer or any service performed for the consumer.

I have enclosed a copy my Police Report/FTC identity theft report ( FTC REPORT NUMBER : XXXX ) to support my identity theft claim. Under 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 when a consumer submits an identity theft report, credit reporting agencies must block any information identified by the consumer as resulting from identity theft within four business days. 
To following information on my credit report is the result of identity theft and should be blocked : Accounts : XXXX XXXX Inquiries : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XX/XX/year> As required by 15 U.S.C 1681c-2, please block this fraudulent information from my credit report immediately. This information should be blocked for one year, at which point i may request an extension of the block. During the block, you may not report no longer contains any fraudulent information. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Here I add the FTC report, hoping that you make a better decision in my situation, thank you

Consumer complaint narrative: I AM THE VICTIM OF IDENTITY THEFT AND THE FOLLOWING DATA MUST BE BLOCKED WITHIN 3 BUSINESS DAYS : This correspondence serves as a formal demand for the removal of inaccurate and unverifiable information from my credit reports, in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692 et seq. Please consider this letter as a notification of violations and a request for immediate action. XXXX. Disputed Accounts XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX The information associated with this account is inaccurate and unverifiable. I request that this account be removed from my credit report immediately. Collection Account Error Collection Account Number : XXXX XXXX Alleged Debt : {$550.00} The alleged debt does not list a valid creditor and is therefore unverifiable and fraudulent. This entry must be removed from my credit report. XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number : XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX Alleged Debt : {$130.00} Given the lack of proper debt validation, this account should be removed immediately. 2. Violations of Consumer Protection Laws The inclusion of the aforementioned accounts in my credit report constitutes a violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) which prohibits the inclusion of unverifiable or inaccurate information in consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1692k ( d ) ( FDCPA ) which mandates compliance with debt validation and verification requirements. Due to these violations, I am entitled to {$1000.00} in damages for each instance of willful non-compliance. Given the nature of these inaccuracies, I am seeking a total of {$3000.00} in damages. 3. Disputed Inquiries The following inquiries are also disputed for accuracy and must be removed in accordance with 15 U.S.C. 1681 : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. Legal Consequences and Remedies Please be advised that your failure to address these disputes within the statutory time frame will compel me to pursue legal action. This may include initiating a civil suit for damages and seeking enforcement through legal channels. Your prompt attention to correcting and removing the disputed information is required to avoid further legal proceedings. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide written confirmation of the actions taken to address these disputes. I expect a response in compliance with the FCRA requirements. Thank you for your immediate attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bureau 's Failure to Conduct Reinvestigation for Account with XXXX XXXX. 

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). The credit bureau has failed to remove a late payment from my account with XXXX XXXX the necessary steps are being taken on my part to rectify this incorrect information. 

I recently disputed the presence of late payment on my XXXX XXXX account XXXX, which has been negatively impacting my credit history. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being. 

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.
