Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute several fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent and remain reported in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my valid identity theft report, XXXX has unlawfully refused to investigate and remove these accounts, further compounding their violations. 

The accounts and inquiries in question are : Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( TransUnion, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( TransUnion ) XXXX Account : XXXX ( TransUnion, XXXX ) XXXX Account : XXXX XXXX TransUnion, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( TransUnion ) IXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX ( TransUnion XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( TransUnion ) XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX ( TransUnion ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX has responded to my dispute with an automated email falsely claiming that my identity theft report and supporting evidence are invalid, stating : " We are responding to your request that information in your personal credit report be blocked due to identity theft. Based on our review of your request and the information available to us, we have determined that either : your request to block was made in error, or, your request to block information was based on a material misrepresentation, or, you knowingly obtained or should have known that you obtained possession of goods, services, or moneys as a result of one or more of the transactions that you are seeking to block. '' This response is both baseless and illegal. I have complied with all legal requirements, including submitting a valid identity theft affidavit. XXXX refusal to block or remove these accounts violates several provisions of federal law : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Blocking Information Resulting from Identity Theft : Credit reporting agencies are legally required to block information stemming from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation. XXXX 's failure to comply directly violates this statute. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting : Reporting fraudulent accounts for which I did not authorize the furnishing of data violates permissible purposes under federal law. 

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Reinvestigation of Disputed Information : XXXX is required to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of disputes. Refusing to investigate and relying on automated responses demonstrates clear noncompliance. 

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of XXXX : XXXX is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. Allowing fraudulent accounts and inquiries to remain on my credit report violates this provision. 

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : XXXX refusal to address valid disputes constitutes willful noncompliance, making them liable for civil damages. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : The entities reporting these fraudulent accounts have also failed in their legal duty to provide accurate and verified information. 

Conclusion XXXX  ongoing failure to comply with federal law and their reliance on automated denials are unacceptable and unlawful. I urge the CFPB to investigate XXXX  conduct and hold them accountable for their violations of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) NO WRITTEN CONSCENT This complaint addresses serious and ongoing violations of federal consumer protection laws due to the unauthorized sharing and furnishing of my personal, private, and financial information to non-affiliated third parties without my explicit written consent and in the absence of required disclosures. The recently discovered that my personal and financial information was shared with third parties, including entities that I did not authorize or consent to carries significant ramifications. This disclosure occurred without my prior knowledge or written consent, and I was not provided with any opportunity to opt-out or control how my data was shared. Despite my right to privacy under state and federal law, these actions were taken without my permission, and I have suffered from the unauthorized exposure of my financial information. 

The violations of law include, but are not limited to : The Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), The Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ), The XXXX XXXX XXXX Reform and Consumer Protection Act, The Federal Trade Commission Act ( FTCA ), The Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ), The Right to Financial Privacy Act ( RFPA ), The Consumer Credit Protection Act ( CCPA ), The Privacy Act of 1974, and State consumer protection laws.

Details of Violations : 1. Violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681b : My consumer report was furnished to unauthorized, non-affiliated third parties without a permissible purpose or my explicit written consent.

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( a ) : The respondent failed to implement reasonable procedures to ensure my data was only shared with authorized parties, I have given no authorizatioins.

15 U.S.C. 1681g : I was not provided a complete disclosure of the entities with whom my report was shared.

15 U.S.C. 1681w ( FACTA Disposal Rule ) : Sensitive consumer data was mishandled and not adequately protected.

The reporting of late payments on my credit report violates 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 of the FCRA. I have not provided express written consent to furnishers or credit reporting agencies ( CRAs ) to share my private information with third parties or non-affiliated entities. Additionally, pursuant to Section 623 ( a ) ( 7 ) of the FCRA, financial institutions are required to notify consumers in writing before furnishing negative information to a nationwide consumer reporting agency.

Account in Question
: CROSSCOUNTRY, Account # XXXX I have never received the statutorily required notice of negative reporting from this furnisher. As such, this accounts reporting is non-compliant and inaccurate. I request its immediate deletion under Section 623 ( b ) ( 1 ) ( E ) of the FCRA.

2. Violations of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1692c ( b ) : Unauthorized communication of my financial information occurred with non-affiliated third parties, violating the FDCPAs prohibition on third-party disclosures.

3. Violations of the Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( GLBA ) : 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( a ) : My nonpublic personal information ( NPI ) was shared without my written consent.

15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) : I was not given an opportunity to opt-out of data sharing.

15 U.S.C. 6803 : Required privacy notices were not provided, denying me transparency regarding how my data would be used.

4. Violations of the Dodd-Frank Act ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 and 5536 ) : The unauthorized sharing of my data constitutes unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( UDAAPs ), including : Unfair practices : Exposing me to identity theft, fraud, and other substantial risks without my consent.

Violations of federal consumer financial laws ( FCRA, FDCPA, GLBA ).

5. Violations of the Federal Trade Commission Act ( FTCA ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 45, the unauthorized sharing of my private data constitutes an unfair and deceptive act in commerce.

6. Violations of the Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1681w : Sensitive consumer information was not properly safeguarded or disposed of, risking unauthorized access.

15 U.S.C. 1681c-1 : Adequate safeguards were not implemented to ensure the confidentiality of my data.

7. Violations of the Right to Financial Privacy Act ( RFPA ) The respondent failed to comply with principles requiring explicit consumer consent prior to sharing financial information with unauthorized parties.

8. Violations of the Consumer Credit Protection Act ( CCPA ) : The unauthorized handling and sharing of my financial data undermine the principles of fairness and transparency required by the CCPA.

9. Violations of the Privacy Act of 1974 : The failure to safeguard or obtain consent prior to sharing private data violates foundational privacy principles codified in the Privacy Act.

10. State Consumer Protection Laws : Californias California Consumer Privacy Act ( CCPA ) requires explicit consumer consent for sharing private information.

New Yorks SHIELD Act mandates safeguards to prevent unauthorized access to sensitive data.

Florida Deceptive and Unfair Trade Practices Act ( FDUTPA ) : Section 501.204 of the Florida Statutes prohibits unfair or deceptive trade practices, including the unauthorized disclosure of personal or financial information. The credit reporting agencies involved have shared my personal information without my consent, constituting a deceptive or unfair practice under this law.

Floridas Financial Privacy Protection Act : This law restricts financial institutions and businesses from disclosing
nonpublic personal information to third parties without prior written consent. The sharing of my private financial data by these credit agencies without my authorization directly violates this statute.

Floridas Information Protection Act ( FIPA ) : Under FIPA, businesses are required to protect personal and financial information from unauthorized access or disclosure. The credit reporting agencies ' actions in disclosing my sensitive data to third parties without my consent violate this law, and they have failed to notify me in the event of any breach or unauthorized use. 



Supporting Legal Precedent : The following Supreme Court decisions further affirm my constitutional right to privacy and data protection : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Establishes privacy as a fundamental right. 

XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Individuals have a right to control the disclosure of personal and financial information. 

XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) : Limits unauthorized sharing of consumer credit data under the FCRA. 



Requested Resolution To resolve this complaint, I demand the immediate removal of the disputed account and any associated records from my consumer file. Additionally : A complete disclosure of all third parties to whom my information was furnished ( under 15 U.S.C. 1681g ). 

Confirmation that all unauthorized disclosures have ceased, and procedures have been implemented to prevent future violations. 

Produce the letter with my Bonafide wet ink signature giving explicit written consent to the communication and furnishing of my personal, private, non-public, financial information with non-affiliated third parties.

If a letter with my Bonafide wet ink signature giving explicit written consent to the communication and furnishing of my personal, private, non-public information and financial information with non-affiliated third parties can not be produced then the credit reporting agency must remove the account in question immediately.

Conclusion The respondents conduct violates multiple federal and state statutes, exposes me to significant harm, and infringes on my right to privacy. I urge the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to take immediate action to address these violations and enforce the removal of this account. 

I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
TRANSUNION XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, IL XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 USC Dear TransUnion, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing.

Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification.

3. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Consumer complaint narrative: Foolishly, on XX/XX/XXXX I opened a Robinhood account hoping to buy the crypto currency XRP. I had already felt I was a week to XXXX weeks behind a good buying opportunity, but I transferred {$5000.00} into my newly created account on XX/XX/XXXX. By the time that money arrived, nearly a week later on XX/XX/XXXX, I felt like my buying opportunity had past, and I immediately transferred {$3000.00} of the {$5000.00} back into my savings account. With the remaining {$2000.00} I purchased XXXX. Robinhood flagged this as " suspicious '' activity, and locked my account. They requested I submit a virtual selfie through their app of the front, left, and right sides of my face, as well as a virtual scan of the front and back of my ID. This made me extremely nervous to be submitting this online, through an app, with absolutely no human to speak to on their end to assure me my identity wouldn't be stolen somehow by doing this. When I realized this supposedly reputable trading app has absolutely no customer service department to speak with, and their virtual " customer support '' doesn't respond either ( you just type a message and send it, and no response comes back to you ), I knew I was in trouble. Regardless, I submitted the ID requested in an effort to have my remaining funds unlocked so I could transfer them back to my savings account. After I completed this on XX/XX/XXXX or XXXX, it said, " No further action is required, your account is under a review. A decision will be made regarding your account on ____ '' Each day, it said the decision would be made the following day, and each new day nothing happened and the date moved to the next day. That was a week ago. I decided to research online, and found this can drag on for months with Robinhood, so I decided to reach out to you guys for help. I merely want to eat my {$200.00} loss, and transfer the remaining {$1800.00} back into my savings account, and close this Robinhood account for good.

Product: Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a customer/consumer of the financial institution Synchrony Bank and its subsidiaries/parents/affiliates/etc.

PRIVACY Title 15 U.S. Code 6801 states, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information, and that the financial institution shall protect against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. Synchrony Bank is a financial institution by definition in this Title, and its failure to abide by privacy laws has both harmed and inconvenienced me ( Attachments 2 through 5 ). 

I provided opt out instructions to Synchrony Bank on XX/XX/year> via the online messaging center in my accounts portal. Attachment 1 shows the opt out instruction, though Synchrony 's print feature did not print the full instruction. My instructions were not complied with, as evidenced by Attachments 2, 3, and 4, which are consumer reports showing my account information reported after the date of my opt out notice. Synchrony Bank continued to report my personal information after receiving my opt out notice, which violated my consumer privacy rights.

12 CFR 1016.7 ( h ) states, " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am now elaborating on my original instruction to eliminate ambiguity. Synchrony Bank does not have my consent to, and shall not, report, share, sell, give, or otherwise transfer my nonpublic personal information, from the date of XX/XX/year>, to a non-affiliated third party or credit reporting agency. The furnishing of my information after that date is unlawful and is required to be removed ; inclusive of, but not limited to, balances, amounts, late payments, status, remarks, comments, highest balance, updated dates, last payment dates, etc.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Innovis is violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Innovis is reporting adverse items on my XXXX XXXX XXXX  account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. Innovis is reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. Innovis is also reporting a {$8100.00} charge off which according to the IRS publication 4681, a charge off is considered income and may not be reported as debt. The account has been charged off as witnessed by the report. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. Innovis does not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to Innovis and XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, and Innovis is the reporting agency and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the financial institution, and Innovis, the consumer reporting agency, DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am opting out of your reporting services for this account and ALL FUTURE ACCOUNTS.

Despite this, the aforementioned creditors have continued to report late payments after charging off the accounts. This practice is both inaccurate and misleading.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, IL XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX SS # XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) XXXX XXXX XXXX, IA XXXX RE : Formal Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting Dear CFPB, I am submitting this formal complaint to address several inaccuracies on my credit reports furnished by XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX. These accounts violate multiple federal statutes, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), and related regulations. I request an investigation into these violations and immediate correction or removal of the inaccurate entries. 
Accounts in Dispute and Specific Inaccuracies : XXXX. XXXX, XXXX * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Discrepancy in the " High Credit '' amount : {$27000.00} ( XXXX XXXX vs. {$990.00} ( XXXX ). 
* Reporting of " Collection/Chargeoff '' status despite a {$0.00} balance. 
* Comments indicating contradictory statuses : " Charged off as bad debt '' vs. " Account transferred or sold. '' XXXX. XXXX * Account Number : XXXX * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Reporting of a " Collection/Chargeoff '' status despite a {$0.00} balance. 
* Comments indicate the account is both " Paid charge off '' and " Transferred or sold, '' creating conflicting information. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) * Account Type : Installment * Issues : * Discrepancy in the " Date Opened '' : XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX XXXX vs. XX/XX/XXXX ( XXXX ). 
* Comments include conflicting resolutions : " Consumer disputes this account information '' vs. " Resolved by data furnisher. '' XXXX. XXXX * Account Numbers : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) * Account Type : Revolving * Issues : * Discrepancy in " High Credit '' amounts : {$3000.00} ( XXXX ) vs. {$2100.00} ( XXXX ). 
* Contradictory comments : " Dispute resolved ; customer disagrees '' vs. " Consumer disputes after resolution. '' * Incorrect reporting of " 120 days late '' in payment history despite ongoing dispute. 
Violations of Federal Law : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : * 1681e ( b ) : Failure to ensure maximum possible accuracy.

* 1681i : Failure to conduct a reasonable investigation upon dispute.

* 1681s-2 ( b ) : Furnishing inaccurate information despite prior disputes.

2. Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) : * 1692e : Use of false or misleading representations in reporting debts.

* 1692g : Failure to validate debts upon request.

3. Unfair and Deceptive Practices : * Misreporting account statuses and payment histories constitutes unfair and deceptive practices under federal consumer protection laws.

Actions Requested : 1. Immediate Removal of Inaccuracies : * All disputed accounts must be corrected or removed from my credit reports due to the failure to meet the accuracy standards under FCRA. 
2. Investigation and Enforcement : * Investigate the actions of the furnishers ( XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX, and XXXX  ) and the credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, Equifax ) for potential violations of federal law. 
3. Validation of Debt : * Require furnishers to provide proper documentation validating their claims, including original account agreements and proof of accuracy.

4. Cease and Desist Misreporting : * Ensure furnishers and credit bureaus implement safeguards to prevent future misreporting.

Conclusion : The inaccuracies and legal violations associated with these accounts undermine the integrity of the credit reporting system and harm my financial standing. I urge the CFPB to take immediate corrective action and hold the responsible parties accountable.

Please provide updates regarding this complaint at the earliest convenience. I am available to supply additional documentation if needed.

These inquiries violate federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681b, which mandates permissible purpose requirements for accessing consumer credit reports. The following inquiries are disputed : Unauthorized Inquiries : XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : Equifax, XXXX Category : Mortgage Companies - XXXX XXXX XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : Equifax, XXXX Category : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Credit Unions XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Auto Financing  XXXX Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category XXXX Auto Financing XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Auto Financing XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Auto Dealers, New XXXX  Date : XX/XX/XXXX Reported by : XXXX Category : Bank Credit Cards Violations of Federal Law : Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : 15 U.S.C. 1681b : Credit reports may only be accessed for a permissible purpose, such as a credit transaction initiated by the consumer.

These inquiries were not authorized by me, and I did not initiate any credit transactions related to these entities.

Unfair and Deceptive Practices : Unauthorized inquiries negatively impact my credit score and constitute an unfair practice under consumer protection laws.

Actions Requested : Immediate Removal of Unauthorized Inquiries : All inquiries listed above must be removed from my credit reports due to the lack of permissible purpose and authorization.

Investigation and Enforcement : Investigate the actions of the entities that accessed my credit reports and ensure compliance with FCRA requirements.

Safeguards Against Future Violations : Implement measures to prevent unauthorized access to my credit file. 

Conclusion : These unauthorized inquiries harm my credit standing and violate my rights under federal law. I urge the CFPB to take immediate corrective action to ensure compliance and protect consumers from similar violations. 
Thank you for your attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Equifax XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Department YOU BROKE THE LAW After several attempts to resolve this very serious issue and concern with Equifax this correspondence serves as a formal demand for Equifax to comply with its legal obligations under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and other applicable federal laws. As a consumer, I assert my rights under these statutes and demand that Equifax immediately cease and desist from reporting any nonpublic personal information or adverse account information without my explicit written consent. 
Legal Basis for My Demand : 1. Right to Privacy and Fair Treatment Pursuant to 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 602 ( a ), consumer reporting agencies, including Equifax, have a statutory obligation to exercise their responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and respect for the consumers right to privacy. The Supreme Court has emphasized the importance of protecting privacy in TransUnion LLC v. Ramirez, 141 S. Ct. 2190 ( 2021 ), ruling that consumers have standing to challenge violations of their rights under the FCRA when their private information is used improperly. 
2. Nonpublic Personal Information Disclosure Under 15 U.S.C. 6801, Congress has declared a continuing obligation for financial institutions to protect the privacy of their customers by safeguarding nonpublic personal information. As a financial institution providing information to credit reporting agencies, Equifax must comply with these obligations. Furthermore, Safeco Insurance Co. of America v. Burr, 551 U.S. 47 ( 2007 ) clarifies that willful noncompliance with FCRA provisions may result in liability. 
3. Lack of Written Consent Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ), consumer reporting agencies may furnish a consumer report only with the written consent of the consumer. No such written consent exists, and any prior consent is hereby expressly revoked. FTC v. Accusearch Inc., 570 F.3d 1187 ( 10th Cir. 2009 ) supports the principle that unauthorized dissemination of consumer information constitutes a violation of federal law. 
4. Right to Opt-Out The Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act, 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) - ( c ), prohibits financial institutions from disclosing nonpublic personal information to unaffiliated third parties without informing the consumer of their right to opt out. Equifax has failed to inform me of this right, a violation underscored by 12 CFR 1016.7, which allows consumers to opt out at any time. I hereby exercise my right to opt out of all reporting services. 
5. Adverse Information Reporting Per 15 U.S.C. 1681c ( a ) ( 5 ), consumer reporting agencies are prohibited from reporting adverse items of information, other than records of convictions, that are more than seven years old. The inclusion of such information without my consent is unlawful and was addressed in Spokeo, Inc. v. Robins, 578 U.S. 330 ( 2016 ), which held that violations of procedural requirements under the FCRA can harm consumers concrete interests. 
6. Accuracy of Information Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ), entities furnishing information to consumer reporting agencies must ensure its accuracy. Equifaxs failure to verify the accuracy of information constitutes noncompliance. Furthermore, 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) mandates that consumer reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information reported. The lack of adherence to these requirements is actionable under Dalton v. Capital Associated Industries , Inc., 257 F.3d 409 ( 4th Cir. 2001 ).

Demands : 1. Immediate Cessation of Reporting Equifax must cease reporting any nonpublic personal information or adverse account information concerning me without my written consent, in compliance with 15 U.S.C. 1681 and 15 U.S.C. 6802.

2. Verification of Compliance Provide written confirmation of your compliance with this demand within 30 days of receipt of this letter. Failure to comply will result in legal action, including but not limited to filing complaints with federal regulatory agencies and pursuing litigation under the FCRA. 
3. Correction of Inaccurate Information Immediately investigate and remove any inaccurate or unverifiable information in my credit report in accordance with your obligations under 15 U.S.C. 1681i.

The following inaccurate and unverified information MUST be removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX This letter constitutes my final demand for compliance. Failure to adhere to these demands will leave me no choice but to pursue all available legal remedies. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX, A consumer a natural living man

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year>XXXX  To whom this may concern : I am writing to update/correct my personal information on my credit file I dont wish to have any telephone number on my report. 

Under consumer law, credit bureaus reporting old or outdated addresses may violate provisions of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). The relevant sections are : 1. FCRA Section 1681e ( b ) : Accuracy of Information Credit bureaus are required to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports. Reporting an old or incorrect address could violate this provision if it misrepresents your current address and affects your credit profile. 

2. FCRA Section 1681i ( a ) : Dispute Process You have the right to dispute inaccurate or outdated information, including old addresses, with the credit bureau. Once you file a dispute, the bureau must investigate and correct or delete inaccurate information, typically within 30 days.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute several fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent and remain reported in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my valid identity theft report, XXXX has unlawfully refused to investigate and remove these accounts, further compounding their violations. 

The accounts and inquiries in question are : Accounts XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has responded to my dispute with an automated email falsely claiming that my identity theft report and supporting evidence are invalid, stating : " We are responding to your request that information in your personal credit report be blocked due to identity theft. Based on our review of your request and the information available to us, we have determined that either : your request to block was made in error, or, your request to block information was based on a material misrepresentation, or, you knowingly obtained or should have known that you obtained possession of goods, services, or moneys as a result of one or more of the transactions that you are seeking to block. '' This response is both baseless and illegal. I have complied with all legal requirements, including submitting a valid identity theft affidavit. XXXX refusal to block or remove these accounts violates several provisions of federal law : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Blocking Information Resulting from Identity Theft : Credit reporting agencies are legally required to block information stemming from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation. XXXX 's failure to comply directly violates this statute. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting : Reporting fraudulent accounts for which I did not authorize the furnishing of data violates permissible purposes under federal law.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Reinvestigation of Disputed Information : XXXX is required to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of disputes. Refusing to investigate and relying on automated responses demonstrates clear noncompliance. 

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports : XXXX is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. Allowing fraudulent accounts and inquiries to remain on my credit report violates this provision. 

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : XXXX refusal to address valid disputes constitutes willful noncompliance, making them liable for civil damages. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : The entities reporting these fraudulent accounts have also failed in their legal duty to provide accurate and verified information. 

Conclusion XXXX  ongoing failure to comply with federal law and their reliance on automated denials are unacceptable and unlawful. I urge the CFPB to investigate XXXX  conduct and hold them accountable for their violations of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Product: Prepaid card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing a formal complaint against Bank of America for their mishandling of my claim involving fraudulent and unauthorized charges to my EDD benefits account. Despite providing all required documentation to verify that I am a victim of identity theft, Bank of America has repeatedly dismissed my claim without conducting a proper investigation, in violation of federal regulations and their own {$0.00} Liability Policy. 

The fraudulent charges occurred shortly after deposits were made to my account. I have submitted the following documentation to Bank of America to support my claim : Identity theft report from the FTC. 
Government-issued identification. 
Additional supporting documents verifying that I did not authorize or make the transactions in question. 

Despite this, Bank of America has denied my claims, citing the proximity of the withdrawals to the deposits as justification. Additionally, they provided me with documentation showing the dates and times of deposits and withdrawals to the account. However, this information does not validate or justify denying my claim. Simply providing transaction history does not constitute a proper investigation. For Bank of America to deny issuing a refund, they must provide evidence and proof that these charges were not fraudulent or unauthorized. 

Instead of fulfilling their obligation to investigate thoroughly, Bank of America has repeatedly sent me generic responses and advised me to contact EDD for a refund. This response is not only dismissive but also unethical, as EDD can not process refunds for funds already distributed to Bank of America. 

Key Concerns : 1. Violation of Regulation E ( Electronic Fund Transfers Act ) : Bank of America has failed to conduct a proper investigation as required under Regulation E, which mandates that financial institutions resolve claims of unauthorized transactions. 
2. Failure to Honor {$0.00} Liability Policy : Bank of Americas advertised {$0.00} Liability Policy for unauthorized charges has not been honored, leaving me unfairly responsible for fraudulent activity. 
3. Inadequate Investigation : Providing transaction history or dates and times of withdrawals does not prove the legitimacy of these charges. A proper investigation should include evidence and proof that the transactions were authorized by me. 
4. Harmful Financial Impact : This unresolved issue has caused me significant hardship, including eviction and denial of housing opportunities, directly resulting from Bank of Americas failure to address this fraudulent activity.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of Incorrect Information on Credit Report To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally dispute inaccuracies on my credit report. These errors, as furnished by the creditors listed below, violate the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). I am requesting the CFPBs assistance to ensure these matters are thoroughly investigated and that the information is corrected or removed if it can not be substantiated. 

Disputed Accounts and Issues 1. XXXX  XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is reported as a charge-off with {$460.00} written off and past due as of XX/XX/XXXX. These details appear inconsistent with my payment history and balance updates. 

Request : Verify the payment history, balance, and charge-off status. Remove or correct any discrepancies if substantiation is lacking. 

XXXX. XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is listed as repossessed with an {$8100.00} balance past due. However, the payment history and status updates are unclear and inconsistent with my records. 

On or around XX/XX/XXXX, I was involved in a severe car accident while completing a XXXX delivery. The vehicle was rear-ended, causing serious neck and back injuries that left me unable to work or generate income. The car remained at the repair facility for approximately 1.5 months while the at-fault partys insurance processed the claim and handled repairs. 

During this time, I contacted XXXX Customer Service to explain my situation and request assistance due to these extenuating circumstances. Despite my efforts to keep them informed, XXXX attempted to repossess the vehicle from the repair facility. I managed to make a payment to delay the repossession temporarily, but the vehicle was ultimately repossessed in XX/XX/XXXX. 

Request : 1. Validate the reported payment history, repossession status, and balance.

2. Provide documentation detailing the accounts payment history, repossession procedures, and any charges or balances resulting from the repossession. 

XXXX. Remove or correct any inaccuracies or unverifiable information in compliance with the FCRA. 

XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account reflects a past due balance of {$80.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, alongside delinquencies that do not align with my records. 

Request : Investigate and verify the reported payment history and past due amounts. Remove unverifiable information. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is listed as charged-off with {$220.00} past due. However, prior dispute attempts have not resolved discrepancies in the payment history or charge-off details. 

Request : Reinvestigate and correct any errors in the charge-off or payment records. 

XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account No. XXXX ) Issue : The account is inaccurately listed as a charge-off. Additionally, I have never signed an agreement with XXXX XXXX XXXX. My original contract was with XXXX XXXX XXXX, and there is no documentation proving my obligation to XXXX. 

Request : 1. Confirm the accuracy of the charge-off status, payment history, and balance.

2. Remove unverifiable information, as required under : 15 USC 1666b : Billing error correction.

15 USC 1681i : Credit reporting dispute requirements.

15 USC 1681s-2 : Obligations of furnishers to report accurate data.

UCC 9, Part 6 : Repossession compliance.

Summary of Concerns Many of these accounts reference prior disputes that failed to produce conclusive evidence or rectifications. The inaccuracies harm my credit profile and fail to meet the FCRAs requirements for accurate, complete, and verifiable reporting.

Requested Actions 1. Ensure each disputed account is thoroughly reinvestigated.

2. Remove or correct any unverifiable or inaccurate information.

3. Require furnishers to provide documentation supporting their reporting or correct the records as necessary.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. Please keep me updated on the progress of your investigation and any actions taken to resolve these disputes. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear CFPB, I am writing to formally dispute several fraudulent accounts and inquiries appearing on my credit reports. These accounts were opened without my authorization or consent and remain reported in violation of federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). Despite my valid identity theft report, XXXX has unlawfully refused to investigate and remove these accounts, further compounding their violations. 

The accounts in question are : Accounts XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX, XXXX, XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Account XXXX XXXX ( Equifax ) XXXX XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX XXXX Equifax, XXXX ) XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX XXXX XXXX, Equifax ) XXXX XXXX Account : XXXX ( XXXX, Equifax, XXXX ) Experians Unlawful Conduct XXXX has responded to my dispute with an automated email falsely claiming that my identity theft report and supporting evidence are invalid, stating : " We are responding to your request that information in your personal credit report be blocked due to identity theft. Based on our review of your request and the information available to us, we have determined that either : your request to block was made in error, or, your request to block information was based on a material misrepresentation, or, you knowingly obtained or should have known that you obtained possession of goods, services, or moneys as a result of one or more of the transactions that you are seeking to block. '' This response is both baseless and illegal. I have complied with all legal requirements, including submitting a valid identity theft affidavit. XXXX refusal to block or remove these accounts violates several provisions of federal law : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 Blocking Information Resulting from Identity Theft : Credit reporting agencies are legally required to block information stemming from identity theft upon receipt of appropriate documentation. XXXX 's failure to comply directly violates this statute. 

15 U.S.C. 1681b ( f ) Permissible Purposes for Reporting : Reporting fraudulent accounts for which I did not authorize the furnishing of data violates permissible purposes under federal law.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) Reinvestigation of Disputed Information : XXXX is required to perform a reasonable reinvestigation of disputes. Refusing to investigate and relying on automated responses demonstrates clear noncompliance. 

15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) Accuracy of Reports : XXXX is obligated to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the data they report. Allowing fraudulent accounts to remain on my credit report violates this provision. 

15 U.S.C. 1681n Civil Liability for Willful Noncompliance : XXXX refusal to address valid disputes constitutes willful noncompliance, making them liable for civil damages. 

15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( a ) Responsibilities of Furnishers of Information : The entities reporting these fraudulent accounts have also failed in their legal duty to provide accurate and verified information. 

Conclusion Experians ongoing failure to comply with federal law and their reliance on automated denials are unacceptable and unlawful. I urge the CFPB to investigate Experians conduct and hold them accountable for their violations of the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is filed against XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX for multiple violations of federal law under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq., and other consumer protection laws. Despite formally disputing 15 fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries on my credit report, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX has failed to act in accordance with their legal obligations. My initial dispute letter included detailed documentation of identity theft and requested the removal and blockage of the fraudulent accounts. As of today, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX has failed to resolve my disputes within the legally mandated timeframes or provide sufficient remedies for their violations. 

The following fraudulent accounts and inquiries remain unresolved and continue to cause harm to my credit profile : Fraudulent Accounts : XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX Original Creditor : XXXX XXXX  ) ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) DPT EDXXXX ( Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXXXXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( Account Number : XXXX ) XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( Account Number : Not Provided ) Unauthorized Credit Inquiries : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Legal Violations Committed by XXXX XXXX Equifax XXXX and XXXX : XXXX to Investigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ) : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX failed to conduct a proper investigation of my disputes within the required 30-day period after receiving notice, in direct violation of FCRA 1681i ( a ).

Failure to Ensure Maximum Possible Accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : My credit report continues to contain inaccuracies, including discrepancies in balances, open dates, and payment histories across bureaus, in violation of FCRA 1681e ( b ).

Failure to Block Fraudulent Information After Notice of Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ) : Despite being provided with sufficient evidence of identity theft, including police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX has failed to block the fraudulent accounts and inquiries.

Failure to Provide Timely Written Results of Investigations ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX did not provide written notice of the results of their investigations within the required 30 days. 

Failure to Provide Consumer Resources for Victims of Identity Theft ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ( e ) ) : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX neglected to implement fraud alerts or offer guidance and support for identity theft victims, in violation of FTC regulations. 

Failure to Notify of Debt Validation as Required ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : Creditors failed to provide debt validation within five days of reporting fraudulent accounts, which XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX has continued to report. 

Failure to Reinvestigate Disputes ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 6 ) ) : Despite providing additional documentation to challenge the resolution of prior disputes, XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX has failed to conduct a reinvestigation. 

Violations of Gramm-Leach-Bliley Act ( 15 U.S.C. 6801 ) : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX failed to safeguard my personal information, as evidenced by the fraudulent accounts and inquiries. 

Relief Requested : I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) take immediate action to hold XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX accountable for their repeated violations of federal law. Specifically, I demand the following remedies : Immediate removal and permanent blockage of all fraudulent accounts and unauthorized credit inquiries listed above. 

Written confirmation from XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding the removal of fraudulent entries and the provision of updated, corrected copies of my credit report. 

Implementation of fraud alerts on my credit file for additional protection against future identity theft. 

An investigation into how my personal information was compromised and how these accounts were permitted to appear on my credit report. 

Compensation for damages resulting from negligence and noncompliance with federal law, including but not limited to damage to my creditworthiness and emotional distress. 

Issuance of penalties and corrective measures against XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX to ensure compliance with federal regulations. 

Supporting Documentation : Enclosed with this complaint, I have provided the following : Copies of my original dispute letters sent to XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. 

Copies of police reports and FTC identity theft affidavits. 

A copy of my government-issued ID and proof of address. 

Documentation of all correspondence with XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX. 

Conclusion : XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX 's failure to comply with federal law and address my disputes in a timely and lawful manner demonstrates willful neglect and reckless disregard for their responsibilities under the FCRA. I request that the CFPB take decisive action to ensure accountability and provide remedies for the harm caused by their noncompliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please do not hesitate to contact me should you require further details or documentation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

I am concerned that my identity has been trafficked or otherwise exploited for fraudulent purposes, including the unauthorized creation of accounts and use of false addresses in my name. This report highlights the fraudulent activity that violates my consumer rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and may be related to broader human trafficking or organized identity theft. 
Summary of Fraudulent Activity : Upon reviewing my credit reports as of XX/XX/XXXX, I discovered the following fraudulent activities that are indicative of identity theft. This information has likely been misused without my knowledge or consent. I suspect that these fraudulent actions may be linked to human trafficking or organized identity exploitation. Below is a list of fraudulent accounts and non-mailable addresses that have been reported under my identity. 
Fraudulent Non-Mailable Addresses The following addresses, which I have no knowledge of, appear on my credit report and are being used to further fraudulent activities. These addresses are non-mailable and have no connection to my true residential address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Fraudulent Accounts : I have identified several fraudulent accounts that have been opened in my name without my consent. XXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Type : XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXXXXXX XXXX Account # : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Type : XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) Account # : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Type : Credit Card XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ) Account # : XXXX Date Opened : XX/XX/XXXX Type : Credit Card Alleged Human Trafficking/Identity Exploitation : Given the nature and scope of the fraudulent activity described above, I have serious concerns that this identity theft is linked to human trafficking or the misuse of my personal information by criminal organizations. It is important that the proper authorities investigate the possibility that my personal information has been trafficked for exploitation and financial fraud. 
Request for Immediate Action : As a victim of identity theft, I request that the following actions be taken immediately : 1. Removal of Fraudulent Accounts : Please remove all fraudulent accounts listed above from my credit report in accordance with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) Section XXXX09 & 611.

2. Investigate the Fraudulent Activity : Please thoroughly investigate the fraudulent addresses and accounts to determine their origin and whether they are connected to identity theft or human trafficking.

3. Notification to Law Enforcement : If any links to criminal activity, including human trafficking, are found during your investigation, please notify the appropriate law enforcement authorities.

4. Expedited Resolution : In accordance with FCRA Section 1681, I ask that you resolve this matter within XXXX days and provide written confirmation that all fraudulent activity has been removed from my credit reports.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, Equifax, XXXX and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

Subject : Request for Deletion of Credit Report Dear XXXX XXXX, Equifax, XXXX and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

I am writing to formally request the deletion of my credit report due to multiple security breaches and the lack of any active lines of credit under my name. I have experienced five security breaches, including incidents involving Equifax, for which I have received settlements. Additionally, I was affected by a recent credit breach from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

According to the data breach website, my Social Security number and personal information have been compromised by these companies. Given this information, my credit report should have been locked, and there should be no listings or open lines of credit. I have not had any credit accounts for over five years, and due to health issues, I am no longer driving, further reducing my need for credit. 

Furthermore, I request the immediate detection of my credit report to prevent any unauthorized access and the removal of my information from all third-party pre-approval lists. I believe that all three credit bureaus ( Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX ) should have refrained from sharing my information without my consent. 

I also request the deletion of any and all unauthorized information on my report, including but not limited to addresses, phone numbers, income, and any charge-offs. It is essential that my credit report reflects only accurate and authorized information. 

Additionally, I want to bring to your attention the recent lawsuit settled in XX/XX/year>, which held credit reporting agencies accountable for mishandling consumer data. This settlement further underscores the need for the protection of consumers ' personal information and reinforces my request for the deletion of inaccurate information from my credit report. 

Please be advised that under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I am entitled to request the deletion of any inaccurate or unverifiable information. Failure to comply with my request may result in a fine of up to {$1000.00} as stipulated by relevant laws.

I kindly ask that you investigate this matter and provide written confirmation of the deletion of my credit report. Please let me know if you require any additional documentation to support my request. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Dispute of XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Account Under FCRA To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to dispute the collection account reported by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX on my Equifax credit report. Based on my investigation through the XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ), XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not licensed to collect debts in the state of California. As such, the reporting of this account is both inaccurate and unlawful. 

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), specifically 15 USC 1681e ( b ), Equifax is required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information contained in consumer reports. Reporting a collection account from an unlicensed entity that is prohibited from collecting debts in California fails to meet this standard. Furthermore, under 15 USC 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ), I have the right to dispute inaccurate or unverifiable information, which obligates Equifax to investigate and remove such information from my credit report if it can not be verified. 

Details of the Disputed Account Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Amount Alleged Owed : {$1400.00} Actions Requested Investigate License Status : Verify through the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and the California Department of Financial Protection and Innovation that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not licensed to operate in California. 

Remove the Inaccurate Entry : Permanently delete this collection account from my credit report as the entity has no legal authority to collect debts in my state. 

Provide Written Confirmation : Send me a written response confirming the removal of this account and provide an updated copy of my credit report reflecting the correction. 
Enclosed are the following documents to support my dispute : A copy of my credit report highlighting the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX account. 
Documentation from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX confirming that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX is not licensed to collect in California. 

Equifax must complete this investigation and respond within the 30-day timeframe required under the FCRA. Failure to comply with these obligations will leave me no choice but to escalate this matter by filing complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the California Attorney Generals office. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I originally signed up for the credit card on XXXX XXXX website to receive free bags. On the site I saw no indication of an annual fee. I specifically avoid cards with anual fees. 

I used the card once and it was paid off, after that I haven't recieved statements in the mail for a {$0.00} balance card. It was my assumption that the card continued to be XXXX balance otherwise I would have received a statement. Citi started to call me and let me know that I owed them the annual fee, the late fee, and interest. I asked if it could be refunded and I was told I needed to be transferred. 

Citi transferred me to a phone line that was telling me that I won a promo and was eligible for a free medical alert device. I initially thought this was Citi and began speaking with XXXX who was telling me about the free medical alert device. During our conversation I realized it was a scam and hung up and called Citi back. 

Citi acknowledged I was on the line and that they did transfer me. The second time they tried to transfer me I was sent to an actual City agent and not a scam. They told me that the timeline is outside of when they can get rid of the annual fee. 

I believe that Citi intentionally waits to provide notice to their customers of an overdue balance for the late fee until they are outside of their policy refund section. Furthermore I believe that City is intentionally making it hard to identify that there is an annual fee. The supervisor I spoke to went so far as to state that nobody reads terms and disclosures acknowledging that if they are there that they are intended to be in a place they are missed. 

The annual fee is {$99.00}, I believe the late fee was already refunded, but I do not have the interest. They claim it was sent, but I did not receive any statements. They stated they do not have any tracking or any proof it was sent besides the system saying it was sent. I do not believe the statement was sent, maybe it fell on the floor in the mail room or something. 

I do not have any documents because I have not received anything. Citi should have the recordings and the transfer log where they transferred me to what seemed like an identity theft hotline. 

I am diligent when signing up for a new credit card to avoid annual fees. If it was easy to spot I wouldn't have signed up for this card, I am also disgusted that Citi would transfer a customer to a line that reeks of being a scam. If this happened to someone over the age of XXXX they likely would have had their identity stolen, because I called Citi I trusted that I was still talking to Citi.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
CFPB ( Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ) complaint. 

Subject : Complaint Regarding Inaccurate Credit Reporting by XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX Description of the Issue : I am filing this complaint to address inaccurate credit reporting by XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX regarding accounts from XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and a student loan serviced by the Department of EducationXXXX XXXX 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX I sent a Notice of Liability and Self-Executing Default to XXXX XXXX XXXX via certified mail on XX/XX/year>, delivered on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
They were given 10 days to respond, but no response was received. Therefore, they are in default, and this account should no longer be reported. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX A Notice of Liability and Self-Executing Default was sent via certified mail on XX/XX/year>, and delivered on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
Again, no response was received within 10 days, placing this account in default. This account should also be removed immediately. 
XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX Department of Education/XXXX XXXX I attempted to send a certified Notice of Liability and Self-Executing Default on XX/XX/year>, but the letter was returned as undeliverable on XX/XX/year> ( Tracking Number : XXXX ). 
The address provided by the school was invalid, and I have been unable to properly serve notice. This loan contract was entered into under unconscionable terms and lacked full disclosure of its impact on credit reporting. 
Violations and Requests for Validation : I am requesting that XXXX, Equifax, and XXXX provide the following : XXXX. XXXX XXXX XXXX : Proof that I provided written XXXX consent to XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX the Department of EducationXXXX XXXX report this information to the credit bureaus. 
XXXX. Court Orders : Records showing that XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX or the Department of EducationXXXX obtained a court order from a competent jurisdiction to communicate with me about these debts. 
XXXX. XXXX Compliance : Documentation that XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX and the Department of Education/XXXX  are adhering to Generally Accepted Accounting Principles ( GAAP ) in verifying the validity of these debts. 
If this information can not be provided, the accounts should be deleted under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) for failure to verify their accuracy. 
Impact on My Rights : The reporting of these accounts is depriving me of my life, liberty, and pursuit of happiness by negatively impacting my credit score without proper validation. 
Requested Resolution : I request the immediate removal of these accounts from my credit reports, including a rapid rescore by all three credit bureaus. If this is not resolved within 7 days, I will begin assessing damages at {$5000.00} per day per account that remains on my report. 
Thank you for addressing this matter promptly.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against * for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : * failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or *, as required by law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute an inaccurate entry on my credit report. According to my credit report, XXXX XXXX has listed certain accounts as charged off. However, I have concrete documentation proving that these loans are not in default, and this claim is false. This misinformation has caused undue harm to my credit score and is a violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and Ohio state laws. 

Details of the Disputed Accounts : Creditor : XXXX XXXX Account Number ( s ) : n/a Reported Status : Charged Off Under the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. Reporting an account as charged off when it has not defaulted constitutes false reporting, which is prohibited under this law. Moreover, Ohios consumer protection laws also mandate that creditors and credit bureaus must report information fairly and accurately, per Ohio Revised Code Section 1345.02, which prohibits unfair and deceptive practices. 

Additionally, in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), the courts reinforced the obligation of credit reporting agencies to conduct reasonable investigations when a consumer disputes the accuracy of information. Reporting a charge-off inaccurately violates this precedent and further illustrates a failure to uphold proper investigative standards. 

To support my dispute, I have attached the following documents : 1. A copy of my credit report highlighting the inaccurate entry. 
2. Documentation proving that my XXXX XXXX loans are not in default. 
3. [ Any additional evidence, such as account statements or correspondence with XXXX XXXX. ] I request that [ Credit Bureau Name ] investigate this matter promptly and delete the inaccurate charge-off entries from my credit report. Failure to address and correct this issue may leave me no choice but to seek legal remedies under the FCRA and Ohio consumer protection laws. 

I appreciate your attention to this matter and expect a written response within 30 days, as required by the FCRA. 

Thank you for your time and cooperation. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax and XXXX are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Equifax and XXXX are reporting adverse items on my XXXX XXXX  account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states, Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. Equifax and XXXX are reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. Equifax and XXXX are also reporting a charge off which according to the IRS publication XXXX, a charge off is considered income and may not be reported as debt. The account has been charged off as witnessed by the report. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. Equifax and XXXX do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to Equifax, XXXX and XXXX XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.15 U.S.C . 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option.

According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, Equifax and XXXX are the reporting agencies and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX  XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX, the financial institution, and Equifax and XXXX, the consumer reporting agencies, DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer XXXX exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am opting out of your reporting services for this account.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bureau 's Failure to Conduct Reinvestigation for Account with XXXX XXXX. 

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). The credit bureau has failed to remove a late payment from my account with XXXX XXXX the necessary steps are being taken on my part to rectify this incorrect information. 

I recently disputed the presence of late payment on my XXXX XXXX account XXXX, which has been negatively impacting my credit history. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being. 

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.

Product: Credit card
Consumer complaint narrative: I've had a store credit card with XXXX XXXX for over ten years. I have NEVER made a late payment or missed any payments on this account, whatsoever. Over the past summer, this account was absorbed by Synchrony Bank. My due date for my credit card payment has always been the XXXX of each month since I've had it ; it remained due on the XXXX after the account was transferred from XXXX XXXX to Synchrony. For reasons unknown to me, as of this month, Synchrony suddenly changed my payment due date to the XXXX of the month without notifying me of this change. Therefore, when I signed onto their website on XX/XX/year> to make my normal payment, I was alerted that I had been charged a {$41.00} late fee, even though I had not been notified of the due date change. As you can see from the attachments, my due date in XXXX was XXXX, then it changed to XX/XX/year> for the XXXX statement. After much debate, an alleged supervisor named XXXX first said there was no changed to the due date, then admitted the due date was changed. She even confirmed I was not notified, however, she did not remove the erroneous late fee. The company will either remove this charge immediately, or I'll take the matter to court, I'm that angry. I have done nothing wrong here. This company has no right to change a due date without informing me and I will not a pay a bogus fee due to their malfeasance.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response
