Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is being filed against Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX for failure to comply with federal laws governing the reporting and timely removal of inaccurate accounts associated with identity theft. 

I have previously submitted an Identity Theft Affidavit, an Affidavit of Truth, and copies of my identifying information to each of the credit bureaus via certified mail, which has been received as evidenced by the return receipts. These documents clearly establish that the following accounts are fraudulent and must be deleted immediately : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

I stated Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681-1681x ), you are required to investigate and delete any information that can not be verified as accurate within 4 business days when identity theft has been properly reported. Specifically : 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 mandates that credit reporting agencies block fraudulent information within 4 days of receiving an identity theft report and proof of identity.

15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ) requires the deletion of inaccurate or unverifiable information following a reasonable investigation. 

Failure to comply with these obligations has been adjudicated in the following court cases, which highlight your liability and lack of compliance : XXXX v. XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Failure to remove inaccurate information after proper notice constitutes willful noncompliance with the FCRA. 

XXXX v. TransUnion, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX. XXXX ) : Credit reporting agencies are liable for damages when they fail to conduct reasonable investigations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute Of Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payment on my credit report relate to the following account : XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Subject : Request for Incorrect Late Payments under the FCRA, specifically 15 USC 1681.

I am writing to dispute an incorrect late payment report on my credit report, specifically in regards to the accounts referenced with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX # XXXX. 
Upon thorough review of my credit report, I have identified discrepancies in the reporting of these accounts. To the best of my knowledge and records, I have consistently paid these accounts on time and in accordance with the agreed-upon terms.

Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between myself and your company. Payment history, particularly late payments, negatively impacts my consumer report and constitutes a part of such transactions and experiences.

Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1666 ( b ), I request documentation of the reasonable procedures you have in place to ensure that periodic statements are mailed to me no later than 21 days before the payment due date. This documentation should include all information required by 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ) regarding the contents of such statements.

Reference to PAANL ( Paid As Agreed Never Late ) : The terms of our agreement have consistently been adhered to. Therefore, the account should be reported with a status of " Paid As Agreed Never Late '' to accurately reflect my timely payments. Any deviation from this status misrepresents my financial responsibility and commitment to fulfilling my payment obligations.

Request for Proof : To validate the reporting of late payments on these accounts, I request the following : Documented proof supporting the claims of late payments, including dates, amounts, and any relevant communication.

In the absence of valid proof, I demand that these accounts be promptly updated to reflect their accurate status as " Paid As Agreed Never Late. '' Request for Timely Investigation : In accordance with the ( FCRA ), I request a thorough investigation of this matter and a written response within 30 days of your receipt of this letter. Failure to adhere to this timeline will be considered a violation of the ( FCRA ).

Please treat this as a formal dispute under the ( FCRA ). If the inaccurate reporting is not corrected or a satisfactory resolution is not provided, I may escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or take legal action to ensure compliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a written response with the results of your investigation. If you require additional information, I can be reached at XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative: List of accounts below has violated my federally protected consumer rights to privacy and confidentiality under 15 USC 1681 I looked at my XXXX and Equifax credit report on XX/XX/year> and noticed some things are incomplete and not accurate. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, whenever a consumer reporting agency prepares a consumer credit report, it shall follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information concerning the individual about whom the report relates according to 15 USC 1681 ( e ) ( b ). 15 USC 1681e ( b ) requires that consumer reporting agencies adopt reasonable procedures to meet the needs of commerce for consumer credit, personnel, insurance, and other information. These procedures must be fair and equitable to the consumer, ensuring confidentiality, accuracy, relevancy, and proper utilization of such information1. The law also mandates that consumer reporting agencies follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of consumer reports2.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Follow-Up Dispute Verification - Failure to Comply with FCRA and this is the proof than show the violation Totally all law written to FCRA Section 611, FCDRA AND TILA, DELETE IMMEDIATELY THE FOLLOWING ACCOUNT : I am writing to formally THIS COMPLAINT the accuracy of information PERSIST IN THE ACCOUNT AND THE bureau has verified on my credit report regarding the following account : Account Name : XXXX XXXX XXXX Account Number:XXXX  While I appreciate your response indicating that the information has been verified, I believe there are still significant inaccuracies that require further investigation. Specifically, 1. Current Balance : XXXX does not report a balance, while XXXX and Equifax list {$0.00}. This inconsistency creates confusion, as all agencies should show the same balance. 
2. Date Last Active : Equifax reports the last active date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears to be an error since it is a future date. 
XXXX shows XX/XX/XXXX, and XXXX lists XX/XX/XXXX. This discrepancy should be investigated. 
3. Date of Last Payment : Equifax lists the date as XX/XX/XXXX, while XXXX and XXXX report XX/XX/XXXX. The difference of a few days could be an error if the payments were made simultaneously. 
4. Payment Status : XXXX states that the account was 60 days past due. 
XXXX mentions the account was past due 30 days two or three times. 
Equifax says " not more than three payments past due ''. These descriptions do not match and should be consistent. 
5. Account Comments : Equifax specifies " Account Closed by Credit Grantor '', while XXXX says " Canceled by Credit Grantor ''. Although similar, the wording differs, which could create confusion. 
6. Last Reported Date : Equifax lists the reported date as XX/XX/XXXX, which appears incorrect since it is a future date. XXXX and XXXX show XX/XX/XXXX, which seems more accurate. 


Pursuant to the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 USC 16811 ( 7 ) credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. Additionally, under the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), 15 USC 1601, it is imperative that all credit information provided is accurate and transparent to protect consumer rights As per the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), I have the right to dispute inaccuracies in my credit report. I request that you conduct a more thorough investigation into this matter, particularly considering the following points : 1. Inconsistencies : There are discrepancies among the three credit bureaus regarding this account, including.

2. Verification Issues : According to Section 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( A ) of the FCRA, you are required to verify accounts through original documentation. I request that you provide the supporting documentation you relied upon to verify this account.

3. Consumer Rights : Under Section 611 of the FCRA, if you can not provide adequate documentation to support the validity of this account, you must remove it from my credit report. 
4. Accuracy Compliance : Additionally, under 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ), you are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information in my credit report. If the information can not be verified, per 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( a ) ( 5 ), I request that you delete any unverifiable information. 

I believe 100 % AND THE PROOF IS ATTACH TO THIS COMPLAINT THAN the bureau has failed to comply with the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ) in their investigation process.

Specifically, I wish MORE POINT AND VIOLATION HAVE THE EQUIFAX TO MY RIGHT AFTER THE INVESTIGATION THE ACCOUNT HAVE DISCREPANCIES AND INACCURATE : 1. Failure to Investigate Accurately ( 15 U.S. Code 1681i ) : After submitting a dispute regarding inaccuracies on my credit report, I did not receive a thorough investigation within the mandated 30-day timeframe. The results of the investigation did not adequately address my concerns. 
2. Inadequate Compliance Procedures ( 15 U.S. Code 1681e ( b ) ) : The bureau has not demonstrated that it has implemented reasonable procedures to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information provided on my report. I am requesting detailed information on the procedures used during the investigation.

3. Duties of Furnishers of Information ( 15 U.S. Code 1681s-2 ) : The furnishers of the disputed information did not adequately investigate or rectify the inaccuracies after being notified of my dispute, as required by law.

4. Transparency and Accuracy ( TILA, 15 USC 1601 ) : The information provided in my credit report has not been accurate or transparent, violating my consumer rights.

5. Public Law 91-506, Title VI, Section 611, Subsections A-D : This law stipulates the procedures for the removal of inaccurate or incomplete information from credit reports. Your response and verification process did not comply with these provisions, necessitating the removal of the bankruptcy record.

6.

7. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information.

8.

9. 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information.

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Equifax for their failure to comply with the FCRA and TILA. Additionally, This is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Removal of Inaccurate/invalidated credit information, please remove immediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

7. 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( 7 ) - Description of Investigation : Pursuant to the FCRA, credit reporting agencies are obligated to provide a description of the investigation within 15 days of receiving a consumer 's dispute. To date, I have not received this required information. 
8.

9. 15 U.S.C. 609 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( a ) - Verification Requirement : Per the FCRA, you are required by federal law to verify all accounts and public information through physical verification of the original signed consumer contract and/or judgment ( s ). Without such verification, there is a risk that erroneous or fraudulent information could be included in credit reports. Given the lack of adequate verification, I request the removal of this unauthorized public record information. 

I am requesting that the CFPB investigate this matter and take appropriate action against Equifax for their failure to comply with the FCRA and TILA. Additionally, This is a violation of 15 U.S. Code 1681i ( 5 ) Removal of Inaccurate/invalidated credit information, please remove immediately.

Thank you for your attention to this matter. I look forward to your response.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute Of Inaccurate Reporting of Late Payment on my credit report relate to the following account : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX 

Subject : Request for Incorrect Late Payments under the FCRA, specifically 15 USC 1681. 

I am writing to dispute an incorrect late payment report on my credit report, specifically in regards to the accounts referenced with XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX. 
Upon thorough review of my credit report, I have identified discrepancies in the reporting of these accounts. To the best of my knowledge and records, I have consistently paid these accounts on time and in accordance with the agreed-upon terms. 

Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ), my consumer report should not contain information solely as to transactions or experiences between myself and your company. Payment history, particularly late payments, negatively impacts my consumer report and constitutes a part of such transactions and experiences. 

Additionally, under XXXX XXXX. XXXX ( b ), I request documentation of the reasonable procedures you have in place to ensure that periodic statements are mailed to me no later than 21 days before the payment due date. This documentation should include all information required by 15 U.S.C. 1637 ( b ) regarding the contents of such statements. 

Reference to PAANL ( Paid As Agreed Never Late ) : The terms of our agreement have consistently been adhered to. Therefore, the account should be reported with a status of " Paid As Agreed Never Late '' to accurately reflect my timely payments. Any deviation from this status misrepresents my financial responsibility and commitment to fulfilling my payment obligations. 

Request for Proof : To validate the reporting of late payments on these accounts, I request the following : Documented proof supporting the claims of late payments, including dates, amounts, and any relevant communication. 
In the absence of valid proof, I demand that these accounts be promptly updated to reflect their accurate status as " Paid As Agreed Never Late. '' Request for Timely Investigation : In accordance with the ( FCRA ), I request a thorough investigation of this matter and a written response within 30 days of your receipt of this letter. Failure to adhere to this timeline will be considered a violation of the ( FCRA ). 

Please treat this as a formal dispute under the ( FCRA ). If the inaccurate reporting is not corrected or a satisfactory resolution is not provided, I may escalate this matter to the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) or take legal action to ensure compliance. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. Please confirm receipt of this letter and provide a written response with the results of your investigation. If you require additional information, I can be reached at XXXX Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing this complaint to the CFPB because, I recently reviewed my credit profile and was dismayed to find that, despite my previous request, EQUIFAX has failed to correct the inaccuracies in my personal information. This letter serves as my second formal notice requesting immediate action to rectify these errors. I request that you delete the inaccurate information from my credit profile within the next thirty days. Below, I have outlined the specific details of my personal information that are inaccurately reported and must be removed without delay : - Name : My name is XXXX XXXX XXXX. I do not have any other names or aliases, am not associated with any other names, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. If any other names or aliases are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information without infringing on my consumer rights. Correct my name on my credit report to reflect the following name ; XXXX XXXX XXXX. Attached to this document is the proof of my identity. 



- Address : My current and only address is XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. I do not have any other current addresses, nor do I desire any other addresses to be retained or reported, all other addresses or previous addresses are not mine and are non-mailable addresses for XXXX XXXX XXXX. Any additional addresses must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. Attached to this document are my proofs of address. 



- Date of Birth : My date of birth is XX/XX/year>. I do not have any other dates of birth, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. If any other dates of birth are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. Please reference the attached document. 



- Telephone Numbers : I do not have any requisite telephone numbers, nor do I desire any telephone numbers to be retained or reported. Any retained telephone numbers must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information.

- Employers : I do not have any requisite employers listed, nor do I desire any employers to be retained or reported. If any employers are reported, they must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information. 



- Spouses, Roommates, Co-Applicants : I do not have any requisite spouses, roommates, or co-applicants, nor do I desire any such information to be retained or reported. Any related information must be deleted immediately unless you can provide proof of your legitimate authority to retain and report such information.

Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act, specifically 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ), you are required to ensure the accuracy and completeness of the information you report. This is my second notification alerting you to inaccuracies in my credit report. By failing to correct these errors, you are now in violation of the FCRA, including but not limited to : - 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Failure to follow reasonable procedures to assure maximum possible accuracy of the information in consumer reports.

- 15 U.S.C. 1681i ( a ) : Failure to conduct a reasonable reinvestigation of disputed information.

- 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Reporting obsolete information or retaining data longer than permitted.

If the inaccuracies are not corrected within thirty days from the date of this letter, I will be compelled to seek legal recourse to enforce my rights under the FCRA. Furthermore, I request that once you have corrected the inaccuracies, you provide me with a complete and updated copy of my credit report reflecting these changes. Please send this corrected report to my address at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX. 



Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. If I do not receive a response or corrective action within the designated timeframe, I will interpret this as non-compliance, and appropriate legal measures will be taken. 



Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX UCC1-304, UCC1-308 ALL RIGHTS RESERVED WITHOUT RECOURSE WITHOUT PREJUDICE

Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Consumer Financial Protection Bureau, I am submitting this complaint regarding American Express for inaccurately reporting a business account as an individual account on my personal credit report. This misrepresentation creates an incorrect liability and violates consumer protection laws and tax guidelines. 

The account in question is a XXXX XXXX XXXX, issued for use by a separate legal entity. I, as an individual, am not personally liable for this account beyond its connection to the business entity. The card is explicitly a business credit card, not a personal credit card, as designed for business expenses. 

Furthermore, American Express is attempting to charge me {$28000.00}, an amount they have already written off for their tax benefit. Under federal tax law, including 26 U.S.C. 6050P, when a creditor writes off or cancels a debt over {$600.00} for tax purposes, they must issue a 1099-C form to the debtor. If American Express has benefited from writing off this debt, they can not continue to report or pursue it as a personal liability against me.

American Expresss misclassification of this account as an individual account on my personal credit report is inaccurate, misleading, and creates undue harm to my credit standing. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681.

Requested Resolution : XXXX. Ensure the account is correctly classified as a business account and not reported as my personal liability. 
XXXX. Investigate American Expresss attempt to charge {$28000.00} while they have already benefited from writing off the debt for tax purposes. 
XXXX. Confirm compliance with the FCRA and IRS reporting laws. 

Please confirm receipt of this complaint and provide an update within 5-10 business days. I appreciate your prompt attention to this matter and trust you will work to correct these inaccuracies.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Subject : Formal Complaint Regarding Data Breach Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 To Whom It May Concern, I am writing to formally notify the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) of a recent data breach in which my personal information, including my Social Security number, was compromised. This breach violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), as outlined in 15 U.S.C. 1681, which protects consumers from negligent handling of personal and financial information.

The data breach occurred through Equifax Consumer Services LLC, which I believe failed to exercise reasonable care in protecting sensitive consumer data as required under the FCRA.This breach places me at serious risk of identity theft and other fraudulent activity, and I am deeply concerned about the potential misuse of my information.

Under 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( b ), entities handling consumer information must ensure the security and confidentiality of consumer data. Additionally, under 15 U.S.C. 1681n and 1681o, entities may be held liable for willful or negligent violations of the FCRA, including failing to properly safeguard sensitive personal information.

Despite my efforts, the breach has caused significant XXXX  and disruption, and I seek your assistance in ensuring that the responsible entity is held accountable under the FCRA.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dispute of Inaccurate Reporting Account # XXXX Dear Equifax Dispute Department , I am writing to formally dispute the inaccurate reporting of the above-referenced account on my credit report. According to your records, this account reflects a balance of {$16000.00}. However, I have documentation ( attached for reference ) from XXXX XXXX XXXX stating that the actual deficiency balance is {$5600.00} after the repossession and sale of the collateral. This discrepancy is not only significant but is a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 1681i and related consumer protection laws.

Grounds for Dispute : 1. Inaccurate Reporting ( 1681e ( b ) ) : Under the FCRA, credit reporting agencies must ensure the accuracy and completeness of all information reported. The discrepancy between the actual deficiency balance provided by XXXX XXXX XXXX and the amount being reported by Equifax clearly demonstrates a failure to meet this requirement. 

2. Verification Requirement ( 1681i ( a ) ( 1 ) ) : I request that you immediately conduct an investigation into this matter and verify the accuracy of the reported balance. If the creditor can not substantiate the reported balance of {$16000.00}, this account must be corrected or deleted from my credit file. 

3. Unfair and Misleading Information : Reporting an inflated balance misrepresents the true state of this account, which negatively impacts my creditworthiness and violates consumer protection principles.

4. Potential Violations of FDCPA ( 807 ) : If this inaccurate balance is being communicated as an attempt to collect a debt, it may constitute a false or misleading representation under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Action Demanded : - Immediately remove or correct the inaccurate reporting of this account within 30 days, as stipulated by the FCRA. 
- Provide written confirmation of the outcome of your investigation. 

Attached to this letter is documentation from XXXX XXXX XXXX showing the correct deficiency balance, which unequivocally supports my claim.

Consumer complaint narrative: This letter is in response to your recent claim that XXXX XXXX XXXX Account # XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX verified the account they are reporting is accurate. Please be advised that I am exercising my rights under FCRA 611 ( a ) ( 6 ) ( B ( iii ) which provides that a consumer may request a description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information shall be provided to the consumer by the agency, including the business name and address of any furnisher of information contacted in connection with such information and the telephone number of such furnisher, if reasonably available. In compliance with this method of investigation request, please provide the following : The description of the procedure used to determine the accuracy and completeness of the information. Name, address, and telephone number of each person contacted regarding this alleged account. A copy of any documents provided bearing my signature, showing that I have a legally binding contractual obligation to pay them the exact amount claimed. Any automated response or e-Oscar verification is unacceptable. I am requesting a re-investigation along with your method of verification. The item in question is inaccurate and represents a very serious reporting error. I expect to receive a response within 15 days of receipt of this letter in compliance with the FCRA. If not, I expect this item will be removed from my credit files immediately. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. I look forward to resolving this matter as soon as possible.

Violations of Consumer Protection Laws The inclusion of the aforementioned accounts in my credit report constitutes a violation of : 15 U.S.C. 1681 ( FCRA ) which prohibits the inclusion of unverifiable or inaccurate information in consumer reports. 15 U.S.C. 1692k ( d ) ( FDCPA ) which mandates compliance with debt validation and verification requirements. Several times I have called the bureau reporting these fraudulent accounts in my report and CREDIT BUREAU has not wanted to give me a solution to this problem where I am being totally affected to be able to acquire a new house for my children, these collections were eliminated and not verified by others bureaus I don't understand how they usually say that these accounts are mine, I have requested contracts from this company with my information and for more than 60 days I have not received any response from them, please help me immediately delete these accounts. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, FL XXXX Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX GA XXXX Re : DEMAND FOR IMMEDIATE REMOVAL OF FRAUDULENT INQUIRIES & EXPOSURE OF EQUITABLE AND LEGAL VIOLATIONS Notice of Violation of FCRA, Privacy Rights, and Potential RICO Violations To Whom It May Concern, This is a formal demand for the immediate removal of all unauthorized and fraudulent inquiries from my consumer report, as previously substantiated by proper documentation, including an FTC Identity Theft Report and proof of identification. 
Despite your removal of similar inquiries on XX/XX/XXXX, Equifax now refuses to remove the remaining inquiries, even though they are identical in nature and fully supported by 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). This deliberate refusal constitutes willful noncompliance and suggests fraudulent intent. 
Severe Violations and Legal Consequences 1. Violation of FCRA 605-C2 : By refusing to remove inquiries after receiving proper identification and an FTC report , Equifax is in direct violation of its obligations under FCRA 605-C2, which mandates the blocking of fraudulent information upon sufficient notice. 
2. Privacy and Constitutional Violations : The requirement for additional sensitive information, including my Social Security number, represents an unlawful intrusion on my privacy. This is excruciating and unnecessary given the documentation already provided and exposes Equifax to penalties under 42 U.S.C. 1983 for deprivation of rights under color of law. 
3. Potential RICO Violations : Equifaxs actionsremoving some inquiries while arbitrarily refusing othersreveal a pattern of fraudulent activity for financial gain. Under the Racketeer Influenced and Corrupt Organizations Act ( RICO ), such intentional manipulation and misrepresentation of consumer data constitute racketeering Here is a list of all the inquiry dates with the first two letters removed : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXX. Frivolous Conduct Regarding My Consumer Report : Equifaxs recent assertion that they can not locate my consumer report is blatantly false, given their prior actions to remove items from the same file. This raises serious questions about the accuracy, maintenance, and accounting of my report under Equifaxs purview. Such conduct justifies an IRS audit of your entire operation regarding my consumer file. As you are compensated for reporting consumer data, the inconsistencies and misrepresentations herein demand full transparency and investigation into your accounting practices. 
My Formal Demands 1. Immediate Removal of the following unauthorized hard inquiries ( list inquiries here ). 
2. A full investigation into Equifaxs back office team for mishandling my consumer report and committing acts of fraud. 
3. Assurance that my privacy will not be further compromised, including refraining from unnecessary requests for sensitive information. 
4. Written confirmation of compliance with FCRA 605-C2 and an explanation of the irregularities in your handling of my consumer report. 
Supporting Documentation FTC Identity Theft Report Valid proof of identification Prior Equifax correspondence confirming removal of similar inquiries Your continued negligence and inconsistent actions have caused irreparable harm to my creditworthiness and future financial opportunities. Failure to resolve this matter immediately will leave me no choice but to : File a formal complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Pursue litigation for damages, including statutory penalties under the FCRA and RICO Act, Request an IRS audit of Equifaxs handling and accounting of my consumer report data. 
This is a final notice. I trust Equifax will act lawfully, equitably, and expeditiously to correct these egregious violations.

Consumer complaint narrative:
To Whom It May Concern, I recently visited myFICO.com and was astounded to find a fraudulent account being reported by several entities, including XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ) and EQUIFAX. This fraudulent account is accompanied by numerous fraudulent inquiries and false information. 

In response to this alarming discovery, Ive made numerous attempts to contact these entities to discuss and resolve the matter. However, Im deeply disappointed to see that the fraudulent account persists on myFICO.com, and the entities involved continue to report it and spread misinformation.

Ive repeatedly contacted these entities to address this issue and discourage the spread of fraudulent information and negative accounts. These accounts are a direct result of identity theft and multiple data breaches committed by XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, and EQUIFAX. 

The devastating impact of identity theft on my credit has made rebuilding my life an arduous task. During this challenging period, Ive thoroughly studied the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), uncovering numerous violations committed by entities such as XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX, and XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I formally requested immediate action from the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Texas State Attorney General, and the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  ) to address fraudulent issues perpetrated by XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX and XXXX. This constitutes my final warning and a cease and desist order. 

Although I am not a credit repair company or consultant, I am well-informed about the applicable laws and have sworn statements, affidavits of truth, and notarized Federal Trade Commission complaints as evidence in my SOLIDIFYING MY STATEMENTS case. I have identified several violations. 

- 15 USC 1692c ( b ) - 15 U.S. code 1681s-2 - 15 U.S. code 1681a ( 2 ) ( 1 ) - 15 U.S. code 1681 ( 3 ) ( e ) - 15 U.S. code 16811 - Procedure in case of disputed accuracy - 15 U.S. code 1681b - Permissible purposes of consumer report - H.R. 3046 Social Security number privacy and identity Theft Prevention Act of 2007 - Section 326 of the XXXX XXXX XXXX - Gramm- leach-Bliley Act - 15 USC 1681B c-2 Furthermore, Im requesting that all information obtained through identity theft be completely blocked. This action constitutes a formal cease and desist from the fraudulent account number XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, XXXX ( Account Number : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, Opening Date : XX/XX/XXXX, Account Status : Closed, Past Due Amount : {$160.00} as of XX/XX/XXXX, Credit Usage Percentage : 163 %, Current Balance : {$8100.00} ). 
- **Last Balance Update : ** XX/XX/XXXX **Recent Inquiries : ** - XXXX XXXX : Inquired on XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX : Inquired on XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX : Inquired XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX - XXXX XXXX  : Inquired on XX/XX/XXXX, requesting an accounting report under 15 US Code 1605 ( a ). However, exceptions apply as per 15 US Code 1681a ( 2 ) ( I ).

The term consumer report doesnt encompass reports solely containing transaction or experience information between the consumer and the reporter, unless the reporter is subject to sections ( 1681s3 ) of this title.. 

I specifically denied authorization to XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and Equifax to obtain my personal identifying information through aggravated identity theft. The consumer credit contract alone isnt sufficient to validate the debt. Validation requires presenting the account and a signed and dated general ledger statement from the account holder.

I am filing this complaint against * for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). 

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : * failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or *, as required by law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/year> EQUIFAX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, GA XXXX Subject : Formal Demand for Immediate Deletion of Inaccurate Information Under FCRA and 15 USC Dear XXXX, This letter serves as an official and legally binding demand for the immediate deletion of inaccurate, unverifiable, and/or incomplete information reported on my credit file. Your agencys failure to adhere to federal laws, including the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and U.S. Code Title 15, constitutes a blatant violation of my rights as a consumer. I demand immediate compliance, as the presence of the disputed items is causing significant harm to my credit profile and financial standing. 
Items in Dispute : XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) ACCOUNT # XXXX Legal Basis for My Dispute 1. 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to follow reasonable procedures to ensure maximum possible accuracy of the information they report. The inclusion of the above-mentioned inaccurate items demonstrates a clear violation of this statutory requirement.

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted within 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fall into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once notified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification. 
XXXX. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report. 
XXXX. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office.

Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

2. 15 U.S.C. 1681i : Upon receiving a dispute, agencies must conduct a reasonable and timely reinvestigation to verify the accuracy of the information. If the data can not be verified, it must be deleted w
ithin 30 days.

3. 15 U.S.C. 1681c : Prohibits the inclusion of outdated information, such as accounts beyond the permissible reporting period. If these items fa
ll into this category, they must be deleted immediately.

4. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ) : Obligates data furnishers to promptly correct or delete inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable information once no
tified of a dispute.

5. 15 U.S.C. 1692e ( FDCPA ) : Prohibits the use of false, deceptive, or misleading representations in connection with debt collection. Any inaccurate reporting tied to debt collection activities is a direct violation of this law.

My Demands 1. Immediate Removal : Delete the inaccurate, incomplete, or unverifiable items listed above from my credit report.

2. Verification Details : Provide the name, address, and contact information of the entities that verified the disputed items, along with any documentation used during verification. 
XXXX. Updated Report : Provide me with a corrected and updated copy of my credit report.

4. Cease and Desist : Stop reporting the disputed items to third parties during the reinvestigation process, as required by law.

Notice of Legal Action Failure to address this matter within the 30-day timeframe prescribed by law will result in the following actions : Filing formal complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and my state Attorney General 's office. 
Pursuing legal remedies for damages incurred due to your agencys noncompliance, including but not limited to violations of the FCRA, FDCPA, and U.S. Code Title 15.

I expect full compliance with these demands and a written confirmation of the resolution of this matter. You are hereby on notice that I will aggressively protect my rights under the law. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint against * for the unauthorized and inaccurate reporting of a collection account on my credit report. This account has been reported without my consent or proper validation, in clear violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ).

Details of the Violation Unauthorized Reporting ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681b ) : * failed to obtain my explicit written consent to report this account. Reporting consumer information without permissible purpose is a direct violation of the FCRA.

Inaccurate and Misleading Information ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681e ( b ) ) : Credit reporting agencies are required to ensure the maximum possible accuracy of reported information. The presence of this account, without validation, is inaccurate and misleading.

Failure to Validate the Debt ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692g ) : I have not been provided with adequate validation or itemization of the debt. Debt collectors are legally required to furnish proper documentation proving the validity of a debt upon request.

Prohibition of Misleading Practices ( FDCPA 15 U.S.C. 1692e ) : Reporting this account without proper validation or consent constitutes a deceptive and unfair practice under the FDCPA.

Failure to Investigate Disputes ( FCRA 15 U.S.C. 1681i ) : Despite disputing this account, no reasonable or timely investigation appears to have been conducted by the relevant credit reporting agencies or *, as required by law.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative: I am writing to formally dispute inaccurate, misleading, and potentially unlawful reporting regarding my XXXX  XXXX account that is being furnished to XXXX XXXX in Equifax Upon reviewing my credit report, I have identified **multiple violations and inconsistencies** under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), which require immediate correction. Identified Violations and Inaccuracies 1. **Reporting Incorrect Status with Past Due Balance and Charge-Off** : - The report reflects that the account has been charged off and closed. However, it simultaneously lists a **past due amount** of ** $ XXXX as of XXXX XXXX. - A charged-off account indicates that the creditor has written off the debt as uncollectible. Per FCRA guidelines, any charged-off balance can not remain reported as past due, as this misrepresents the current status of the debt. 2. **Future-Dated Entries** : - The report reflects contradictory **future dates** ( e.g., Status Updated : XX/XX/year>, Balance Updated : XX/XX/year> ). These dates are impossible because this report was generated in XXXX XXXX. Reporting future activity is inaccurate, misleading, and violates the FCRAs requirement for fair and accurate reporting. XXXX. **Credit Usage at 118 % ** : - The report states that my credit usage is XXXX % **, which is mathematically incorrect because the credit limit is reported as ** $ XXXX while the current balance is ** $ XXXX. This reflects inaccuracies in balance calculation or credit usage reporting. XXXX. **Ambiguity in Comments and Dispute Resolution** : - The comments indicate the account was previously in dispute investigation complete. However, no documentation or outcome of the investigation was provided to me, violating my right to a proper investigation under FCRA Section 611. 5. **Multiple Reporting Violations** : - **Incorrect Balance Reporting** : The balance and credit usage appear overstated. - **Duplicate Reporting** : The account balance and past due amount seem to be inconsistently reported across sections. Additional Violations in Payment History Reporting 1. **Future-Dated Late Payments** : - The payment history shows **late payments for XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, XX/XX/year>, and XXXX XXXX. As of todays date in XX/XX/year>, these months have not yet occurred, and future payments can not be accurately reported as late. This constitutes **false and inaccurate reporting** and is a clear violation of FCRA Section 607 ( b ), which mandates maximum possible accuracy. 2. **Inconsistent Reporting with Past Account Status** : - The account has already been charged off and closed as reflected earlier in the report. A charged-off account should not reflect **ongoing monthly late payments**, as the creditor is no longer expecting regular payments. Reporting multiple late payments after the charge-off date is both redundant and misleading. 3. **Adverse Impact on Creditworthiness** : - These inaccuracies in payment history significantly harm my creditworthiness by misrepresenting my financial behavior and account status. Legal Basis for Dispute Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ) : - **Section 611** requires that disputed information must be investigated and corrected within 30 days. - **Section 607 ( b ) ** requires maximum possible accuracy of information furnished. - **Section 623 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) ** prohibits furnishers from reporting inaccurate or unverifiable information. - **Section 605 ( a ) ( 5 ) ** prohibits re-aging or reporting obsolete information. The inaccuracies on this report violate these provisions and misrepresent my creditworthiness, causing harm. Requested Action I demand the following : 1. **Immediate investigation** into the inaccurate reporting under FCRA guidelines . 2. **Removal of the account and of the following : - The past due status and amount, as the account is charged off. - Any future-dated entries, as they are impossible and misleading. - The overstated credit usage percentage and balance inconsistencies. - Inaccurate payment history reporting for future months and redundant late payments post-charge-off. 3. **Documentation** of the investigation results and verification of all corrected information. Failure to Comply If you fail to address these inaccuracies within the 30-day timeframe required by law, I will escalate this matter with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau XXXX CFPB ) and explore all available legal remedies under the FCRA. I have enclosed a copy of the credit report, including the **payment history**, for your reference. Please respond to this dispute promptly.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Money was not available when promised
Consumer complaint narrative:
I hope this message finds you well. I am reaching out to seek your intervention and support with an issue involving Wise, an online financial service provider operating in USA. My funds have been frozen for over 20 days, allegedly due to " international sanctions, '' which I find entirely unjustified and unacceptable. 
Background I hold a US account with XXXX and recently made a transfer to my Wise account in US nad my fouds have been blocked for investigation when the amount I did transfer was only XXXX. 
I do not understand why this transaction is under investigation. The transfer was initiated from a legitimate bank in the United States to Wise, which I understand operates legally in XXXX & US. As an online financial institution, Wise allows users to conduct transactions from anywhere in the world.

To clarify : The transaction originated from a legal financial institution in the U.S. and was intended for Wise. 
No transfers were made to or from embargoed countries such as XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, etc. ( again, this was from the U.S. to Wise XXXX ). 
This transaction complies with all legal regulations and should not have been blocked. 
If Wise intends to analyze every transaction I make from the U.S. to Wise moving forward, I would prefer to close my account. I can not afford to have my funds frozen for more than 15 days each time. Therefore, I demand that my funds be immediately returned to my Wise account. While I am willing to close my account with Wise, holding my money for such a prolonged period is unacceptable and constitutes an act of theft. It is illegal for Wise to use my funds to generate interest or make investments without my explicit consent. 
Purpose of the Funds : These funds were intended to cover essential payments in XXXX, including : Rent, Education for my XXXX  child, and XXXX sustenance for my wife and child. 
Consequences : Any negative outcomes arising from this delay will be Wise 's legal responsibility, such as : Penalties for overdue payments, Expulsion of my child from school due to non-payment, or Eviction from our home. 
I have already demonstrated that my funds are lawfully earned, and the transaction was conducted between legitimate financial institutions more than 15 days ago. 
My Demands : Release the funds as per the original transaction immediately, or Return the funds to my U.S. account without further delay.

My Wise User Number : XXXX By withholding these resources, Wise is endangering my familys well-being, as they depend on this money for survival. I expect a resolution to this matter today.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bureau 's Failure to Conduct Reinvestigation for Account with XXXX XXXX. 

Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding a critical issue with the reinvestigation process on my credit report as mandated by the regulations outlined in 15 USC 1666 ( b ) and 15 USC 1681 ( a ) ( 2 ) ( A ) ( i ). The credit bureau has failed to remove a late payment from my account with XXXX XXXX the necessary steps are being taken on my part to rectify this incorrect information. 

I recently disputed the presence of late payment on my XXXX XXXX account XXXX, which has been negatively impacting my credit history. According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, I have the right to an accurate and fair credit report. After my dispute, the credit bureau was obligated to conduct a reinvestigation into the matter and ensure that any inaccuracies are promptly corrected. 

Despite the statutory obligation, the credit bureau has failed to carry out a proper reinvestigation and correct the inaccurate information on my credit report. This negligence has not only affected my credit score but also compromised my financial well-being. 

I request the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau to investigate this matter urgently and ensure that the credit bureau complies with the regulations stipulated under the law. I am seeking prompt action to rectify this error and restore the accuracy of my credit report. 

Attached to this letter are supporting documents relevant to my case, including copies of correspondence with the credit bureau and XXXX XXXX. I appreciate your attention to this matter and look forward to a swift resolution. 

Thank you for your prompt assistance in this regard.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this formal complaint against XXXX for their failure to comply with federal laws governing consumer privacy and disclosure rights. XXXX has violated my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), the Privacy Act of 1974, and other applicable statutes by : 1. Failing to Provide Required Disclosures : XXXX did not provide me with any disclosures or notifications regarding my rights to opt out of the sharing of my personal information with third parties. 
2. Failure to Honor My Opt-Out Request : I recently sent XXXX a formal opt-out notice, as permitted under 12 CFR 1016.7 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( i ) and 15 USC 6802, requesting that they immediately cease the disclosure of my personal information. Despite this, XXXX has continued to share my information without my authorization, directly violating my federally protected consumer rights. 
Details of the Violations : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 602 ( a ), it is stated : There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. 
Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX are consumer reporting agencies, and I am the consumer. I have the right to ensure my private information is not shared without my consent. 
This right is further supported by 15 U.S.C. 6801, which declares : It is the policy of Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. 
A furnisher of information to credit agencies qualifies as a financial institution under this definition. 
Per 15 U.S.C. 1681, Section 604 ( a ) ( 2 ) : A consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report only in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. 
Neither XXXX ( the furnisher of information ) nor the consumer reporting agenciesEquifax, XXXX, or XXXX my consent, written or otherwise, to furnish or report my information. Any prior consent, whether verbal, non-verbal, written, implied, or otherwise, is hereby revoked. 
Additionally, 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) - ( c ) states : A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise the nondisclosure option. 
I was never informed of my right to exercise this option, which constitutes a failure to comply with the law. 
Under 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) ( A ), it is stated : A person shall not furnish information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate.

Moreover, 15 U.S.C. 1681e requires that consumer reporting agencies maintain reasonable procedures to ensure compliance with 1681c and limit the furnishing of consumer reports to authorized purposes under 1681b. Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX have failed to meet this requirement in their handling of my information. 
Lastly, 12 C.F.R. 1016.7 explicitly states : A consumer may exercise the right to opt-out at any time.

I am exercising my right to opt out of all reporting services provided by Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX. 
Requested Resolution : 1. I request the immediate removal of all unauthorized and inaccurate information reported by XXXX from my credit files with Equifax, XXXX, and XXXX. 
2. I demand that XXXX cease all reporting of my personal information and comply fully with my opt-out request. 
3. I request compensation in the maximum allowable amount of {$1000.00} for these violations, as provided under the FCRA and Privacy Act of 1974. 
Impact on Me as a Consumer : XXXX actions have violated my trust, compromised my privacy, and caused undue stress. Their failure to comply with federal laws governing the accuracy, privacy, and proper handling of consumer information has further damaged my ability to ensure my credit file reflects accurate and lawful information. 
I trust the CFPB will investigate XXXX violations and hold them accountable for failing to respect my federally protected consumer rights.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Equifax and XXXX are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. Equifax and XXXX are reporting adverse items on my XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. Equifax and XXXX are reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. Equifax and XXXX are also reporting a charge off which according to the IRS publication 4681, a charge off is considered income and may not be reported as debt. The account has been charged off as witnessed by the report. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. Equifax and XXXX do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to Equifax, XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX , whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked.15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX & XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, 15 USC 1681 section 602 ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, Equifax and XXXX are the reporting agency and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by 15 USC 6801, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. 15 USC 1681 section 604 ( a ) section 2 states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX XXXX , the financial institution, Equifax and XXXX, the consumer reporting agency, DO NOT have my consent to furnish this information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent. 
12 CFR 1016.7 states that A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am opting out of your reporting services for this account.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
As an XXXX XXXX, a father-to-be, and a dedicated provider striving to break cycles of poverty and secure a better future for my family, I am deeply troubled by the persistent negligence and discriminatory practices of the credit reporting agenciesXXXX, Equifax, and XXXX XXXX Their actions have not only jeopardized my familys financial stability but have also pushed us closer to generational poverty. 
These errors are a direct violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681, and the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g. This blatant disregard for their legal obligations under the Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ), FCRA, and FDCPA reflects systemic failures that perpetuate inequities and reinforces the racial biases that disproportionately harm XXXXXXXX XXXX like myself. By failing to uphold these statutes, these agencies are not only threatening my financial future but are also undermining the very principles of fairness and equality that these laws were designed to protect. 
The accounts and inquiries listed below are unauthorized, fraudulent, or inaccurately reported. Their continued presence on my credit reports has caused significant financial harm, including limiting my access to credit and opportunities to support my growing family. Despite providing the required documentationincluding proof of identity, an FTC fraud report, and a statement identifying these items as fraudulentthese agencies have failed to comply with their obligations to block or remove this information under 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2 within the four days mandated by law. 

Please remove unauthorized/fraudulent inquiries and accounts : XXXXAccounts : XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$98.00} XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$270.00} XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$360.00} XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$230.00} XXXX XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$250.00} Inquiries : XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX EquifaxAccounts : XXXX XXXX XXXX : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$4700.00} XXXX XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$1000.00} Inquiries : XXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX XXXXAccounts : XXXX XXXX : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$5000.00} XXXX XXXXAccount : XXXX Opened : XXXX : {$3400.00} Inquiries XXXX XXXX CARD - XX/XX/XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX - XX/XX/XXXX I demand the immediate removal of these accounts and inquiries from my credit reports within the four days required by 15 U.S. Code 1681c-2.

15 U.S. Code 1681c2 - Block of information resulting from identity theft Except as otherwise provided in this section, a consumer reporting agency shall block the reporting of any information in the file of a consumer that the consumer identifies as information that resulted from an alleged identity theft, not later than 4 business days after the date of receipt by such agency of ( 1 ) appropriate proof of the identity of the consumer ; ( 2 ) a copy of an identity theft report ; ( 3 ) the identification of such information by the consumer; and ( 4 ) a statement by the consumer that the information is not information relating to any transaction by the consumer.

Failure to comply will result in legal action. By willfully violating the FCRA, I am willing to settle your civil liability damages I have suffered as a result of your violation for {$1000.00} pursuant to FCRA 616 ( a ) ( 1 ) ( B ) [ 15 U.S.C. 1681n ]. Should you fail or refuse to settle the matter by tendering payment in the amount of {$1000.00} within ten ( 10 ) calendar days of receipt of this notice and demand, I will seek actual damages, which are greater than {$1000.00}.

Your failure to act not only harms me but perpetuates systemic injustices that disproportionately affect XXXX XXXX. This is a violation of the Equal Credit Opportunity Act and underscores the need for accountability. By failing to act, these agencies further demonstrate a disregard for the financial wellbeing of individuals like myself who are striving to create a stable foundation for their families. 

For violating my rights under the FCRA, send funds immediately to : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, TX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Payday loan, title loan, personal loan, or advance loan
Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year>, I applied for a personal loan with Avant. As part of the process, they stated they strive for a 24-hour turnaround time for approval or denial. As part of the process, I linked my bank account through the " Plaid '' service. Within 24 hours, they requested my two most recent pay stubs, which I uploaded. 

On XXXX, XX/XX/XXXX, they sent me an email asking to call them. When I spoke with their rep, they said they could not proceed with my application unless I change my bank account to the account where I get the majority of my paycheck direct deposited. My understanding is that no company is allowed to require direct deposit as a condition of credit, much less are they allowed to force you to use a specific direct deposit account. 

I called again later that day to check status and ask them about the direct deposit issue, but they said they had moved the process forward and now needed me to sign my contract. I stated I already signed XXXX at the beginning of the process, and the phone rep said this was just final paperwork. However, when I reviewed the document compared to what I originally signed on XX/XX/XXXX the terms differed : the loan terms which were clearly stated in the original document were a payment of {$220.00} per month, and APR of 30 %, and an interest rate of 22.05 %. The new terms which they told me were just " final paperork '' were the same documents, except the payment was now {$230.00}, the APR was 33.17 %, and the interest rate was $ 25.07 %.

Upon further investiation online, I see Avant was fined in the past for issues regarding auto pay. I also feel this was a " bait and switch '' - it's one thing to tell me I can't be approved for what I applid for, it's another to tell me I'm just signing " final paperwork '', but that paperwork doens't honor the terms of the original application. Had I not looked closely, I'd have been fooled.

This situation feels predatory, dishonest, intended to deceive, and is shady. Their process also has only led me in circles for 5 days when a 24-hour turnaround time was promised - I'm right back at the start, only they tried to trick me and switch the terms without informing me.

I called today and told them I wanted my application to be withdrawn, and I am not interested. Their rep did not do so. She also said I would receive an email confirmation that my application was closed and that I had declined to proceed. That has not occured.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX has asserted that my mortgage account is 15 months overdue as of todays date. However, this claim is perplexing for several reasons. 

First, I only became a customer of XXXX XXXX in XX/XX/year> when my mortgage servicing was transferred from Bank of America. If XXXX XXXX is attributing these 15 months of alleged late payments to the period before the transfer, this claim must logically originate from Bank of America. However, my Bank of America account does not show any record of missed payments, late fees, or delinquent statements during the period in question. 

This raises serious concerns about the accuracy of XXXX XXXX 's records and the validity of their claim. Furthermore, I have previously been assured verbally by Bank of America that my payment history was in good standing, with no reported delinquencies or missed payments. 

Given the absence of evidence supporting the claim of 15 months of missed payments and the contradictory records from Bank of America, I am left questioning how XXXX XXXX arrived at this conclusion. I have requested clarification and documentation from XXXX XXXX to substantiate their position, but they have yet to provide a satisfactory response. 

This issue further underscores the broader pattern of miscommunication and mishandling that has characterized my experience with XXXX XXXX. I request that XXXX XXXX investigate this matter thoroughly and provide : Documentation explicitly detailing how the 15 months of missed payments were calculated. 
A reconciliation of their records with Bank of Americas, including evidence to justify the transfer of alleged delinquencies.

Immediate correction of any erroneous reporting to credit bureaus or within their internal systems. 
It is imperative that XXXX XXXX takes these concerns seriously and works to resolve this discrepancy promptly and transparently.

I am writing to request your consideration in removing late payments from my credit report for the accounts listed below. I have been a responsible and timely payer overall, and I sincerely regret the oversight that caused the late payment in question.

This condition caused unexpected health complications that made it difficult for me to manage my financial responsibilities. While I fully understand the importance of making payments on time, my primary focus during that period was on recovering my health, which caused a delay in my payment processing.

As a loyal customer, I kindly request your assistance in removing these late payments from my credit report as a gesture of goodwill. I believe this removal would more accurately reflect my overall creditworthiness and my commitment to fulfilling my financial obligations. 

I greatly appreciate your time and understanding, and I look forward to hearing from you regarding this request. If you require any additional information or documentation, please feel free to contact me. 

Thank you for your consideration. 

Sincerely, XXXX XXXX

Product: Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding fraudulent transactions that were debited from my Citibank account ending in XXXX. I am a victim of identity theft, and these unauthorized transactions resulted from this crime. Despite my efforts to resolve this matter, Citibank has not taken appropriate action to investigate the fraudulent charges or recover the funds stolen from my account.

I previously submitted a dispute to Citibank and spoke with several representatives who initially seemed willing to assist in resolving this issue. However, Citibank later denied the claim without providing any update or reason for the denial. The funds stolen from my account were never returned, and I have been left without any clear resolution. This situation has been extremely frustrating, stressful, and difficult, especially given that I need the funds in my account to cover essential medical bills.

Moreover, when I called Citibank to inquire about the status of my dispute, the representative became rude and was unable to provide any meaningful information regarding my claim. I believe Citibank has failed to take the necessary steps to properly investigate this matter and recover the stolen funds. As part of my efforts to resolve this, I have filed an official FTC Report with the Federal Trade Commission for identity theft, which includes the fraudulent transactions.

Below are the items in question that were fraudulently charged to my Citibank account : XX/XX/year> XXXX : {$74.00} XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX  : {$380.00} XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX : {$220.00} XX/XX/year> XXXX : {$57.00} XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX : {$250.00} XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$250.00} XX/XX/year> XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : {$50.00} XX/XX/year>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX {$270.00} XX/XX/year> XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX : {$56.00} The total amount of fraudulent charges is {$1600.00}, which has caused a significant financial burden, especially as I need these funds to cover my medical bills. I request that Citibank immediately re-investigate these transactions as fraudulent and recover the stolen funds from my account. This entire ordeal has added unnecessary financial strain and stress to an already difficult situation.

It is unacceptable that Citibank has not taken proper measures to address this issue. I trust that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau will assist in ensuring Citibank complies with all necessary regulations to resolve this matter fairly and promptly.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to follow up on a dispute I initially filed in XX/XX/year> regarding duplicate charges from the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX. The charges in question were posted on XX/XX/year> in the amounts of {$170.00} and {$480.00}, which I identified as duplicates of the correct charges posted on XX/XX/year> in the amounts of {$550.00} and {$1300.00} for my stay. 
Despite filing my dispute in XX/XX/year>, I never received a response from Chase and was forced to resubmit my dispute on XX/XX/year>. Chase eventually responded, claiming they investigated the charges and determined them to be valid. However, no supporting documentation or reasoning was provided to justify this conclusion. 
In response, I sent my original billing folios, which show only the correct charges from XX/XX/year> and no record of the duplicate charges on XX/XX/year>. I re-disputed the charges once again but received only the same generic response from Chase, again lacking any supporting documentation or explanation for why the duplicate charges were deemed valid. 
It is important to note that these charges are clearly phantom charges made in error, as the XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX has confirmed they are unable to locate these transactions in their system and therefore can not issue a credit. In fact, it was the XXXX XXXX that advised me to dispute the charges with my bank, which suggests that Chase may have failed to properly present the chargeback to the merchants bank. Additionally, Chases failure to respond to the initial dispute within the required timeframe raises further concerns about whether this matter was handled in accordance with proper dispute resolution procedures.

a. They stated they tried to reach me by post, email and telephone. That is untrue. I received no call or email.

a. I called immediately and provided the information requested and the representative said they would work on getting it resolved. I followed it up with an email. 
3. I received third letter dated XX/XX/XXXX which I received XX/XX/XXXX, with a check for my checking account balance stating that they have closed my checking account as well as my corporate card again with no explanation. 
a. The letter is unintelligible due to their printer malfunction. 
No response to my calls or emails. 
This is all apparently because the want to know what my company does. It does the same thing it has done for the over 25 years as a customer of Union Bank and subsequently USBank. Subject : Complaint Regarding Violations of Federal and State Consumer Protection Laws Parties Involved : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX, XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX : XXXX XXXX Affiliated with XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXCredit Acceptance Corporation Address : XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXXXXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX Manager/Authorized Representative, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX I am filing this complaint regarding fraudulent, deceptive, and unlawful practices in a vehicle purchase on XX/XX/XXXX, involving a XXXX XXXX XXXX  ( VIN : XXXX ). These actions violate the Truth in Lending Act ( TILA ), Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ), Federal Odometer Laws, and the Alabama Uniform Commercial Code. 
Key Violations : 1.TILA Violations : {$4500.00} down payment misrepresented as part of credit, violating disclosure requirements. 
Finance charges ( 23.99 % ) and amount financed were inaccurately disclosed. 
2.Federal Odometer Act Violations : Odometer reading ( XXXX miles ) omitted clarification on mechanical limits, violating federal disclosure laws. 
3.Failure to Itemize : Fees for title, service contracts, and GAP insurance were not itemized, causing ambiguity. 
4.Unlawful Fees : GAP insurance and extended warranties were added without explanation or consent. 
5.Deceptive Practices : Trade-in value was inflated to manipulate the financed amount.

Legal Remedies Reserved : 1.TILA Vi
olations : Seek statutory damages up to {$5000.00} per violation. 
2.Federal Odometer Act : Demand {$10000.00} or triple damages for odometer violations.

3.State Consumer Protection Laws : Pursue claims under Alabama Consumer Protection Act.

4.Punitive Damages : Request damages for willful violations.

5.Emotional Distress : Claim additional damages for financial and emotional harm. 
Relief Requested : Rescind the Retail Installment Contract immediately. 
Refund the {$4500.00} down payment and associated fees. 
Remove negative credit reporting related to this transaction. 
Pay {$25000.00} in damages for financial, legal, and emotional harm. 
Failure to comply within 24 hours will result in legal escalation, including filing a lawsuit in federal court and complaints to the FTC and Consumer Protection Division. 
Conclusion : The actions by XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, its representatives, and Credit Acceptance Corporation have caused significant harm and violated federal and state laws. Immediate resolution is necessary to avoid further action. 
Sincerely, XXXX
