Product: Mortgage
Sub-issue: Trying to communicate with the company to fix an issue related to modification, forbearance, short sale, deed-in-lieu, bankruptcy, or foreclosure
Consumer complaint narrative:
I have major concerns with the way that Veterans United has handled the servicing of my mortgage loan. I have been very transparent and forthcoming regarding my hardship and dealing with the illness and passing of my mother and was given a song and dance by their staff about how they were willing to work with me when I got back on my feet. Unfortunately when I got back on my feet and contacted their agents to try and work towards a resolution to get caught back up I was told that there are no options and that I needed to reinstate the entire past due amount. I did not believe this information was correct and when the VA contacted me about the past due payments they told me that the bank should be working with me and allowing me access to the government programs that are available to distressed borrowers with VA loans. This has not happened. My hardship is resolved and I have had a significant change in financial circumstances but Veterans United turns a blind eye and starts the foreclosure process against me. I believe that Veterans United is engaging in unethical servicing practices.

I have worked as a XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX for 19 years and purchased my home with a VA loan in XXXX. Later that year I got very sick from XXXX and missed a month of work, and several months later same thing happened, XXXX  XXXX and a month out of work. When that hardship happened, the bank worked with me and offered me a one year forbearance as required by the government CARES act for VA loans. Once I was back on my feet and financially sound I was offered a modification that put the past due payments back into the balance of the loan and dropped the payment {$200.00}. I made the modified payment as agreed for several months. Then my mothers XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX became dramatically worse, she was hospitalized multiple times for XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX  XXXX etc. I was my Moms primary caregiver and had to miss a lot of time from work between late XX/XX/XXXX through XXXX when she passed away. It was a mess, my income dropped about 60 % during that time because I had to help take care of her, then put her in hospice and ended up having to help pay the funeral expenses and take time off to settle her affairs. I had contacted the bank during this process to let them know what was going on and explain why I had fallen behind on the payments. As I stated, their agents were initially supportive. I would check in probably once a month with updates on the situation and was told that they would work with me. When I was back on my feet in XXXX I contacted their agents to tell them I was back on my feet and ready to resume payments or be considered for loss mitigation options and was rudely told, sorry, there are no options other than bringing in XXXX XXXX as a down payment and if you cant make that payment this is going to lead to foreclosure.

Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally file a complaint regarding persistent harassment by XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, and their now-hired debt collector, Stillman Law Office XXXX I have been contacted by these entities in relation to an account that is not mine, and their actions are in violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ). 

On XX/XX/year>, I made a formal request for proof that I owe the debt they claim, specifically asking for documentation with my signature showing that I signed an agreement related to the alleged debt. To date, I have not received any such documentation. Despite my clear request, the company has failed to provide evidence that I am responsible for this debt, continuing to harass me with calls, letters, and now, the involvement of Stillman Law Office. 

Furthermore, I have made it very clear to these entities that I do not want my personal information shared with third parties. Nevertheless, they have gone ahead and shared my personal information, including my Social Security number, with another company, violating my explicit request to remove and cease the sharing of my data. 

This situation has caused me significant distress, and I believe that their actions are in violation of the FCRA, as well as other consumer protection laws. Specifically, their failure to provide valid proof of debt and the unauthorized sharing of my personal information are clear violations of my rights. 

I request that the CFPB investigate these practices immediately, and help ensure that these companies cease and desist their unlawful actions. I would appreciate your guidance in resolving this matter as quickly as possible.
Company: Stillman, P.C. d.b.a. Stillman Law Office

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I recently received a debt collection notice from your office. I am writing to verify that you have contacted the correct individual and to request that you provide documentation confirming this.

Please supply me with a copy of any contract or agreement signed with your company or the original creditor.

In accordance with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I request the following information : 1. The name and address of the original creditor and the current creditor.

2. Verification of the debt amount you are seeking to collect, including evidence that a contract exists creating the amount you claim is owed.

3. Documentation of all assignments showing the transfer of the debt from the original creditor to the current creditor.

4. Proof that the original creditor securitized the debt.

5. Documentation showing the assignments of the debt from the original creditor to the secured trust and then back to the original creditor.

Please cease and desist from collecting on this debt until you have provided validation of the debt.

Additionally, I request that you do not access my credit report or report anything to my credit bureaus. I dispute the validity of this debt amount, and this dispute should be reflected on my credit report if you have already reported this debt.

Permissible Purpose Please state your permissible purpose for accessing my credit information. I dispute your right to do so.

Notification to Other Collectors I dispute that I owe this debt to you. Should you transfer this debt to another collector, please inform them of my dispute regarding the validity of this debt. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

I contacted each CRA and was informed that their records were correct. They declined to substantiate the claim and informed me I could file a fraud report if I WISHED, but they could not help me ANY further!

I submitted IN WRITING a Validation request under the FCRA title 611. This request was ignored by the creditors in question. When I called back and demanded to speak to a supervisor to find out the status of the Validation demand that I had filed, I was informed by a person who stated that HE was a supervisor, but refused to provide me with his operator number or extension, that THEY were not required by the FCRA to provide any VALIDATION information for inquiries, even if it could be Identity Theft.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Follow-Up Complaint Regarding Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC To Whom It May Concern, I am submitting this follow-up complaint regarding Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC for inaccurate reporting of a debt on my credit report, resulting in significant damage to my financial reputation and credit score. While I appreciate that Jefferson Capital Systems has terminated collection efforts and requested deletion of the tradeline, this error has caused me quantifiable financial and emotional harm.

Basis for My Claim for Monetary Damages : 1. Reporting Inaccurate Information : Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC unlawfully reported a debt that they have now admitted to be invalid, as evidenced by their response stating they terminated collection and requested deletion.

2. Impact on My Credit Report : The inaccurate tradeline caused a significant decrease in my credit score, leading to : Denial of credit opportunities. 
Higher interest rates on existing or new financial obligations. 
Emotional distress and time spent disputing this inaccurate information.

3. Negligence and FCRA Violation : Under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), creditors and collection agencies are required to ensure accurate reporting. The failure to validate the debt before reporting it constitutes negligence, and I believe I am entitled to monetary compensation for damages resulting from this unlawful action.

Relief Sought : I am requesting Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC compensate me for the financial and emotional damages caused by this inaccurate reporting, in the amount of {$10000.00}. This amount reflects the harm to my creditworthiness, my financial opportunities, and the emotional stress incurred. 

I respectfully request that the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau investigate this matter further and assist me in securing fair compensation from Jefferson Capital Systems , LLC for their error and negligence. 

Thank you for your time and attention to this matter. Please let me know if additional documentation or clarification is needed to support my claim.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease
Sub-issue: Account reinstatement or redemption after repossession
Consumer complaint narrative:
I searched for an answer to my question but the results provide no clear answer. I am needing to know what the TEXAS state law or policy is for the LENGTH OF TIME a finance company must sell a car after they have repossessed it. Its been 5 months and Hyundai Motor Finance has not received the duplicate title and they have not sold the car.

Account No. : XXXX Due to the unexpected employment gap after a mass layoff, Hyundai Motor Finance repossessed my vehicle XXXX months ago but has yet to obtain a duplicate title or sell the car at a private auction. This delay prevents me from purchasing another vehicle unless I add the remaining {$18000.00} balance to the cost of the next car, with the potential of still owing a balance to Hyundai Motor Finance if the sale price falls short of the debt. XXXX has stated they can not provide a timeline for obtaining the title or completing the sale, leaving me with no clear resolution. If timely payment was required to avoid repossession, why is there no urgency to sell the repossessed vehicle? 

Vehicle : ( XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ). 

Since the repossession, Hyundai Motor Finance stated there is no clear date for the vehicle 's sale. The " Notice of Our Plan to Sell Property '' stated only that the vehicle would be sold " at a private sale sometime after XX/XX/XXXX, '' leaving the timeline indefinite. I have been told multiple times that the duplicate title was requested but it has never been received and no attempt to escalate and resolve the issue in a timely manner has been made. 

Hyundai Motor Finance did not offer assistance to accommodate my financial situation and would only accept full payment for the vehicle 's return. However, despite repossessing the vehicle, they have not sold it in a timely manner, which undermines the intended purpose of repossession. Per legal requirements, a sale must be " commercially reasonable, '' which is generally understood to mean within 90 days of repossession. As of XX/XX/XXXX, nothing has been done since XX/XX/XXXX. Per Hyundai Capital Americas company policy, and the contract with stakeholders and investors, Is 130 days without the car being sold and no ETA or sense of urgency, the standard way to business? 

This delay impacts my ability to obtain another vehicle. As long as the full balance on the repossessed XXXX XXXX remains unresolved, it will likely lead to rejection from lienholders if I attempt to finance a new or used car, effectively placing me in a position where I can not move forward without being financially disadvantaged. Additionally, I am working again. I could have resumed monthly payments during this time if Hyundai Motor Finance had permitted it, instead of declining partial payments.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I believed I had purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX in XXXX. I signed all the paperwork, made my down payment, secured insurance, and drove off in the car. However, when they submitted my application to the bank, the process became unusually lengthy. During this time, I repeatedly asked if the transaction was legitimate, as it began to feel like a scam. To make matters worse, they charged me more than we had originally agreed upon. 

When the bank did not approve the loan, the dealership ran my credit multiple times without my consent. They then pressured me into signing a new contract but refused to provide me with a copy. Meanwhile, they put me in a rental vehicle, claiming they needed to " fix '' the XXXX. When I returned, they demanded a larger deposit and instructed me to provide inaccurate information to the bank. I refused to lie or engage in fraudulent practices. 

I repeatedly asked for a refund or to return the vehicle, but they refused, stating I was already the registered owner with the XXXX and owed them {$10000.00}. At that point, I was unclear about what I was being charged for. I constantly felt uneasy, worried they might repossess the car over this mysterious debt. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after consulting with the new bank and correcting the inaccurate information, I ultimately decided to return the vehicle. Multiple banks and financial advisors had warned me against continuing business with this dealership. Despite returning the car, I left with no refund, no vehicle, and multiple unauthorized credit inquiries that I never agreed to or approved.

Consumer complaint narrative:
A payment was posted to my Chase Freedom account on XX/XX/year>. My balance due on the app reflected the payment until at least XX/XX/year>. In the intervening days I made significant personal and financial decisions based on the balance reflected on the app. Relying on the information provided on the app has caused me tremendous financial crisis, and immeasurable personal distress.

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Attempts to collect debt not owed
Consumer complaint narrative:
Violation of 15USC1681 Sec Act of 1933 EFT ACT Indenture trustee act Subject : **Dispute of Debt and Allegation of Identity Theft** Account Number : [ Your Account Number ] Reference Number : [ Any Reference Number ] Dear Amsher Collections, I am writing to dispute the debt you are attempting to collect and to formally notify you of an identity theft issue related to the above-referenced account. It has come to my attention that this debt is the result of fraud, and my personal information was obtained and used without my consent or authorization from XXXX. Not only does amsherr collections have my information but another third party without authorization also has my information illegally obtained and without my consent. See attached photo **Allegation of Identity Theft : ** Based on my records and investigation, I did not authorize the creation or use of this account. This is an act of identity theft, and I firmly believe that XXXX, or an unauthorized party, may have illegally disclosed my personal information to create this fraudulent account. As a result, I am contesting the legitimacy of this debt and its inclusion in my credit file. 

As provided under the **Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) **, 15 U.S.C. 1681, I am entitled to request that any fraudulent or disputed information be investigated and corrected in a timely manner. Furthermore, under **FCRA Section 605B** ( 15 U.S.C. 1681c-2 ), I am entitled to a block on my credit file of any information resulting from identity theft once I have reported it. 

Additionally, under the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) **, 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I have the right to dispute any debt, and as such, I am requesting that you cease any collection activity on this alleged debt until the issue of identity theft is fully investigated and resolved.

**Request for Action : ** 1. Please cease all attempts to collect on this debt until you provide valid documentation proving the legitimacy of this account.

2. I request that you provide all documentation and evidence showing how my personal information was obtained, and how this debt was allegedly incurred.

3. Please conduct a thorough investigation into this matter, in accordance with FCRA guidelines, and provide the results of your findings.

4. I also request that you notify the credit bureaus to remove this fraudulent information from my credit report if your investigation confirms that it was indeed the result of identity theft. 

XXXXCase Law and Legal Precedents : ** 1. **Bergen v. Credit Management , LP**, XXXX XXXX XXXX. XXXX XXXX ( E.D.N.Y. XXXX ) The court held that creditors and debt collectors have an obligation to cease collection efforts once fraud is reported. 
XXXX. XXXXJohnson v. Randstad North America*XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ) Courts have found that debt collectors must comply with the FDCPA 's requirements to cease collection efforts upon notice of a valid dispute. 
XXXX. **Kramer v. Credit Control Services , Inc.XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( S.D.N.Y. XXXX ) In this case, the court emphasized the obligation to investigate allegations of identity theft and address disputes in compliance with the FCRA. 

By law, you are required to conduct an investigation and respond to my dispute within 30 days, as per **FCRA 1681s-2 ( b ) ** and **FDCPA 1692g ( b ) **. Please take the necessary steps to resolve this matter promptly.

If you fail to resolve this dispute and continue collection activities on this fraudulent debt, I will be forced to take further legal action, which may include filing complaints with the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), and the state attorney general 's office. Additionally, I may pursue a lawsuit for violations of the FCRA and FDCPA.

I expect a written response to this letter within the next 30 days *Enclosures : - Copy of identity theft report ( if applicable ) - Copy of any relevant supporting documents or identification*
Company public response: Company believes it acted appropriately as authorized by contract or law

This issue further underscores the broader pattern of miscommunication and mishandling that has characterized my experience with Selene Finance. Consumer complaint narrative: I had XXXX pending charges from XXXX for {$150.00}. The first was from XX/XX/XXXX and the second was from XX/XX/XXXX. They were holds for incidentals from my 2 separate reservations I had at the hotel. On the XXXX, after I had checked out of the first stay and checked in for the second stay that I had booked and paid for separately, the {$150.00} hold fell off. I received a push notification from Cash App stating that it was released. However, after clicking on the notification my account balance was not reflecting that the funds had been returned to my available balance. It was still reading at something like {$8.00}. I brought this issue up with Cash App immediately in their chat support. I was basically told that I am crazy and that the amount had credited back despite my total amount not reflecting such. That customer service agent got tired of dealing with me and kept telling me that they have done everything that they can do for me and sent me back to the beginning of the line for the support chats. I was connected with another representative and they told me that I needed to get a hold of XXXX and get an invoice stating that there is a XXXX balance owed by me to the XXXX. Once that is received then they would be able to look into the matter farther. I have supplied the XXXX balance invoice as requested. As far as I am aware nothing has been done to further investigate this matter and it is being swept up under the rug as if it never happened. The XXXX {$150.00} hold from the XXXX from XX/XX/XXXX is still currently in pending status on my checking account with Cash App. I have questioned this in their Chat Support part of the app on several different occasions. Each time I have tried to address this as an issue I have been told that there is nothing they can do to investigate the matter farther until they receive a XXXX balance invoice from the XXXX. I get the invoice and submit it to Cash App through the chat support. At first I am told that the invoice I supplied that was emailed to me from the XXXX ( supplied screen shots to Cash App via chat support ) and at first they tried telling me that the invoice could not be accepted for this matter. After debating that with the support team on Cash App I was finally told that I must wait the entirety of 30 days before the {$150.00} is released. Once the 30 days have come and gone then they will, I guess, look into it more. This is after they had told me that it is not on them but the XXXX and that XXXX has to release the funds first. I explained to Cash App that the XXXX has assured me that both of the holds for {$150.00} were released a month ago and that there is nothing else that the XXXX can do. On XXXX I stayed at the Wyndham XXXX XXXX in Florida. On XX/XX/year>, I was asked if I wanted a Wyndham Rewards Card. I said " no '' and thought that was the end of the interaction with the staff member. 

When I returned from my trip, I found a letter from Barclay 's explaining that my application for the Wyndham Rewards Card was denied.

I did not apply for a Wyndham Rewards Card. I did not want to apply for a Wyndham Rewards Card. Someone on the staff at the Wyndham XXXX XXXX resort took my information and applied for a credit card without my authorization and without my knowledge. 

This is unacceptable. 

I am now trying to remove this from my credit reports, and having difficulty as no one at XXXX, XXXX, nor XXXX believe me that I did not apply for a credit card, but I didn't! 

Isn't this illegal? 

We are trying to repair our credit in order to buy a house and now I have this unauthorized hard credit inquiry on my report for two years because Wyndham and Barclays are forcing staff to push credit cards on guests and when they say no, they just apply for credit cards to boost their metrics anyway. 

Please help. Thank you.

Product: Money transfer, virtual currency, or money service
Issue: Trouble accessing funds in your mobile or digital wallet
Consumer complaint narrative:
**What Happened : ** On XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX, at XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX**, a {$2.00} payment was sent to me through Cash App. The payment failed, and I contacted Cash App Support for an explanation.

Initially, I was told the payment could not be completed because I had **exceeded the number of transactions permitted on my account**. I requested the following information multiple times : 1. **What are the specific transaction limits? ** 2. **When do these limits reset? ** 3. **How are these limits determined ( number of transactions or monetary amounts )? ** Despite my repeated efforts, Cash App Support refused to provide answers. They stated that they do not have access to this information and could not give me a **timeline** for when I would be able to receive payments again.

Adding to the confusion, I used Cash App **for the same event last year** with far more transactions and experienced **no issues** at that time. This raises questions about why limits are now being applied to my account without explanation.

The companys responses have been inconsistent. At one point, they suggested the issue might be with the **senders account**, despite earlier blaming my accounts limits. When I asked for clarification, I was told **no further details could be provided** and **no further action would be taken**.

-- - **Why This Is a Larger Issue : ** This is not just about the ** {$2.00} payment** ; its about our ability to continue using **Cash App as a trusted platform** to accept payments. If Cash App can withhold funds indefinitely without clear rules, limits, or timelines, it prevents us from using the service effectively for future transactions.

As a business, we rely on Cash App to process payments seamlessly for our customers. If this continues, we will be forced to stop using the platform and inform our customers that Cash App is unreliable for handling payments. 

-- - **Dates and Actions Taken : ** - XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX : ** {$2.00} payment failed. I contacted Cash App Support.

- Support stated the failure was due to transaction limits but refused to clarify what those limits are or when they reset.

- I repeatedly asked for transparency, resolution, or escalation to someone who could provide answers.

- Support gave conflicting information, suggesting the issue might be with the sender, without providing proof or guidance. 

**Amount Involved : ** {$2.00}. 

-- - **Actions Taken by Me : ** - Contacted Cash App Support through their in-app chat multiple times.

- Asked for clear details about the transaction limits and how they apply.

- Requested escalation to a manager, which led to no actionable resolution. 

-- - **Actions Taken by the Company : ** - Failed to provide transparency regarding limits on my account. 
- Gave inconsistent responses, initially blaming my account and later suggesting the sender was the issue. 
- Refused to provide a timeline for resolution or steps to avoid this issue in the future. 

This lack of transparency has made it impossible to rely on Cash App for payments. As a widely used platform, Cash App must provide clear and consistent rules so businesses and individuals can trust their service. Without this, we can not confidently use or recommend Cash App to our customers.

Product: Vehicle loan or lease

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> my vehicle was repossessed, I was told I would have to submit a cash only payment either via XXXX XXXX or a wire transfer and pay up through next month. Instead of reinstating the loan, I submitted a wire transfer on XX/XX/year> for the entirety of my loan plus the repossession costs and was told a repossession release would be submitted within XXXX business days. Upon the XXXX business days coming to pass I contacted the repossession company and was told that the release has not been filed and I would need to contact the back. After receiving multiple different telephone numbers to incorrect departments and multiple transfers I finally made it to the repossession department to be told they thought I submitted an ACH transfer and they were unaware it was a wire transfer so my release was on hold until XX/XX/year>. After providing the reference number for the wire transfer I was advised that the transfer type was updated and emailed for approval and my immediate release paperwork would be sent to the repossession company. Allowing time for the update to occur, I later contacted the repossession company back to inquire about the release and they advised that the release had now been sent but that the hold for XX/XX/year> was still incorrectly active so they are unable to return my vehicle to me despite XXXX bank no longer owning a lien on my vehicle and I would need to wait out the weekend and check back on Monday XX/XX/year> to see if the bank has finally filed the correct paperwork or not. These continued oversights and negligence on the paperwork XXXX employees are filing is producing a loss of wages and major inconveniences for my family including my children being unable to attend school as they are continuing to not correct their mistakes.

Wells Fargo is treating me like a minor, which is violate Equal Credit Opportunity Act, because I have the full capacity to contract with Wells Fargo. Wells Fargo is holding on to my security collateral and not processing it per my request. Which is in violation of the security agreement with Security Exchange Commission. Also, I have remove any Power of Attorney that I may have been given to Wells Fargo directly or indirectly, due to Wells Fargo not upholding their fiduciary duties, so they must honor my request and run my application & tender through the Federal Reserve. In good faith, I gave Wells Fargo value consideration with securities collateral and i am not receiving nothing in exchange is unacceptable Window. Wells Fargo, has NOT provided me with any legitimate or legal reason on how they can loose or take any financial lost with my securities collaterals, by honoring my request to access to my credit. Product: Prepaid card
Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint regarding Bank of Americas handling of my dispute involving unauthorized transactions on my account. Upon discovering multiple consecutive unauthorized transactions that ultimately drained my account to a XXXX balance, I promptly called the bank to dispute them. The representative informed me that the system required the disputes to be filed as separate claims. As a result, four claims were submitted for review.

Three of the claims were ruled in my favor, and the bank confirmed those transactions were unauthorized. However, the fourth claim was denied based on reasoning that is inconsistent with the findings of the other claims and unsupported by substantial evidence. The banks denial letter stated : No evidence of inconsistent or aggressive spending or high-velocity transactions associated with a compromised card. 
A pattern of transactions following card funding loads, pausing once the balance was used, and restarting after new funds were loadaed. 
The spending pattern appeared consistent between valid and disputed transactions. 
No failed PIN attempts were detected. 
These points fail to address the most critical and obvious inconsistency : three of the four claims found all the transactions in those claims to be fraudulent. The disputed transactions all occurred consecutively as part of the same fraudulent activity, draining my account to XXXX. If Bank of America determined those transactions were fraudulent, it is unreasonable to conclude that one was authorized without providing specific evidence to support that determination.XXXXAdditionally, the banks reliance on a lack of failed PIN attempts or " consistent spending patterns '' is flawed, particularly given the high levels of fraud during the XXXX pandemic, including unemployment-related fraud through XXXX. Criminals have become adept at accessing stolen personal informationsuch as mine, which has been compromised in previous data breaches, including the XXXX breachand using it to bypass traditional fraud detection methods. A lack of failed PIN attempts is not a strong argument when unemployment insurance fraud was rampant at that time. 

Despite my request for all investigation details, Bank of America only provided a generic list of transactions, including the date, time, merchant name, location, and amount, which is identical to what is available in my online banking statement. This does not meet the requirements of a thorough investigation under Regulation E.

Bank of America has failed to conduct a reasonable and thorough investigation into my claim, as required by federal law. Their basis for denying the fourth claim is fundamentally flawed, particularly given that three of the four claimsrepresenting parts of the same fraudulent activity involving consecutive transactionswere already found to be fraudulent. I respectfully request that the CFPB require Bank of America to : Reevaluate the denied claim based on a proper and transparent investigation. 
Provide all evidence and documentation used in their investigation, including any merchant logs or records, and a detailed explanation of their reasoning for deny this claim. ( Not just a list of transactions as found in an online statement, this is not sufficient ) Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Company public response: Company has responded to the consumer and the CFPB and chooses not to provide a public response

Consumer complaint narrative:
Violation of Federal Consumer Protection Laws and Request for Debt Validation I am filing this complaint against LVNV Funding LLC for violations of federal consumer protection laws under 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ), 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ), 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ), and 15 USC 1681-S2 ( 7 ) ( A ). Below, I outline my concerns and requests for corrective action. 

LVNV Funding LLC has contacted me through various channels, including emails, text messages, and phone calls, attempting to collect an alleged debt. I dispute owing any and all debts to LVNV Funding LLC and request proper validation of the debt. The company has failed to comply with federal laws and regulations in its communications and reporting practices. 

Violations and Issues Violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( b ) ( 5 ) : LVNV Funding LLC has failed to provide clear and conspicuous disclosure of the debt 's details, including the name of the original creditor and sufficient information to understand the nature of the alleged obligation. 

Violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( c ) ( 4 ) ( i ) : The company has not provided an itemized statement breaking down the alleged debt, including the principal, interest, fees, and other charges, making it impossible for me to assess its validity. 

Violation of 12 CFR 1006.34 ( d ) : Communications from LVNV Funding LLC have lacked proper validation information, which is required to be provided in initial or subsequent contacts under federal regulations.

Violation of 15 USC 1681-S2 ( 7 ) ( A ) : LVNV Funding LLC has furnished inaccurate or incomplete information to credit reporting agencies regarding the alleged debt without properly investigating disputes or ensuring accuracy.

In XXXX, I noticed an unfamiliar/unauthorized/unvalidated account on My XXXX credit report named " LVNV Funding LLC/Resurgent Capital Services '' XXXX On XX/XX/year>, I provided " LVNV Funding LLC/Resurgent Capital Services '' a notice containing the following : " Provide all of the following information and submit the appropriate forms and paperwork back to me along with the Affidavit signed in accordance with your 28 United States Code Section 1746 within thirty days from the date of your receipt of this request for validation and proof of claim : i. Alleged Name and Address of Creditor : ii. Name on File of alleged debtor : iii. Alleged Account Number : iv. Amount of alleged debt : v. Date that this alleged debt became payable : vi. Date of original charge off or delinquency : vii. Amount paid if debt was purchased : viii. Please attach a copy of any signed agreement debtor has made with debt collector, or other verifiable proof that debtor has a contractual obligation to pay debt collector ; ix. Furnish a copy of the original promissory note/agreement redacting my social security number to prevent identify theft and state that your client named above is the holder in due course of the note agreement and will produce the original for my own and a judges inspection should there be a trial to contest these matters ; x. Produce the account and general ledger statement showing the full accounting of the alleged obligation that you are now attempting to collect ; xi. Identify by name and address all persons, corporations, associations, or any other parties having an interest in legal proceedings regarding the alleged debt ; XXXX. Verify as a third party debt collector, you have not purchased evidence of the alleged debt and are proceeding with collection activity in the name of the original maker of the note ; xiii. Verify you know and understand that certain clauses in a contract of adhesion, such as a so-called forum selection clause, are unenforceable unless the party to whom the contract is extended could have rejected the clause without impunity ; xiv. Verify that you know and understand that contacting me again after receipt of this notice without providing procedurally proper validation of the debt constitutes the use of interstate communications in a scheme of fraud by advancing a writing, which you know is false with the intention that others rely on the written communication to their detriment a violation of your 18 United States Code Section 1341. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX and when you are attending school, your loans are deferred. Not in this case. So, I am contacting you about the debt you are trying to collect. You contacted me by phone on _________________. This letter is being sent to you under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act, 15 USC 1692g Sec. 809 ( a ) and ( b ), which states that you must supply the following information : Information About the Debt and the Creditor Within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing : The amount of the debt ; The name of the creditor to whom the debt is owed ; A statement that unless the consumer, within 30 days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector ; A statement that if the consumer notifies the debt collector in writing within the 30 days that the debt, or any portion thereof, is disputed, the debt collector will obtain verification of the debt or a copy of a judgment against the consumer and a copy of such verification or judgment will be mailed to the consumer by the debt collector ; and A statement that, upon the consumer 's written request within 30 days, the debt collector will provide the consumer with the name and address of the original creditor, if different from the current creditor. 

Information About the Amount and the Age of the Debt You must provide a complete accounting of the debt you claim I owe within 30 days of receiving this letter. This proof must include and is not limited to : The complete and signed contract for the debt obligation, which is the subject matter of this dispute ; An itemized breakdown of what you claim the money is owed for ; Explain and show me how you calculated the amount in dispute ; Provide me with copies of any documents, ledgers, spreadsheets, etc., that show that I agreed to pay the amount you claim that I owe ; Identify the original creditor ; Identify and accurately describe any third-party costs for which you are charging me and that you have included in the disputed amount along with a complete itemization of all such charges ; and Provide me with an affidavit that the Statute of Limitations has not expired on this account. 

Information About Your Authority to Collect This Debt Whether your firm has a debt collection license in my state. If not, explain why. If so, provide the date of the license, the name on the license, the license number, and the contact information of the agency that issued the permit and Whether you are contacting me from a location outside of my state and have a debt collection license from that location, including the license number and the contact information of the agency that issued the permit. 

I further dispute this debt and invoke my rights under the FDCPA and other applicable state laws. 

I request that you suspend all collection activities and that your agency provide me with clear and convincing evidence that I have a legal obligation to pay you and/or the original creditor for the amount in dispute. 

Please note : If you have reported invalidated and inaccurate information to any of the three major Credit Bureaus XXXX XXXX, XXXX, or XXXX ), said action might constitute fraud and disparagement of credit under both Federal and State Laws. Accordingly, if any invalidated or inaccurate negative mark is found on any of my credit reports by you ( or the third parties you represent ), demand is hereby made to remove such negative marks while this debt is disputed. 

Please respond to this request within 30 days of the date of this letter. I need your response to make an informed decision about the alleged debt. In addition to providing the above information, please let me know in writing if you are prepared to accept less than the debt you claim is owed. 

Sincerely, ______________________________ ___________________ XXXX XXXX XXXX

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
My credit report shows a reputed collection account XXXX at {$2800.00} with XXXX XXXX  with different opening dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities. I have never had an account with this company nor any record of any type of first notice of debt including rights to dispute from this company. And if I, by chance, even though I have no recollection nor tangible record, naively spoke with a representative of this company over the phone about this debt, I was not informed by that representative that I had a right to dispute this debt nor a specific timeframe to do so.

15 USC 1692g 809. Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents states that within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. Https : //www.merriam-webster.com/dictionary/receipt definition of the word receipt is- a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money ; proof, evidence. I have never signed nor received any type of acknowledgement receipt from a mailing service for any mail from this company. I am familiar with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Had I signed a receipt of notice for the proper and legal documentation from this company, I wouldve immediately responded asking for lawful verification of debt or copy of court ordered judgement well within the lawful 30 days allotted. After receiving my response letter with receipt, this company would have to legally cease from collection attempts and remove the account from my credit reports until their proof of verification is sent back to me. This company has reported to my credit reports without observing the FDCPA laws. My credit has been impacted adversely because of this companys irresponsibility. 

My credit reports also show that LVNV FUNDING has provided this alleged account with inaccurate information. The FCRA requires that all data reported from the credit reporting agencies, creditors, or furnishers on a consumer 's report be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY. This means no data can be reported that can't be legally PROVEN to be 100 % accurate. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. My XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit reports all show different open dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities for this same exact account. Therefore making this alleged account full of inaccuracies. 

This is erroneous and flawed reporting that is listed on my credit reports. Not only did LVNV FUNDING not follow lawful FDCPA communications protocol, but it has also broken FDCPA False or Misleading Representations protocol as well. A debt collector, in collecting a debt, may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. Specifically, a debt collector may not falsely represent the character, amount, or legal status of the debt, or of any services rendered, or compensation he or she may receive for collecting the debt. A debt collector may not communicate, or threaten to communicate, false credit information or information that should be known to be false, including not identifying disputed debts as such. Each of my XXXX credit reports show different information instead of them all showing the exact same information. This is considered a false and misleading representation that this company has submitted to the credit reporting agencies. 

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has begun to aggressively litigate companies who continuously violate consumer laws. According to consumerfinance.gov, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) took action against the nations two largest debt buyers and collectors for using deceptive tactics to collect bad debts. The Bureau found that XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX bought debts that were potentially inaccurate, lacking documentation, or unenforceable. Without verifying the debt, the companies collected payments by pressuring consumers with false statements and churning out lawsuits using robo-signed court documents. The CFPB has ordered the companies to overhaul their debt collection and litigation practices and to stop reselling debts to third parties. 
The CFPB found that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debts that they knew, or should have known, were inaccurate or could not legally be enforced based on contractual disclaimers, past practices of debt sellers, or consumer disputes. The companies also filed lawsuits against consumers without having the intent to prove many of the debts, winning the vast majority of the lawsuits by default when consumers failed to defend themselves. These practices violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the XXXX XXXX XXXX Reform and Consumer Protection Act. 

The website also stated that Encore and XXXX XXXX XXXX threatened and deceived consumers to collect on debts they should have known were inaccurate or had other problems, said CFPB XXXX XXXX XXXX. Now, the XXXX biggest debt buyers in the market must refund millions and overhaul their practices. We will continue to take action to protect consumers from illegal and obnoxious debt collection practices. 

Just as the CFPB took action against the above companies, I am asking the CFPB to take action against this company as well. Please help me get this account removed immediately and conduct an investigation on this company. As a consumer, Im publicly publishing this descriptive complaint on consumerfinance.gov so that others can learn from my experience and so that this government agency can use this information to help work with other violations and complaints from consumers regarding this company. It is not my duty to provide evidence that this alleged debt is not mine. It is the legal obligation of the debt collector to first prove or provide proof of evidence that they can lawfully collect on any alleged debt before a consumer challenges it, accurately report to the credit agencies, and follow all FCRA and FDCPA laws. As of today, they have been very unsuccessful to do so. 

C/O RESURGENT CAPITAL SERVICES XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX

I was notified of this and immediately came outside and objected to the repossession. I got into the driver seat of my vehicle demanding the tow truck operator release my vehicle and he refused. We sat in the parking lot of my daughter 's father 's house for the next 10+ hours while the tow truck operator called me obscene names and told passer-byers that I was a XXXX XXXX  debtor. The tow truck operator accessed my trunk and unhooked my battery so I had no heat for the entire 10 hour ordeal. He threw the property from my trunk onto the ground and XXXX  my daughter 's father when he came to ask the name of the tower 's company and who he was acting on behalf of. He constantly was lifting my vehicle and dropping it so that I was XXXX  around inside the car and only after speaking with an attorney who called XXXX XXXX 's main office was my vehicle released. During the ordeal I was unable to relieve myself properly without being able to leave my vehicle and had no choice but to relieve myself in my car. I was living out of my car at the time and this ordeal was extremely traumatic. The police were called upward 7 times but refused to intervene even after he assaulted my daughter 's father. XXXX XXXX should have to be held accountable for their actions and Exeter Finance was made aware of the incident - I was told that I would receive some sort of communication in return for my formal complaint and never did.

He was only responsible for paying the minimum interest free monthly amounts without consulting me about the purpose. Upon regaining my health in XXXX XXXX, I reviewed my finances and discovered these fraudulent charges. For the past eight months, I have sought their removal, but Chase has mishandled my case unlawfully. This has led to a drastic decline of approximately XXXX points in my credit score. As a principle, I refuse to be held accountable for unauthorized charges. Furthermore, my personal informationsocial security number, email, addresses, drivers license ID, and other private detailshas been compromised due to identity theft and data breaches over the last five years.

The second type of unauthorized charge comes from XXXX XXXX, amounting to roughly {$6000.00} for a rental I did not authorize. I never provided my credit card information for this purpose. XXXX XXXX XXXX, under the terms of my XXXX Subscription agreement, should have provided me with a free loaner or if the local dealers were out of loaners a rental of equal quality, due to a malfunction in my XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( most prestigious car they make ). Due to a serious XXXX XXXX malfunction, the car caused an accident. This could have led to catastrophic outcomes for me and nearly did for the traffic the car hit. Instead, XXXX improperly utilized my credit card, which they had no right to charge, to address XXXXXXXX XXXX significant mistake. The only way they could have obtained my credit card information would have been through illegal means. 

I have thoroughly reported my identity theft concerns to Identitytheft.gov, with reference number XXXX. Despite numerous attempts to rectify these issues with the merchants, Chase Bank, and the three major credit bureaus, I have yet to receive a satisfactory resolution.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/XXXX, I believed I had purchased a XXXX XXXX XXXX from XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX in XXXX. I signed all the paperwork, made my down payment, secured insurance, and drove off in the car. However, when they submitted my application to the bank, the process became unusually lengthy. During this time, I repeatedly asked if the transaction was legitimate, as it began to feel like a scam. To make matters worse, they charged me more than we had originally agreed upon. 

When the bank did not approve the loan, the dealership ran my credit multiple times without my consent. They then pressured me into signing a new contract but refused to provide me with a copy. Meanwhile, they put me in a rental vehicle, claiming they needed to " fix '' the XXXX. When I returned, they demanded a larger deposit and instructed me to provide inaccurate information to the bank. I refused to lie or engage in fraudulent practices. 

I repeatedly asked for a refund or to return the vehicle, but they refused, stating I was already the registered owner with the DMV and owed them {$10000.00}. At that point, I was unclear about what I was being charged for. I constantly felt uneasy, worried they might repossess the car over this mysterious debt. 

On XX/XX/XXXX, after consulting with the new bank and correcting the inaccurate information, I ultimately decided to return the vehicle. Multiple banks and financial advisors had warned me against continuing business with this dealership. Despite returning the car, I left with no refund, no vehicle, and multiple unauthorized credit inquiries that I never agreed to or XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX : XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/XXXX XXXX XXXX  : XX/XX/XXXX, XXXXapproved.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Re : Account number XXXX Dear collection agent, I took a look at my credit report and saw a collection from you reporting on my credit. I am unaware of this debt and why it's even on my credit report. So therefore as allowed under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), I am requesting that you allow me to validate the alleged debt. I am aware based on what you are reporting that there is a debt from ( name of hospital/doctor ), but I am unaware of the amount due since there is no breakdown of any fees. 
Additionally, I am allowed under the Health Insurance Portability and Accountability Act ( XXXX ) to protect my privacy and medical records from third parties. I do not recall giving permission to [ name of provider ] for them to release my medical information to a third party. I am aware that the XXXX does allow for limited information about me but anything more is to only be revealed with the patient 's authorization. 
Therefore my request is twofold-validation of debt and HIPAA authorization XXXX 
Please provide a breakdown of fees including any collection costs and medical charges. Provide a copy of my signature with the provider of service to release my medical Information to you. 
Cease any credit bureau reporting until the debt has been validated by me. 
Please send this information lo my address listed above and accept this letter, sent certified mail, as my formal debt validation request, which I am allowed under the FDCPA. Please note that withholding the information you received from any medical provider in an attempt to be XXXX compliant can be a violation of the FDCPA because you will be deceiving me after my written request. I request full documentation of what you received from the provider of service In connection with this alleged debt. 
Additionally, any reporting of this debt to the credit bureaus prior to allowing me to valldate it XXXX be a violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act, which can allow me to seek damages from a collection agent. I will await your reply with the above requested proof. Upon receiving it, I will correspond back by certified.

Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to formally dispute the collection account reported by Jefferson Capital Systems LLC on my credit report. This letter serves as a complaint regarding their violation of my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) and other applicable consumer protection laws. I also request immediate investigation and removal of this erroneous account, as it is damaging my credit and causing undue hardship. According to the FCRA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 ), Jefferson Capital Systems LLC is obligated to ensure that any information they furnish to credit reporting agencies is accurate and verifiable. In this case, they have failed to meet these requirements.

Failure to Provide Adequate Debt Validation ( 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ) ) I have the right to request proper validation of the alleged debt, which includes : Proof of the original creditors name and the chain of ownership of the debt.

Documentation of the original signed agreement proving I owe this debt.

Evidence that Jefferson Capital Systems LLC has the authority to collect in Ohio while attempting to enforce this debt in New York. 
Simply providing a billing statement does not meet the standards of validation under federal law. This has been upheld in XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXX/XX/XXXX ), where the court held that billing statements alone are insufficient validation of a debt. 

Jefferson Capital Systems LLC is required to ensure the maximum accuracy of the information they report. Failure to validate the debt renders the account unverifiable, making their reporting a violation of the FCRA. As per XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX ), unverifiable debts can not be reported. 

Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), debt collectors must have proper authorization to collect debts. Jefferson Capital Systems LLC has failed to provide proof that they are authorized to collect this debt in New York while I reside in Ohio. Their actions constitute misleading and deceptive practices in violation of 1692e of the FDCPA. Moreover, collection actions across state lines without proper licensing may violate XXXX XXXX and XXXX consumer protection statutes, which require out-of-state collectors to meet specific legal requirements before pursuing debts.

I believe my account with Chase has been compromised and attempted fraud has been committed. I want an investigation into the matter. I want to see if the actual check has any signs of alteration. I want my money back as soon as possible and I want Chase bank to be fined for negligence on attempted fraud.

Product: Debt collection
Sub-issue: Didn't receive notice of right to dispute
Consumer complaint narrative:
My credit report shows a reputed collection account XXXX at {$1900.00} with JEFFERSON CAPITAL with different opening dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities. I have never had an account with this company nor any record of any type of first notice of debt including rights to dispute from this company. And if I, by chance, even though I have no recollection nor tangible record, naively spoke with a representative of this company over the phone about this debt, I was not informed by that representative that I had a right to dispute this debt nor a specific timeframe to do so. 

15 USC 1692g 809. Validation of debts ( a ) Notice of debt ; contents states that within five days after the initial communication with a consumer in connection with the collection of any debt, a debt collector shall, unless the following information is contained in the initial communication or the consumer has paid the debt, send the consumer a written notice containing ( 3 ) a statement that unless the consumer, within thirty days after receipt of the notice, disputes the validity of the debt, or any portion thereof, the debt will be assumed to be valid by the debt collector. XXXX XXXX XXXX definition of the word receipt is- a writing acknowledging the receiving of goods or money ; proof, evidence. I have never signed nor received any type of acknowledgement receipt from a mailing service for any mail from this company. I am familiar with the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Had I signed a receipt of notice for the proper and legal documentation from this company, XXXX wouldve immediately responded asking for lawful verification of debt or copy of court ordered judgement well within the lawful 30 days allotted. After receiving my response letter with receipt, this company would have to legally cease from collection attempts and remove the account from my credit reports until their proof of verification is sent back to me. This company has reported to my credit reports without observing the FDCPA laws. My credit has been impacted adversely because of this companys irresponsibility. 

My credit reports also show that JEFFERSON CAPITAL has provided this alleged account with inaccurate information. The FCRA requires that all data reported from the credit reporting agencies, creditors, or furnishers on a consumer 's report be 100 % ACCURATE, 100 % VERIFIABLE, and 100 % TIMELY. This means no data can be reported that can't be legally PROVEN to be 100 % accurate. 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( A ) ( 1 ) A person shall not furnish any information relating to a consumer to any consumer reporting agency if the person knows or has reasonable cause to believe that the information is inaccurate. My XXXX, XXXX, and XXXX credit reports all show different open dates, balances, first date of delinquency, balance due, and/or last date of activities for this same exact account. Therefore making this alleged account full of inaccuracies. 

This is erroneous and flawed reporting that is listed on my credit reports. Not only did JEFFERSON CAPITAL not follow lawful FDCPA communications protocol, but it has also broken FDCPA False or Misleading Representations protocol as well. A debt collector, in collecting a debt, may not use any false, deceptive, or misleading representation. Specifically, a debt collector may not falsely represent the character, amount, or legal status of the debt, or of any services rendered, or compensation he or she may receive for collecting the debt. A debt collector may not communicate, or threaten to communicate, false credit information or information that should be known to be false, including not identifying disputed debts as such. Each of my 3 credit reports show different information instead of them all showing the exact same information. This is considered a false and misleading representation that this company has submitted to the credit reporting agencies. 

The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) has begun to aggressively litigate companies who continuously violate consumer laws. According to consumerfinance.gov, the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) took action against the nations two largest debt buyers and collectors for using deceptive tactics to collect bad debts. The Bureau found that XXXX XXXX XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX bought debts that were potentially inaccurate, lacking documentation, or unenforceable. Without verifying the debt, the companies collected payments by pressuring consumers with false statements and churning out lawsuits using robo-signed court documents. The CFPB has ordered the companies to overhaul their debt collection and litigation practices and to stop reselling debts to third parties. 
The CFPB found that XXXX and XXXX XXXX XXXX attempted to collect debts that they knew, or should have known, were inaccurate or could not legally be enforced based on contractual disclaimers, past practices of debt sellers, or consumer disputes. The companies also filed lawsuits against consumers without having the intent to prove many of the debts, winning the vast majority of the lawsuits by default when consumers failed to defend themselves. These practices violated the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act and the Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act. 

The website also stated that XXXX  and XXXX XXXX XXXX threatened and deceived consumers to collect on debts they should have known were inaccurate or had other problems, said CFPB Director XXXX XXXX. Now, the two biggest debt buyers in the market must refund millions and overhaul their practices. We will continue to take action to protect consumers from illegal and obnoxious debt collection practices. 

Just as the CFPB took action against the above companies, I am asking the CFPB to take action against this company as well. Please help me get this account removed immediately and conduct an investigation on this company. As a consumer, Im publicly publishing this descriptive complaint on consumerfinance.gov so that others can learn from my experience and so that this government agency can use this information to help work with other violations and complaints from consumers regarding this company. It is not my duty to provide evidence that this alleged debt is not mine. It is the legal obligation of the debt collector to first prove or provide proof of evidence that they can lawfully collect on any alleged debt before a consumer challenges it, accurately report to the credit agencies, and follow all FCRA and FDCPA laws. As of today, they have been very unsuccessful to do so. 

JEFFERSON CAPITAL SYSTEMS XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX XXXX

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Unable to get your credit report or credit score
Sub-issue: Other problem getting your report or credit score
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am filing this complaint because I have been unable to access my free annual credit report through TransUnions website and mobile app, as well as being unable to file disputes on their platform. This has been an ongoing issue, and despite several attempts to log in and resolve the matter, I have been denied access to my account. 

XXXX XXXX : Attempts to Log In : I have tried multiple times to log in using my credentials, but I repeatedly receive error messages that prevent me from accessing my account. 
Customer Service : I have contacted TransUnions customer service, but no resolution was provided. [ Include specific dates, times, and the names of representatives if possible. ] Dispute Access Blocked : In addition to the login issue, I am unable to file disputes online, which is a violation of my rights under multiple consumer protection laws. 

Laws Potentially Violated : 1. Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) : TransUnion is violating my right to access my free annual credit report ( 15 U.S.C. 1681g ) and my right to dispute inaccurate information on my report ( 15 U.S.C. 1681i ). Their failure to allow me to dispute errors online also contradicts their obligation to maintain reasonable procedures to ensure accuracy ( 15 U.S.C. 1681e ).

2. Consumer Financial Protection Act ( CFPA ) : Under the CFPA, TransUnions actions could be considered unfair, deceptive, or abusive acts or practices ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 ). They are failing to provide me with the access I am entitled to under the law.

3. Federal Trade Commission Act ( FTC Act ) : By not providing access to my credit report and blocking my ability to dispute errors, TransUnion is engaging in potentially unfair or deceptive practices, which is prohibited under the FTC Act ( 15 U.S.C. 45 ).

4. Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act : TransUnions practices may violate UDAAP provisions ( 12 U.S.C. 5531 & 5536 ) by unfairly restricting access to credit report information and dispute processes.

5. Electronic Signatures in Global and National Commerce Act ( E-Sign Act ) : If TransUnion is providing electronic access to credit reports and disputes but not making them accessible to me, they may be violating the E-Sign Act ( 15 U.S.C. 7001 ).

6. Equal Credit Opportunity Act ( ECOA ) : By limiting my ability to access my credit report and dispute errors, TransUnion may be violating the ECOA ( 15 U.S.C. 1691 ) by potentially preventing me from accessing my credit history.

7. Fair and Accurate Credit Transactions Act ( FACTA ) : TransUnions actions may hinder my ability to monitor my credit for identity theft, violating my rights under FACTA ( 15 U.S.C. 1681m ).

Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX, TransUnion and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

Subject : Request for Deletion of Credit Report Dear XXXX XXXX, XXXX, TransUnion and all 3rd party unauthorized credit reporting agencies.

I am writing to formally request the deletion of my credit report due to multiple security breaches and the lack of any active lines of credit under my name. I have experienced five security breaches, including incidents involving XXXX, for which I have received settlements. Additionally, I was affected by a recent credit breach from XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

According to the data breach website, my Social Security number and personal information have been compromised by these companies. Given this information, my credit report should have been locked, and there should be no listings or open lines of credit. I have not had any credit accounts for over five years, and due to health issues, I am no longer driving, further reducing my need for credit. 

Furthermore, I request the immediate detection of my credit report to prevent any unauthorized access and the removal of my information from all third-party pre-approval lists. I believe that all three credit bureaus ( XXXX, XXXX, and TransUnion ) should have refrained from sharing my information without my consent.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear Sir/Madam, I am writing to dispute the reporting of a charge-off on my credit report for a JPMCB CARD account, which Chase Bank has reported as charged off with {$13000.00} written off. Their reporting is inaccurate and includes multiple misrepresentations regarding my payment history and the accounts status. 

Chase claims that I missed payments during XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX. However, this is factually incorrect, as Chase closed my account in XX/XX/XXXX. Despite this closure, Chase has continued to report alleged missed payments for months following the closure, which is a clear misrepresentation. Nowhere in their reporting do they acknowledge that they were the ones who unilaterally closed the account. This deliberate omission further undermines the accuracy and legitimacy of the reported information. 

Prior to XX/XX/XXXX, I made all my payments on time. My bank statements clearly show that all payments throughout XXXX and XX/XX/XXXX were made in full and on time. The absence of a payment for XX/XX/XXXX occurred only because Chase abruptly closed the account without providing me with any notice, documentation, or explanation for their actions. 

Chase has reported this debt as a charge-off and claimed a write-off for their tax purposes. However, they have not issued me a Form 1099-C, as required under 26 U.S.C. 6050P of the Internal Revenue Code for canceled debts exceeding {$600.00}. Their failure to issue this form calls into question whether the debt has truly been canceled and whether the charge-off was properly reported in compliance with the law. 

Violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act The continued reporting of alleged missed payments from XXXX to XX/XX/XXXX, despite the account being closed in XX/XX/XXXX, constitutes a serious violation of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ), which mandates that all furnished information must be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Chases actions have resulted in inaccurate and incomplete reporting, damaging my credit standing and requiring correction. 

Requested Actions I respectfully request that you investigate this matter thoroughly and take the following actions : XXXX. Verify Chases Reporting of Missed Payments : Require Chase to provide verifiable evidence of missed payments for XXXX, XXXX, and XX/XX/XXXX, given that the account was closed in XX/XX/XXXX. 
XXXX. Investigate the Account XXXX : Confirm that the account was closed by Chase in XX/XX/XXXX, and review their failure to disclose this closure in their reporting. 
XXXX Review the XXXX XXXX : Determine whether Chase has issued XXXX Form XXXX for the {$13000.00} charge-off. If not, this calls into question the legitimacy of the charge-off, and the notation should be removed from my credit report as unsubstantiated. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this case. It is highly appreciated as it is deeply disturbing.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Dear XXXX, I am writing to formally dispute the reporting of a charge-off on my credit report for an account listed with JPMCB CARD. This account has been reported as charged off with {$13000.00} written off, as reflected on my credit report. JPMCB ( contact information : XXXX, DE XXXX, phone : ( XXXX ) XXXX ) has reported this charge-off despite significant irregularities in their handling of my account. 

First, JPMCB closed my account abruptly and without notice in XX/XX/XXXX. This closure came as a complete surprise, as I had consistently maintained my account in good standing. A review of my payment history will show that I had no missed payments, and I had always paid my account responsibly. Despite this, JPMCB randomly decided to close my account without providing me any reasoning or documentation to explain their decision. 

Second, JPMCB has reported this account as a charge-off and appears to have claimed it as a write-off for their tax purposes, yet they have failed to issue me a Form 1099-C as required under 26 U.S.C. 6050P of the Internal Revenue Code. Creditors are obligated to issue a Form 1099-C when debts of {$600.00} or more are canceled, but JPMCB has not done so in this case. Additionally, in In re Reed, 492 B.R. 261 ( Bankr. E.D. Tenn. 2013 ), the court noted that the issuance of a Form 1099-C serves as evidence of a creditors intent to cancel a debt. The absence of this form raises questions about whether this debt was truly canceled or if the reporting is inaccurate.

This inconsistent reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( 15 U.S.C. 1681 et seq. ), which mandates that all information furnished to credit bureaus be accurate, complete, and verifiable. Without a Form 1099-C or proper explanation of the account closure and subsequent charge-off, the reporting from JPMCB can not be considered accurate or verifiable.

I respectfully request that you investigate this matter and take the following actions : 1. Verify whether JPMCB has issued a Form 1099-C in connection with this charge-off.

2. Investigate the account closure and confirm the accuracy of the charge-off reporting, given my history of timely payments.

3. If JPMCB has not issued a Form 1099-C or can not provide documentation justifying the account closure when payments were in good standing and no missed payments were on the account and charge-off, remove the charge-off notation from my credit report as it lacks proper verification and compliance with applicable laws. 

Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter.

Product: Credit card
Sub-product: General-purpose credit card or charge card
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am a customer/consumer of the financial institution Synchrony Bank and its subsidiaries/parents/affiliates/etc.

PRIVACY Title 15 U.S. Code 6801 states, It is the policy of the Congress that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect the privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information, and that the financial institution shall protect against unauthorized access to or use of such records or information which could result in substantial harm or inconvenience to any customer. Synchrony Bank is a financial institution by definition in this Title, and its failure to abide by privacy laws has both harmed and inconvenienced me. 

I provided opt out instructions to Synchrony Bank in XX/XX/year> via the online messaging center in my accounts portal. My instructions were not complied with, as evidenced by Attachments 1, 2, and 3, which are consumer reports showing my account information reported after my opt out notice. Synchrony Bank continued to report my personal information after receiving my opt out notice, which violated consumer privacy laws.

12 CFR 1016.7 ( h ) states, " A consumer may exercise the right to opt out at any time. I am now elaborating on my original instruction to eliminate ambiguity. Synchrony Bank does not have my consent to, and shall not, report, share, sell, give, or otherwise transfer my nonpublic personal information, from XX/XX/year>, to a non-affiliated third party or credit reporting agency. There should have been no furnishing of account information as of XX/XX/year>, and anything furnished as of the date is mandated to be removed ; inclusive of, but not limited to, balances, amounts, late payments, status, remarks, comments, highest balance, updated dates, last payment dates, etc. 

FAIR REPORTING Additionally, Synchrony Bank furnished information to credit reporting agencies while the account balance was still in dispute. Attachment XXXX shows the account was in dispute, still, as of XX/XX/year>, therefore, XXXX and XX/XX/year> information should not have been furnished. Furnishing information during those months was a violation of fair credit reporting 15 USC 1681s-2. Consequent to Synchrony Banks unlawful actions, I was denied when applying for a loan recently ( Attachment 5 ).

15 USC 1681n states, Any person who willfully fails to comply with any requirement imposed under this title with respect to any consumer is liable to that consumer in an amount equal to the sum of ( 1 ) ( A ) any actual damages sustained by the consumer as a result of the failure or damages of not less than {$100.00} and not more than {$1000.00}. Synchrony Bank owes me {$3000.00} in civil damages : {$2000.00} for furnishing information to XXXX for XXXX and XXXX, and {$1000.00} for furnishing information to XXXX for XXXX.
