Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative:
I am submitting this complaint because two debt collection agencies, WAYPOINT RESOURCE GROUP LLC at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, UT XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX at XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, MN XXXX are reporting the same alleged debt on my credit report. This is causing undue harm to my credit score and financial reputation. I have no contract, agreement, or business relationship with either agency, and neither agency has provided lawful validation of this debt despite my requests. 
Under the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ), 15 U.S.C. 1692g ( b ), I have the right to request validation of any alleged debt, and both agencies are legally obligated to cease collection activities, including reporting to credit bureaus, until they provide sufficient proof of the debt. Despite these requirements, both agencies continue to report this debt without validation. Additionally, this duplicate reporting violates the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ), 15 U.S.C. 1681s-2 ( b ), which mandates that furnishers of information, such as debt collectors, must ensure the accuracy of the information they report. The failure to verify or correct duplicate reporting constitutes an actionable violation of federal law. Furthermore, under XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ), inaccurate or misleading reporting that harms a consumers credit standing is a concrete injury. Both agencies actions have directly caused harm to my credit reputation, subjected me to potential denials of credit, and created unnecessary stress. " Congress plainly sought to curb the dissemination of false information by adopting procedures designed to decrease that risk. [ A ] n intangible harm, such as the risk of dissemination of inaccurate information, can satisfy the requirement of concreteness under Article III. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ). " The mere presence of an inaccuracy in an internal credit file, if it is not disclosed to a third party, does not amount to a concrete harm. However, the risk of dissemination of inaccurate information and actual disclosure can result in reputational harm that is cognizable. '' XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX ).

THE LAW CLEARLY STATES : ( a ) In general Subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency may furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : ( 1 ) In response to the order of a court having jurisdiction to issue such an order, a subpoena issued in connection with proceedings before a Federal grand jury, or a subpoena issued in accordance with section 5318 of title 31 or section 3486 of title 18.

( 2 ) In accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates.

*I DID NOT GIVE YOU PERMISSION TO FURNISH THESE ACCOUNTS AS LATE.

THE FAIR CREDIT REPORTING ACT PROTECTS ME AS A CONSUMER AND STATE THIS TYPE OF ( reporting ) is *EXCLUDED* FROM FURNISHING AND REPORTING.

( 2 ) Exclusions.Except as provided in paragraph ( 3 ), the term consumer report does not include ( A ) subject to section 1681s3 of this title, any ( i ) report containing information solely as to ( transactions or experiences ) between the consumer and the person making the report ; A LATE PAYMENT IS A TRANSACTIONAL EXPERIENCE BETWEEN MYSELF AND WHO I DO PRIVATE BUSINESS WITH.

*DELETE THE LATE PAYMENTS ON THE ACCOUNTS IMMEDIATELY.

*DO NOT DELETE THE ACCOUNTS.

Failure to respond satisfactorily with deletion of the above referenced account, and send out a free copy of my report after the changes have been made will result in legal actions being taken against your company, for which I will also be seeking {$1000.00} per violation for : 1. Consumer complaint narrative:
XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX are violating my rights under the Fair Credit Reporting Act. XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX are reporting adverse items on my XXXX XXXX account without my permission which is a direct violation of 15 USC 1681 C ( a ) ( 5 ) which states Except as authorized under subsection ( b ), no consumer reporting agency may make any consumer report containing any of the following items of information : Any other adverse item of information, other than records of convictions of crimes which antedates the report by more than seven years. is reporting late days on my credit report for this account. This reporting is clearly adverse and being reported without my permission, which is against the law. 15 U.S. Code 1681 ( e ) states, Every consumer reporting agency shall maintain reasonable procedures designed to avoid violations of section 1681 ( c ) of this title and to limit the furnishing of consumer reports to the purposes listed under section 1681 ( b ) of this title. XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX do not maintain reasonable procedures. 
Any and all consent to report adverse items by XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX and XXXX XXXX, whether it be verbal, non-verbal, written, implied or otherwise is revoked unless the reporting is paid as agreed or Current. 15 U.S.C. 6802 ( b ) ( c ) states that A financial institution may not disclose nonpublic personal information to a nonaffiliated third party unless-the consumer is given an explanation of how the consumer can exercise that nondisclosure option. XXXX XXXX never informed me of my right to exercise my nondisclosure option. 
According to the Fair Credit Reporting Act, XXXX XXXX XXXX section XXXX ( a ) states There is a need to ensure that consumer reporting agencies exercise their grave responsibilities with fairness, impartiality, and a respect for the consumers right to privacy. I am the consumer, and XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX are the reporting agencies and I have the right to make sure that my private information isnt shared and is backed by XXXX XXXX XXXX, It is the policy of the XXXX that each financial institution has an affirmative and continuing obligation to respect privacy of its customers and to protect the security and confidentiality of those customers nonpublic personal information. XXXX XXXX is a financial institution, by definition, under that title. XXXX XXXX XXXX section XXXX ( a ) section XXXX states that In general subject to subsection ( c ), any consumer reporting agency XXXX furnish a consumer report under the following circumstances and no other : in accordance with the written instructions of the consumer to whom it relates. XXXX XXXX, the financial institution, and XXXX, EQUIFAX and XXXX, the consumer reporting agencies, DO NOT have my consent to furnish adverse information and they surely DO NOT have my written consent.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of FCRA Violations Dear Equifax, I am writing to formally dispute the violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that I believe Equifax has committed. Specifically, I am referring to the provisions outlined under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which addresses civil liability for willful noncompliance. 

It has come to my attention that Equifax has willfully failed to comply with requirements imposed under the FCRA, resulting in damages to me as a consumer. As per the statute, I am entitled to seek damages for any actual harm sustained as a result of such failures, or statutory damages ranging from {$100.00} to {$1000.00}. 

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will be compelled to pursue further action, including filing a claim in small claims court or seeking arbitration. I hope to resolve this matter amicably and urge you to take this letter seriously. 

Please respond to this letter within 15 days, providing a detailed explanation of how you intend to rectify these violations. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Issue: Problem with a company's investigation into an existing problem
Sub-issue: Their investigation did not fix an error on your report
Consumer complaint narrative:
Bridgecrest formerly XXXX who I appreciate for giving me a auto loan is continuing to report my loan incorrectly. 

I understand that I didnt have perfect payment history and struggled towards the end but Bridgecrest billing wasnt 100 % perfect themself with problems with the ACH autopayments that I didnt set up and I wasnt getting alerts or notification that would explain that even though I made payment on time there was another system or platform ( XXXX  ) managing my loan so while I was using Bridgecrest app to monitor my payments the other system ( XXXX XXXX ) was using ACH autopay caused a return payment on these ACH. Brightcreat app showed no autopay or alerts of return payment while XXXX app had it own system processing auto ACH that I didnt realize or wasnt alerted. I got charges a return payment fees even months I paid on time. I asked Bridgecrest to please not report my account in a negative way because the fact is I did pay off the loan early extra fees and all which means that Im not late on payments if the loan was paid early. Bridgecrest has no reason to report anything negative as the account was paid in full. I repeat. The account was paid in full early. 

False information is the documentation of the last payment that shows the account was paid closed followed by 60 days past due. I respect if Bridgrcreat feels the need to report the negative but they need to highlight and document my file accurately and fair. This is causing harm. The slight unnoticed remarks and missing information is what causing this to read as unsettled incomplete or negative. The missing information is 1. Last monthly payment. 2. Paid in full 3. Correct order of events with the last transaction and file payment paid in full. Period Thats it. No remarks after closed. What ever you put before is on Bridgecrest but please be honest with the final payment.

Issue: Problem with a purchase or transfer
Sub-issue: Card company isn't resolving a dispute about a purchase or transfer
Consumer complaint narrative:
After several requests for documentation used to deny my fraud claim, FISERV sent the attached single-page letter dated XX/XX/year>. 

As you can see, the information ( numbers ) pasted on the page are not explained or detailed in anyway and the assertion that funds were received by the intended financial institution XXXX XXXX with account ending XXXX not true. It is critical to note that some of the information is blacked out or redacted! 

Only in XX/XX/year> did FISERV reveal that it believes that I am responsible for the disputed transaction. Let me state again that I did not make the transaction and FISERV can not prove that I made the transaction by virtue of the fact that I did not make the transaction. I will not allow FISERV to call me a liar and steal my money.

Since I did not make the disputed transaction, who did? Because of FISERVs resistance to transparency, I suspect the transaction was committed by someone inside Money Network. Rather than addressing its internal fraud problem, FISERV seeks to absolve itself from responsibility by trying to pin the transaction on me with false allegations and ambiguous and incomplete communication. FISERVs denial tactics are insulting, disingenuous, and criminal.

Lastly FISERV invites me to call the number on the back of the card with questions. When I call this number all that I am told by the customer service representative is that my claim has been denied without further explanation. There is a complete disconnect between customer service ( in Georgia ) and Dispute Operations ( in Nebraska ).

Product: Debt collection
Issue: Took or threatened to take negative or legal action
Sub-issue: Threatened or suggested your credit would be damaged
Consumer complaint narrative:
PennyMac Loan Services , LLC Subject : **Dispute of Foreclosure Threat and Violation of Securities Fraud** Violation of SEC ACT OF 1934 SECURITIES FRAUD, VIOLATION OF INDENTURE TRUSTEE ACT AND EFT ACT I am writing to formally dispute the actions and threats of foreclosure associated with the above-referenced loan. I assert that you are in violation of the **Securities Exchange Act of 1934**, **Uniform Commercial Code ( UCC ) **, and the **Indenture Trustee Act**. Additionally, your actions may constitute **securities fraud**, as I am the sole owner of the property in question as both the assignor, assignee, mortgagor, and holder of the promissory note. Furthermore, I contend that the actions of your institution, including threats of foreclosure, are not legally supported by a valid lien or judgment as required under the law.

**Legal Violations and Claims : ** 1. **Securities Fraud under the Securities Exchange Act of 1934** : According to the **Securities Exchange Act of 1934**, securities fraud occurs when false or misleading representations are made in relation to the sale or transfer of securities. As the original holder and sole owner of the property in question, I dispute any claims that PennyMac Loan Services has a valid lien or ownership over my property. No lien has been recorded in the **UCC-11 system**, and under **UCC law**, any property not listed in the system has no established lien over it. Therefore, any attempt by your institution to claim ownership or threaten foreclosure on the grounds of an invalid or unrecorded lien is a clear violation of the law and constitutes securities fraud.

2. **Lack of Valid Lien** : As the holder of the promissory note and the sole owner of the property, I assert that **no lien** has been filed with the **UCC-11 system**. According to **UCC 9-312** and related statutes, a lien can only be perfected and enforceable if it is properly filed and recorded. Since there is no such lien, PennyMac Loan Services has no legal right to take any action against the property, including the initiation of foreclosure proceedings.

3. **Foreclosure Can not Be Reported or Threatened Without a Judgment** : As per established case law, foreclosure proceedings can not be initiated or threatened without a valid judgment. This principle is supported by several rulings, including **XXXX XXXX  XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX ( XXXX XXXX XXXX ), which held that foreclosure threats must be based on a court judgment and not merely on the assertion of an unsubstantiated debt. Moreover, the **Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) **, specifically **15 U.S.C. 1692e ( 5 ) **, prohibits any representation or threat to take actions that can not legally be taken, such as foreclosure without a valid judgment.

4. **Indenture Trustee Act Breach of Fiduciary Duty** : Under the **Indenture Trustee Act**, the trustee for any debt-servicing institution, including PennyMac Loan Services, has a fiduciary duty to act in the best interests of the borrower and to discharge all debts appropriately. By threatening foreclosure without the appropriate legal documentation, PennyMac Loan Services and their trustee have abandoned their fiduciary duty to ensure that the debt is properly managed and discharged.

5. **Fraudulent Banking Practices** : It is well-established under **12 U.S.C. 83** that banks are prohibited from lending money that does not actually exist, and it is illegal to record a deposit from the borrower as a loan extension, only to return the funds to the borrower under the guise of a loan. This practice is fraud, as it misrepresents the transaction and constitutes a false statement of credit extension. 

**Request for remedy** Given the legal violations outlined above, I am requesting the following actions from PennyMac Loan Services : 1. **Immediate Cease of All Foreclosure Threats** : PennyMac Loan Services must immediately stop any actions or threats related to foreclosure on the property until proper documentation of a valid lien is provided, or until a court judgment is entered in support of the claim.

2. **Removal of Any Foreclosure-Related Information from My Credit Report** : Any foreclosure-related information should be immediately removed from my credit report, as no legal basis for such actions exists.

3. **Provide Proof of Lien and Validity of Debt** : PennyMac Loan Services must provide proof of a recorded lien in the **UCC-11 system** and demonstrate that the debt is legally valid, and not subject to securities fraud or improper lending practices.

4. **Cease Harassment and Debt Collection Activities** : Any further attempts to collect this debt or harass me for payment must cease immediately until these matters are resolved in accordance with the law. 

**Conclusion** : I trust that PennyMac Loan Services will take immediate steps to address these serious legal issues. If this dispute is not resolved within 30 days, I will take further action, including filing complaints with the **Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ) **, the **Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ) **, and seek legal recourse through the appropriate state and federal courts. 

I look forward to your prompt response and a resolution to this matter.

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
This complaint is a continuum of complaint ID : XXXX. 

On XX/XX/year>, I conducted a transfer from an external account ( credit union ) to Chase, via my Chase checking account, in the amount of {$600.00}. I received a notice that the transfer would be remitted and available on XX/XX/year>. However, when viewing my balance on XX/XX/year>, I noticed that there was no hold pending or funds in my account from the transfer. 

I waited until XX/XX/year> and contacted Chase and was routed to their fraud department. The fraud department informed me that they were unable to verify the name on the external account. In addition, Chase Bank decided to delete the account from my list of external accounts, again. Lastly, Chase failed to inform me, in any manner, that the transaction of {$600.00} was in question by the bank. I asked for a reason why Chase did not contact me to at least verify any information or send me a letter, in addition to deleting the account from my list of external accounts. The representative informed me that the algorithm automatically deletes the account if it is unable to verify the account holder on the remittal side. I informed the representative that Chase 's failure to notify me of the transfer in question resulted in monetary consumer harm, as a credit card bill that I was anticipating paying was to be paid by all the funds from the transfer. As a result, I incurred a delinquent payment and interest fees due to the negligence of Chase. 

While informing the bank of their practice and how it monetarily affected me, I was told that the bank is allowed to do this per the disclosed terms and conditions. I informed the representative that while the bank may be abiding by the terms and conditions, it does not mean the bank 's practice is legal. I stated that the act of the bank is unfair, deceptive, and abusive, and has resulted, at least in my case, monetary harm.

However, since the bank referred me to the account disclosures and digital services agreement, I took a look at both documents. In reviewing the account disclosures, the bank states the following : " You acknowledge and agree that we may decline or prevent any or all transactions to or from your account, including refusing, freezing, reversing, delaying or returning any specific withdrawal, payment or transfer of funds to or from your account, or removing funds from your account to hold them pending investigation, including in one or more of the following circumstances : Your account is involved in any legal or administrative proceeding ; We receive conflicting information or instructions regarding account ownership, control, funds or activity ; We suspect that you may be the victim of a fraud, scam or nancial exploitation, even though you have authorized the transaction ( s ) ; We suspect that any transaction may involve illegal activity or may be fraudulent ; We are complying in our sole discretion with any federal, state or local law, rule or regulation, including federal asset control and sanction rules and anti-moneylaundering rules, or with our policies adopted to ensure that we comply with those laws, rules or regulations ; or We reasonably believe that doing so is necessary to avoid a loss or reduce risk to us. '' While the bank does state that it may decline any transaction, account disclosures fail to inform a reasonable consumer that if the bank is unable to verify a transaction, or must decline it, that the bank will completely delete the account from the consumer 's records, forcing them to go through the trial deposit and verification process again. The practice of Chase bank in continuously deleting my external account, at least twice, without notice of doing so or reason as to why, has resulted in an unfair, deceptive, and abuse practice to consumers, and presents unjust enrichment to the bank.

As a result, I have requested the bank contact me within two business days or face litigation, due to weakness in disclosures and the abusive, deceptive, and unfair practice done upon me. However, I will give the bank until close of business XXXX, XX/XX/year>, to properly rectify this issue by responding with a reason for the denial, a course of action to prevent this going forward, and the reimbursement of the fees I incurred from the negligence of Chase.

Consumer complaint narrative:
XX/XX/XXXX my attorney asked for correspondence to be sent to him as he was representing me. I was blocked from the account. In XXXX my attorney sent a letter to give me full access to the account. 

Selene rejected all negotiations and wer eready to foreclose. 

I found out in XXXX that I qualified for XXXX XXXX XXXX. 

I asked the lawyer to get my mortgage statment reinstated with my name and address. He said he still could not figure out why Selene had done that.

I called Selene no less than 30 times trying to get my name restored on the account. I finally get a manager who told me that the issue would be resolved and in fact he told me in all his years he had never seen the actual mortagee replaced with the lawyers name. The mailing address yes, but to have the names placed on the mortgage statement that he had never seen. 

The lawyer sent a cease and desist, Selene responded that it was dated XXXX and not vlaid, obviously the lawyer had a typo. He corrected it. Resent it and I confirmed it was recieved. 

I contimued to call until XXXX and each time I called I referenced the fact that the manager told me it would be resolved and when each rep checked they XXXX you are right and we are going to update notes and get this fixed. 

Finally on XX/XX/XXXX, the rep explained to me that they need a letter from the attorney. I said this is absolutely bonkers, a manager confirmed the letter was sent MONTHS ago and now you are only informing me.

I called my attorney who no longer represents me and he wa
s extremely agitated at Selene. He told me in all his years he had never seen such complete incompetence.

He sent the letter once again.

I again followed up with phones calls and and email and finally resorted to fiiling a complaint.

The first and only response I recieved essentailly made it look like I had a frvilous complaint and that I had been answered. It was completely comical because if you read the letter they are staing we responded to you on the same date as the letter dated as a repsonse to XXXX. 

It gets more comical. I think it was ABUNDANTLY clear my lawyer stopped representing me and with more than XXXX phones ( being conservative ). Since at least XX/XX/XXXX I have been attemtping to take over MY mortgage and have my name replaced on my account. 

Today, Saturday XX/XX/XXXX, I get a letter from Selene stating that I did not provide them with my lawyer contact information as I indicated I am representated by XXXX. They are stating that I did not provide them with suffficient information to contact him, meanwhile all the correpsondence ( monthly statements ) continue to be addresssed and sent to him as recent as XX/XX/XXXX. 

Further, XXXX XXXX, XXXX for a THIRD time my lawyer send a letter stating that he was no longer representing me. I have sent emails stating I am no longer represented by a lawyer. 

In your response, you stated that I was represented by a lawyer. That was the ecuase for not communicating with me, yet you had full permission from the lawyer months ago and if you check the file you will see I had permissions and spoke to reps no less than XXXX times.

In this recent complaint, after sending my response, I also made it crystal clear in bold, to portfolio Recovery Associates, after already receiving a cease and desist demand letter and debt verification letters in XX/XX/XXXX as mentioned in my complaint, I finished my response with, DO NOT CONTACT ME in any form to this alleged debt Portfolio recovery associates was already officially notified in a certified letters on XX/XX/XXXX and received per signature card as proof. Now with this recent complaint, Ive demanded this again as seen in attachments. Again, against my demand in both written and in this most recent complaint, continue to violate the Federal Fair Credit Reporting Act and my rights again. Im demanding the Department of consumer affairs take serious action against this company for violating my rights and the law again and again. As in past complaints and being fined XXXX  of dollars for this same behavior, portfolio recovery associates has not learned the law or stopped this unethical behavior and illegal business practices. Product: Debt collection
Consumer complaint narrative:
Resurgent Capital Services XX/XX/scrub>XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX RE : Cease and Desist Demand XXXX Account XXXX XXXX in XXXX Dear Resurgent Capital Services, This letter serves as a formal demand for you to immediately cease and desist ALL unwanted contact with me regarding the alleged debt identified as account number [ Account Number ]. Your persistent calls, threats, and harassing tactics are a blatant violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ) and my right to peace of mind. 
Furthermore, I dispute the validity of this debt and require immediate verification. Under the FDCPA, you are legally obligated to provide me with written documentation proving my legal obligation to repay this debt within XXXX days of your initial contact. This documentation must include, but is not limited to : A clear and detailed chain of assignment, outlining the complete history of ownership of this alleged debt since its origin. This includes the name and address of each entity that has owned the debt, along with the date and legal instrument for each transfer. 
Proof of a valid and enforceable contract between me and the original creditor, signed by all parties involved and detailing the specific terms and conditions of the debt. This includes the original loan agreement, any amendments, and all supporting documentation. 
While I am committed to responsibly addressing any legitimate debts I may owe, I can not engage in any discussions or negotiations until this information is fully validated. My dedication to fulfilling my financial obligations requires complete transparency and verification of every aspect of this alleged debt. 
However, should the debt be verified after receiving the requested documentation, I am open to discussing a fair and reasonable offer in compromise to settle the account. I am committed to resolving this matter quickly and responsibly, but only once the legitimacy of the debt is established. 
Be advised that continued harassment and failure to provide the requested documentation will result in immediate legal action. This may include, but is not limited to, filing a complaint with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Attorney General 's office, initiating a lawsuit for FDCPA violations, and seeking damages for the emotional distress and harassment I have endured. 
You are solely responsible for complying with this cease-and-desist demand. This includes stopping all phone calls, letters, text messages, emails, and any other forms of communication directed at me or any third party regarding this alleged debt. Your sole authorized method of contact is in writing, sent via certified mail to the address listed below. 
I reiterate, stop the harassment and provide the requested documentation immediately. Ignoring this demand will have serious consequences. I also emphasize my willingness to discuss a settlement once the debt is legitimately verified. 
Sincerely, XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX Resurgent Capital Services XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX  XXXX Cease-and-Desist and Debt Validation Failure Account Number : XXXX Reference Number : XXXX Dear Resurgent Capital Services, I am writing to notify you that the deadline for your response to my cease-and-desist and debt validation request has expired. As of today, you have failed to provide the required documentation proving the validity of the alleged debt and your legal authority to collect it. 
Your failure to provide validation constitutes a violation of the Fair Debt Collection Practices Act ( FDCPA ). Specifically, you have not : XXXX. Provided a complete and detailed Chain of Assignment/Title, showing all transfers of ownership of this debt from the original creditor to your organization. 
XXXX. Produced a signed agreement or contract proving the debt 's enforceability. 
XXXX. Demonstrated your legal authority to collect the alleged debt. 
Since you have failed to comply with your legal obligations, I consider this matter closed. Any further attempt to collect this debtincluding phone calls, letters, or reporting to credit bureauswill be treated as a willful violation of the FDCPA. Be advised that I will immediately pursue the following actions if such violations occur : XXXX. File complaints with the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau ( CFPB ), the Federal Trade Commission ( FTC ), and the XXXX XXXX Attorney XXXX XXXX. 
XXXX. Initiate legal proceedings to recover damages caused by your violations, including but not limited to emotional distress, statutory damages, and attorneys fees. 
This letter serves as final notice that I will not tolerate any further unlawful collection activity related to this matter. 
Sincerely,

Product: Checking or savings account
Sub-issue: Funds not handled or disbursed as instructed
Consumer complaint narrative:
I opened a small business account with Chase Bank on or about XX/XX/scrub> 2024, after receiving an unsolicited offer from Chase sent to my email address. I have been a customer of Chase and held a personal checking account at the time. I opened the account without problems spurred on by a bonus of {$300.00} to be awarded if I fulfilled certain requirements within 90 days. I was to be paid the bonus within 15 days of completion of the requirements.

Most importantly, the email offer provided a link within the email to take advantage of the offer. This is how I applied for the new small business account and qualified for the offer. The promotion code was included with the email and this was used in conjunction with the offer. I am a sole proprietor.

After I completed the requirements, I expected the {$300.00} bonus to be credited to my account as promised on XX/XX/scrub> 2024. It was not so I called on XX/XX/scrub> 2024, and sent along an email to correct the problem. At first I was told that I did not include the promo code and therefore was not eligible. I reiterated that I responded directly thru the email ad and that the promo code was used. I received a call on XX/XX/year>2024, from someone purporting to be from the executive division telling me that I would get my bonus and that a letter would follow. I never received any letter regarding this matter.

Worse, instead of getting {$300.00} as indicated in the offer, I only received {$220.00}. I called and emailed yet again to determine the problem and was told that since I was subject to backup withholding the money was taken out and sent to the IRS and that I should file for a refund.

I never stated that I was subject to backup withholding and Chase had no right to assume this. It seems that Chase lost the entire application and is making up facts as time goes on. First Chase states I did not use the promo code when I did use the promo code and now it tells me that I am subject to backup withholding when I am not. Chase is unable to manage its paperwork and back office functions.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Prior i emailed regarding getting assistance with car payment because an emergency happened. 

Now fast forward, Having the jeep a year payments weren't made towards the car note payment, but paid to have my jeep fixed. I have been reaching out to the dealership to schedule appointments, regarding concerns i was having with the vehicle, to my prevail I was and continually getting the run around. Now the jeep has been repossessed. 

When i went into the dealership, XXXX as I was advised, i was told If i can find my own mechanic, then i can continue to go to my own mechanic and long as i produced reciepts of what I have fixed, then what Stellantis Financial would deduct from that, and then send me the title. 

That hasn't happened, I still don't have the title, the vehicle is currently At XXXX XXXX and Stellantis is giving me until XX/XX/XXXX to pay XXXX. Now when I log into my credit reports, what Stellantis is saying I owe and behind on to retrieve the vehicle, does not say that on my credit report. 

All I want is my title at this point. On my credit report it shows 60 days past due, of only XXXX dollars. I have an appointment scheduled to have the radar replaced, but not my vehicle to have it replaced. Everytime I catch Stellantis in a lie, they do something to my account, now I can't even login to view my statement for XXXX. Last i did check it only showed past due of XXXX. 

I have had it with this company from not receiving any help from dealership on fixing the vehicle, from the issues I have with the vehicle, to just everything. 

As a consumer, I rather put my car note payment towards having a working vehicle, rather than paying a car note on a vehicle that was going out on me and at that time only had it 7 months. now its been a year, 1 year XX/XX/XXXX and im going through XXXX and back getting my title. I present reciepts, no money taken off. Now its like their trying to charge me quadriple what I owe without deducting anything, and witholding my title, now their possible trying to sell the vehicle. 

I'm a XXXX XXXX, that goes to treatment 3x a week. I also work, go to school and take care of my mother who has progressive ms. Im not looking for sympathy or empathy, Im looking for my title to be sent to me. Getting the car fixed cost more, than what the car note payments were. 

I am still wanting to fix the jeep, long as I own it, i will no longer pay Stellantis another car note payment.

I really need my title. I even went as far as contacting a attorney to send a demand letter, Haven't been able to pay that, because of how high getting my jeep fixed costs. I really need some help on retrieval of my vehicle title and having my vehicle towed back to me.

I have emails and videos of issues i brought to their attention with getting no where.

They even locked me out from my online account and now I can't see anything. Pricing doesn't add up to whats on my credit file, accounts being locked after catching company in multiple lies just a bunch of scam stuff thats going on.

Consumer complaint narrative:
On XX/XX/year> I was charged {$1200.00} for bad service and parts.

My truck was broken down and parked in the rest area
.

The road service XXXX XXXX XXXX drove up to me on their own and offered to fix.

After my explanation about electrical issues, they PROMISED to fix the problem with the engine starting.

They found by their opinion that the starter is bad and offered to buy a NEW one and deliver to me.

They replaced it and nothing changed. The engine still couldn't start. The problem was not in the starter, but after payment they left and took my WORKING starter. I had to pay them by invoice, otherwise I would have had problems with them.

I took pictures of their starter just in case and the pictures helped me later.

I ordered the towing to the other shop, they fixed the electronic issue and I left the shop on my truck.

In the next 1-2 days, the starter started getting worse and worse. And I came to another shop to check the starter, I was already in other location.

The new technician showed me the scratches on the starter on my previous pictures and told me that the starter was already used before installation and it looks
like the starter was defective, XXXX, not original.

After removing the defective starter, he showed that it was painted in addition, and it didn't have the factory
sticker like original XXXX parts. 
After replacing, the new starter works perfect. 
I wasted a lot of time and money because of their bad service and parts. I have disputed that transaction and asked getting my money back. All invoices and pictures are available as a proof.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX invoice. The next shop found and fixed the electrical issue, that bad starter was getting worse.

Product: Prepaid card
Sub-issue: Trouble using the card to spend money in a store or online
Consumer complaint narrative: Equifax recently issued prepaid XXXX debit cards to people as part of their data breach settlement. I received one for a whopping {$7.00}. I went to the website and registered/verified my card information. A virtual prepaid debit card for such a low amount is next to useless, so I tried to add to my XXXX gift balance, as that is something you can usually do with prepaid debit cards. XXXX tried to process this but said it was declined. I was shocked that XXXX wouldn't accept a XXXX so I called the XXXX XXXX XXXX number and asked why it was declined by the largest online company in the world. I was told that this particular card is only accepted by select merchants, something that was not made clear in the card information ; he emailed me the list of merchants and it's true, XXXX was not included. It is a very narrow list of merchants that will accept this debit card. Also, if XXXX wanted to request this card be converted into a physical card - something that would be much easier to use - there is a {$3.00} fee. So a {$3.00} fee taken away from {$7.00} would make this worth {$4.00} if you got a physical card. So essentially, Equifax chose the most inconvenient method to XXXX out these payments. They purposefully chose to do this as prepaid debit cards to make it harder for people to actually use this money. That is a whole other scam onto itself and deserves its own lawsuit. Plenty of other companies involved in settlements like this very easily issue their payments via things like XXXX, XXXX, XXXX, even mailing physical checks. Those are all easy to use and they are very clearly options for these companies as it happens ALL THE TIME. I've gotten payments from multiple settlements before and all were easily done via those methods I mentioned before. Equifax very clearly chose to do it in this insidious manner because they know the vast majority of people receiving these " payments '' thru prepaid cards won't even use them because it's so inconvenient to do so. It is almost laughable the lengths to which Equifax will go to make sure people do not use this money. The fact that this is connected a lawsuit about a data breach that probably caused a lot of people grief and money is insane. It's an insult to everyone, and it is sickening that it's allowed to use these scam tactics to pretend to right any wrongs.

XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXX XX/XX/year> Equifax Information Services LLC XXXX XXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX XXXX XXXXXXXX Subject : Dispute of FCRA Violations Dear Equifax, I am writing to formally dispute the violations of the Fair Credit Reporting Act ( FCRA ) that I believe Equifax has committed. Specifically, I am referring to the provisions outlined under 15 U.S. Code 1681n, which addresses civil liability for willful noncompliance. 

It has come to my attention that Equifax has willfully failed to comply with requirements imposed under the FCRA, resulting in damages to me as a consumer. As per the statute, I am entitled to seek damages for any actual harm sustained as a result of such failures, or statutory damages ranging from {$100.00} to {$1000.00}. 

If this matter is not resolved promptly, I will be compelled to pursue further action, including filing a claim in small claims court or seeking arbitration. I hope to resolve this matter amicably and urge you to take this letter seriously. 

Please respond to this letter within 15 days, providing a detailed explanation of how you intend to rectify these violations. 

Sincerely,

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Sub-issue: Reporting company used your report improperly
Consumer complaint narrative: Equifax cost me over {$55000.00}, tens of hours fighting to resolve an identity fraud issue stemming from them leaking my personal data, and many more hours fighting with a credit card issuer. I have taken copious notes ( with dates and plenty of documentation ) to provide evidence of this. After I filed a formal claim with them, Equifax acknowledged their fault, and that my claim was valid. Yet, they have resorted to lying and unsavory business practices to avoid fairly compensating me. As per the terms of the Equifax Data Breach Settlement website, I was entitled to a maximum of {$20000.00} ( please note, this is *still* less than the amount that was charged to my SSN/credit report due to this fraud ). However, they stalled and avoided my requests for follow-ups over the course of *two* years. I submitted a claim in 2020, checked the website every month or so for status updates on my claim, immediately responded to a request for extra documentation ( which I obliged ), and then one day ( after two years ), they said that I missed a window to provide them an update. So they are claiming that they somehow emailed me an update with a time-sensitive deadline ( after which my claim was nullified ) -- yet I have zero record of this in my email and never received a letter. And now, somehow, when they had to legally pay me a claim ( they sent me < {$20.00}, after all of this ), they were able to contact me about it via email and letter to my apartment. I have wasted so much of my time, effort, energy, and stress on this -- and it turns out it was all for basically nothing, and Equifax won't ever be punished for it or obligated to make it right.

Product: Credit reporting or other personal consumer reports
Checking or savings account
Issue: Problem with a lender or other company charging your account
Consumer complaint narrative:
I arranged for my XXXX XXXX XXXX phone bill to be due on XX/XX/XXXX. I made a payment of {$100.00}, which posted on XX/XX/XXXX, and paid the remaining balance of {$7.00} on XX/XX/XXXX. However, on XXXX  morning, I received an alert that my account was overdrawn, and I began receiving notifications that other bills were bouncing due to insufficient funds. 
I first tried chatting with someone on the BMO banking app for assistance, but I was told to contact the merchant instead. When I spoke with the merchant, they couldn't see any hold on their end. I then visited a BMO bank branch in person to seek further answers. There, I was informed that the phone company had placed an unusually long hold on the payment but that I wasn't actually overdrawn ; my account was in good standing, and I should be able to pay the bills that were due. 

The next morning, despite these assurances, I continued to receive notifications of bounced payments due to insufficient funds. I returned to the bank to seek some form of remedy for an issue that was clearly not my fault. I was told there was nothing that could be done and that the hold would be dropped today, XX/XX/year>. As of this morning, the hold has not been lifted from my account. 

I've already incurred a late fee on one of the balances that was rejected due to insufficient funds, even though the bank assured me this wouldn't happen. I explained to the bank that it doesn't make sense for them to allow any of hold when I have overdraft protection enabled on the account, and yet the hold caused me to overdraft. Now, I could potentially lose my business website because there aren't enough funds to cover the upcoming balance this week. 

I'm losing even more money due to accumulating late fees and lost privileges because of someone else 's error, and I'm not receiving any compensation or assistance for this issue. This situation has taken three days away from metime that should have been spent getting my startup off the ground.

Consumer complaint narrative:
Between XXXX 2022, I was using job hiring searches such as XXXX  and XXXX XXXX to find job listings. Having recently retired from XXXX  years of military service, I needed to find employment. 

One hiring agent reached out to me about a position, and agreed that we speak through their communication channel known as 'XXXX  '. This company had a website and all the inner workings as a legit company. It was a position where I'd work from home and they would provide all related equipment ( computer/headphones/mouse/etc ). Through dialogue thru the XXXX app, the company started sending checks to purchase required equipment on my own. Once deposit attempts were made, my bank, USAA, immediately shut down my account, and cut ties with me just as quickly. Any remaining funds in the account were immediately seized, as this account was linked to some bill payments. 

Several attempts were made to reach out to USAA reps ( who provided no information or reasoning ) to get some reconciliation on the matter. When I tried to open another checking account with another bank, they kept the deposit and froze the account citing there is a fraud alert on my name from another bank ( USAA ). A couple letters were written as well with little to no response. 

I reached out to the USAA CEO 's office and an rep called back in about a week saying that the matter was resolved, agreed that I had been frauded, and that there is no more issues with the matter. USAA, however, continues to refuse to bank with me ( to which i'm not concerned ) and the fraud alert still remains on my name and SSN.

Consumer complaint narrative:
I am writing to file a formal complaint regarding my unresolved issue with Citi Bank, which has negatively impacted my credit and financial stability. 

In XXXX, I fully paid off my Best Buy Citi credit card balance and requested a pay and delete letter to confirm the account was settled and removed from my credit report. Despite my request, Citi Bank never provided the requested letter. Shortly after making the payment, I received a collection letter from a third-party company, claiming I still owed a debt to Citi Bank XXXX Confused and concerned, I called Citi Bank immediately to address the situation and confirm my payment. They acknowledged my payment but again failed to provide written confirmation or documentation resolving the issue. 

The account remained on my credit report until XXXX, causing ongoing damage to my credit profile. When I reached out to Citi Bank again earlier this year, they only sent an email confirming the account closure but still did not provide the requested formal documentation. 

The lack of proper communication, follow-up, and accurate reporting on Citi Banks part has caused significant inconvenience and frustration. I request CFPBs assistance in ensuring Citi Bank provides the necessary documentation and investigates the mishandling of this situation, including their failure to follow through with the agreed pay and delete process and the erroneous collection notice I received. 

Thank you for your attention to this matter.

Consumer complaint narrative: On XX/XX/year> & XX/XX/year>, I applied for credit at Well Fargo application # XXXX. And I have been denied access to my credit according to Federal Reserve Act. Wells Fargo continue to mention that my approval is based upon other credits accounts, incomes qualification and what's on my consumer credit reports- which is clear discrimination. None of those factors shall not determine my access to credit, according to the Equal Credit Opportunity Act & the Federal Reserve Act. I gave my application along with Tender to obtain access to my credit, yet still denied. Wells Fargo is treating me like a minor, which is violate Equal Credit Opportunity Act, because I have the full capacity to contract with Wells Fargo. Wells Fargo is violate Security Exchange Commission Act, because in their indenture agreement with the SEC, it indicates that I can surrender a note collateral of debt securities in exchange for for payments. Wells Fargo is holding on to my security collateral and not processing it per my request. Which is in violation of the security agreement with Security Exchange Commission. Also, I have remove any Power of Attorney that I may have been given to Wells Fargo directly or indirectly, due to Wells Fargo not upholding their fiduciary duties, so they must honor my request and run my application & tender through the Federal Reserve. In good faith, I gave Wells Fargo value consideration with securities collateral and i am not receiving nothing in exchange is unacceptable Window. Wells Fargo, has NOT provided me with any legitimate or legal reason on how they can loose or take any financial lost with my securities collaterals, by honoring my request to access to my credit. Any security interest is mention in ALL their contracts & agreements. There is NO risk to Wells Fargo.
